Cardiovascular symptom reports

Male, 16 - 25 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
16 2021-05-25 chest pain, chest discomfort Presented as a pulled muscle in the left chest/lung area. No SOB, just pain and tightness in the ch... Read more
Close
Presented as a pulled muscle in the left chest/lung area. No SOB, just pain and tightness in the chest. Began after the second vaccine and occurred on and off for about 2-3 weeks.
17 2021-04-09 heart rate decreased, fainting, pallor The individual starts to show signs of anaphylaxis reaction some minutes after vaccination by the nu... Read more
Close
The individual starts to show signs of anaphylaxis reaction some minutes after vaccination by the nurse. Said"I am not feeling good." Upon assessment, the individual is leaning his head backwards, unable to read how many fingers I held up; complained "can't see"; slow in responding. The individuals appears to be losing consciousness; eyes closed. Color of face pale. HR: 47; Pusle Ox 95%. RR:16. BP 112/64. Epipen 1 dose administered L leg IM. 911 was called. Continue to monitor and check vital signs. BP 143/75, HR: 54 and pulse ox: 94%. At 0850:EMS arrived. VS remain stable. HR: 62; Pulse Ox 94%. The individual starts to open up his eyes and responding. Parents at his side. He is taken to the ER. Followed up with the patient's parent, mom and is stable and doing better.
17 2021-06-23 chest discomfort none initially - second day had fever, body aches and some chest tightness
18 2021-01-02 troponin increased, chest pain Tactile fever ,arm pain, headache and malaise in 24 hrs following injection Next day generalized ac... Read more
Close
Tactile fever ,arm pain, headache and malaise in 24 hrs following injection Next day generalized achiness ,retrosternal chest pain and bilateral forearm tingly pain similar to Nov 2019 and went to Hospital UC,CXR and EKG normal but with short PR interval on EKG ,elevated troponin 3.5 Transferred to hospital troponin 12.1 ng/ml IVIG given SARS IGG positive on admission PCR negative
18 2021-01-15 fast heart rate I had tachycardia and was hyperventaliting. I was seen in the ED.
18 2021-01-17 inflammation of the heart muscle Myocarditis; A spontaneous report was received from a physician, concerning a 18-year-old, male pati... Read more
Close
Myocarditis; A spontaneous report was received from a physician, concerning a 18-year-old, male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced myocarditis. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 30 Dec 2020, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot number: 037K20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 31 Dec 2020, within 24 hours of vaccine administration, the patient develop symptoms of myocarditis and was admitted to the hospital. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported. The outcome for the event, myocarditis, was not reported.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns an 18-year-old, male, who experienced a serious unexpected event of myocarditis. The event occurred approximately 2 days after first dose of mRNA-1273, Lot# 037K20A administration. No information available regarding medical history and concomitant medications. Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Based on temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
18 2021-01-20 chest pain patient reports fever of 100.5, headache, cough, and chest pain. resolved in one day
18 2021-01-20 oxygen saturation decreased Change in voice and O2 SATs dropped- throat was closing
18 2021-02-24 pallor WITHIN 5 MINUTES OF VACCINE PATIENT FELT FAINT, LIKE HIS HEAD WAS SPINNING. BP WAS 80/40. PULSE WAS... Read more
Close
WITHIN 5 MINUTES OF VACCINE PATIENT FELT FAINT, LIKE HIS HEAD WAS SPINNING. BP WAS 80/40. PULSE WAS 42. BLOOD SUGAR WAS 125. VERY PALE, LIPS WERE PALE/BLUISH IN COLOR. HAD A DECREASED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS. SPO2 WAS 88%, OXYGEN WAS PLACED ON HIM. HE WAS TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITAL VIA EMS
18 2021-03-05 chest pain Developed fatigue, body aches, headache 1 day after vaccination on 3/3. The morning of 3/5 complaine... Read more
Close
Developed fatigue, body aches, headache 1 day after vaccination on 3/3. The morning of 3/5 complained of chest pain. Took Tylenol at 8:30 am. At 10:30 am his family found him unresponsive. EMS was called and he was pronounced dead in the home.
18 2021-03-07 fainting About 3 minutes after patient received immunization, he fainted and had a seizure. Patient was with... Read more
Close
About 3 minutes after patient received immunization, he fainted and had a seizure. Patient was with his parents and he told them he felt like he was going to faint, so his parents stabilized him before it happened. Patient seized for about 10 seconds and then came to alertness. He was made comfortable and given juice and a granola bar after a while because patient had not yet eaten this morning. I monitored patient for about 45 minutes before I felt patient was stable and feeling well enough to leave. Patient left with his parents monitoring him.
18 2021-03-08 fainting Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Additional Details... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Additional Details: Pt fainted in waiting area shortly after vaccine administration. Quickly became responsive, talkative, and aware. Had patient lie down, elevated feet, gave pt water and potato chips to increase salt intake/ raise bp. Monitored patient for additional 30 minutes. Pt indicated he was feeling much better and left with family members with instructions to monitor him and have pt rest for remainder of the day. Tried to follow up with patient on 3/9, but phone number was out of service.
18 2021-03-13 pallor At approximately 2 PM on Wednesday the 10th, I began to feel light headed, nauseous, and feverish. C... Read more
Close
At approximately 2 PM on Wednesday the 10th, I began to feel light headed, nauseous, and feverish. Color drained from my face and I also began to lose track of the conversation I was having. I couldn't keep up with the pace of the conversation and eventually realized I couldn't remember what we were talking about. Looking back on the event now, I could only remember what was happening for around. 2 minute span before I forgot it. After losing my ability to form new memories, I began to lose old ones. I would look through pictures and not recognize faces, listen to songs and not remember the artists, and lose entire gaps of my past. My parents described my memory loss as that of a concussion but, to be frank, I don't remember much of any of it. All of my past memories have returned, but I still have yet to regain my memory from 2 PM to 10 PM of that day.
18 2021-03-16 lightheadedness patient "saw black"and nearly passed out was grey, sweaty HR 39, BP 96/60 after a few minutes his c... Read more
Close
patient "saw black"and nearly passed out was grey, sweaty HR 39, BP 96/60 after a few minutes his color came back after vomiting x2 observed in tent, BP 136/78, HR 69
18 2021-03-17 chest discomfort Received first dose of Moderna vaccine today around 2:30 pm. Reports 2 minutes later, felt left side... Read more
Close
Received first dose of Moderna vaccine today around 2:30 pm. Reports 2 minutes later, felt left side of throat "swell" and was uncomfortable. Also felt mild chest discomfort. Symptoms resolved after about 3 minutes, so he finished his 15 minute observation time, and left the clinic. He returned approximately 15 mins later, and informed the ER MD here in the clinic that his throat swelling and tightness had returned and that he now had and some difficulty breathing. He was answering questions appropriately, appeared in no distress. At 1510 VS taken: BP 122/74, O2 sat 100%, P 73, RR 18. Skin color pink/normal. ER MD advised patient be taken to ER and he called report there. Patient was taken via WC right away to ER with MD, and RN and myself. Anaphylaxis kit brought. But not used. He was stable during transport. In ER he c/o more throat tightness, and it appeared that the left side of his neck was mildly swollen. He then c/o bilateral pedal numbness and also some difficulty breathing. Care was assumed by RN and report was given to her. He was able to call his parents prior and remained stable at the time we departed the ER. NP
18 2021-03-18 pallor After receiving vaccine, patient sat down for the 15 minute observation. He reports about 1-2 minute... Read more
Close
After receiving vaccine, patient sat down for the 15 minute observation. He reports about 1-2 minutes after sitting down feeling flushed, lightheaded. Patient's color pale. EMS on site and took over triage of patient. BP 83/50, P 58-60. Patient reported eating a bar before coming. His blood sugar 111. Patient was given water to drink. BP increased to 100/62, color returning, still pale. He reports feeling better. He stood and sat in a w/c to take to the stretcher for additional observation. Patient ate a pack of peanut butter crackers, drank 1 16.9 oz bottle water, color pink, BP 121/76. Patient says he drove from DIFFRENT STATE to receive his vaccine and is alone. Patient reports feeling better. He was instructed to walk around, he did so without any complications, color remained pink. He says he feels better. After additional 15 minute observation, he was checked out. I instructed if the symptoms come back to pull over and call 911, he verbalized understanding.
18 2021-03-24 loss of consciousness Lethargic, Nausea, Difficulty with hearing, decreased LOC and Blurry vision

Close
ABOUT 3 MINUTES AFTER RECEIVING COVID-19 MODERNA VACCINE CLIENT EXPERIENCED WHAT IT LOOKED LIKE SEIZURE ACTIVITY. ACCORDING TO MOTHER CLIENT WHO WAS SITTING ON A CHAIR FOR OBSERVATION POST VACCINATION, DROPPED HIS PHONE TO THE FLOOR AND RAISED BOTH OF HIS ARMS UP WITH PALMS OPENED AND STARTED TO SHAKE A LITTLE WITH EYES CLOSED. MOTHER ASKED FOR HELP. WHEN HELP ARRIAVED CLIENT WAS CONSCIOUS AND NO SEIZING ACTIVITY WAS WITNESS. CLIENT LOOKED PALE AND SWEATY.
18 2021-03-31 fainting, loss of consciousness patient passed out a few minutes after recieving his second moderna dose, he recovered quickly but o... Read more
Close
patient passed out a few minutes after recieving his second moderna dose, he recovered quickly but opted to be transported via ambulance to hospital and released with a diagnosis of syncope.
18 2021-04-01 pallor Pt reported feeling dizzy post vaccination. Staff responded. Pt presented pale and sweating profusel... Read more
Close
Pt reported feeling dizzy post vaccination. Staff responded. Pt presented pale and sweating profusely. VS: BP-84/59, HR- 64, RR-20. On-Site EMTs assessed patient. Pt transported to Medical Center for further evaluation. Mother of patient present.
18 2021-04-06 fainting, hypotension Per the NP: 1:20pm: While in observation, patient had an episode of syncope/ hypotension. It was u... Read more
Close
Per the NP: 1:20pm: While in observation, patient had an episode of syncope/ hypotension. It was unclear at the time if this was a reaction to the vaccination or not. Was treated immediately by NP and EMT/Paramedic staff. 911 was called and pt was transferred to the ER via monitored stretcher for further evaluation. Prior to leaving, and as pt was being transferred from one stretcher to the transport stretcher, pt experienced another syncopal episode. No arrhythmia noted on monitor, BP running 70's/50's. Awake, sluggish but oriented to person and place upon leaving. Transported via monitored stretcher to the ER.
18 2021-04-06 fainting 15:40 Patient stood up and walked to escort to be checked into Observation. Turned around and retur... Read more
Close
15:40 Patient stood up and walked to escort to be checked into Observation. Turned around and returned to nurse, stating " I don't feel good" and fainted. Patient assisted to chair then floor. Diaphoretic. EMS and NP immediately on site. Smelling salts waved under his nose and he abruptly woke up. He stated he has a fear of needles . Family member here with patient. 15:50 - BP 98/35; HR 53. Sats 98% on RA. Conversant with EMT's and nursing staff 15:52- drinking water, eating breakfast bar. States he feels better 15:55 BP 117/72; HR 78- R 20. Ready for discharge home @ 1605.
18 2021-04-07 loss of consciousness Patient passed out and fell over. He did not injure himself in the fall. Was out for 1-2 seconds. ... Read more
Close
Patient passed out and fell over. He did not injure himself in the fall. Was out for 1-2 seconds. Was a little light headed and weak as he sat in the chair, but was recovered after 15 minutes. Reported being nervous about needles and failed to eat/drink much earlier in the day.
18 2021-04-07 pallor After getting vaccinated. Patient felt dizzy and shortness of breath, parking team sat him down in w... Read more
Close
After getting vaccinated. Patient felt dizzy and shortness of breath, parking team sat him down in wheelchair. Medics responded, mouth feels dry. Feels a little light headed. HR 160, BP 130/85 at 9:30am. HR 151, BP 177/94 at 9:35am. Facial flushing. Loss of color in face. Transport to hospital.
18 2021-04-08 fainting dizziness/light headed, cold, clammy and sweating in face, fainted, then vomited. Occurred 4 hours a... Read more
Close
dizziness/light headed, cold, clammy and sweating in face, fainted, then vomited. Occurred 4 hours after shot was given.
18 2021-04-08 fainting Patient received vaccine in left arm and during waiting/observation period a few minutes later (whil... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine in left arm and during waiting/observation period a few minutes later (while sitting), he told the person near him he felt dizzy, and he fainted. He soon regained consciousness (within about a minute) and was observed/attended to. 911 was called immediately as a precaution, and paramedics monitored his vital signs slowly helped him into a chair. He drank some water and a little electrolyte drink. He did not want to seek hospital treatment, and paramedics left. He stated he was experiencing nausea while sitting in the chair, and said he started to feel like he was going to faint again. Again 911 was called and paramedics attended to him, but he did not faint again. After resting in a chair and drinking some more water and some electrolyte drink, as well as cold compresses on his forehead and the back of the neck, he was eventually escorted by two store employees on a motorized scooter cart to his parent's car and went with his parent home (he did not want to seek hospital treatment).
18 2021-04-10 fainting Patient received the vaccine and was instructed to sit for 15 minutes as required before leaving. Ab... Read more
Close
Patient received the vaccine and was instructed to sit for 15 minutes as required before leaving. About five to ten minutes to, we were alerted that the patient had fainted. Upon coming to the patient, he was starting to come to but was out of it. I tried asking the patient how he was feeling, is he having a hard time breathing? Patient's entire arms and legs were bright red with possible rashes that lasted about 5 minutes and went away quick. Patient's face remained their normal shade. Patient reported he fell asleep and patient's father reported waking the patient up prior to coming to get his vaccine. Patient sat at the pharmacy to be monitored for an addition 30 minutes before leaving with father. Patient was given water and fan to help cool him down. Patient reported feeling ok after about 10 minutes with legs elevated but was instructed to sit for longer than that time. Patient was ok to leave with father after 30+ minutes of monitoring.
18 2021-04-11 fainting, pallor About 10 minutes after the vaccine, the patient was standing in front of the pharmacy with his mom a... Read more
Close
About 10 minutes after the vaccine, the patient was standing in front of the pharmacy with his mom and fainted. He landed on his buttocks and did not appear to hit his head. He immediately appeared conscious but disoriented. He had a steady pulse and no itching or rash or trouble breathing, but he seemed pale. EMT was called and upon evaluation determined that he did not need further treatment. The patient went home with his mother.
18 2021-04-12 chest pain, pallor Patient called today, received the vaccine at a pharmacy, at 11 am. At 10pm now feeling like he can... Read more
Close
Patient called today, received the vaccine at a pharmacy, at 11 am. At 10pm now feeling like he cannot swallow, pale, chest pain, irritated throat. Was dispositioned by On call Provider Dr to seen medical care in the ED.
18 2021-04-13 lightheadedness Near syncopal episode. Patient was layed down on cot and vital signs were taken and within normal li... Read more
Close
Near syncopal episode. Patient was layed down on cot and vital signs were taken and within normal limits.
18 2021-04-14 lightheadedness This patient had some dizziness after the shot and was apprehensive in receiving it. He claimed he f... Read more
Close
This patient had some dizziness after the shot and was apprehensive in receiving it. He claimed he felt dizzy and in seconds had slumped off of his chair. He was unresponsive for a few seconds only about 5-10 seconds and we gave him an IM Benadryl as a precaution. He awoke complaining of a funny feeling in the mouth and tongue but had no rash or redness or swelling to indicate an allergic reaction. We decide to monitor closely for an escalation of symptoms but to have a EpiPen handy, and call an EMT unit. His blood pressure was low at first at around 107/68 then quickly come up in about 10 minutes to 130/80. With no other issues we believe he had a vasovagal syncope but wanted the ER to make sure we were correct. I called and checked on him after he was at the ER. and the nurse stated that he was doing very well and that they had seen this happen with the vaccine at other site locations.
18 2021-04-15 chest pain "At 1400 patient in observation, RN vaccinator, noticed young man's head drooped over. RN went over ... Read more
Close
"At 1400 patient in observation, RN vaccinator, noticed young man's head drooped over. RN went over to the patients and tapped his arm. Did not respond to verbal or physical touch. RN called for help. After a few seconds patient responded and opened his eyes. Patient transferred via wheelchair to private area. BO 76/64, diaphoretic. RR appeared normal. Patient stated he did not eat all day. patient stated his throat hurt and felt tight and he had chest pain. Patient agreed to be transported via on-sight ambulance to Medical Center for assessment with brother."
18 2021-04-15 fainting Patient fainted about 5-10 minutes after receiving vaccine

Close
Syncope, lightheadedness. Observation had him walk and he fainted while walking. Ate Crepes for breakfast, lunch he had chips and a small cup of water.
18 2021-04-16 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, fluid around the heart Patient developed mild chest pain roughly 24 hrs after receiving 2nd Moderna Vaccine injection. He i... Read more
Close
Patient developed mild chest pain roughly 24 hrs after receiving 2nd Moderna Vaccine injection. He initially managed this with ibuprofen, but pain intensified and he presented to the ED approximately 1.5 days after 2nd injection with severe chest pain, diffuse ST elevations on EKG and elevated Troponin I measurement of 6 ng/ml. Patient transferred to hospital for further management and remains under inpatient care at time of report. Testing initially suggested pericarditis but cardiac MRI consistent with myocarditis. Troponin I peaked @ 75 ng/ml on 4/16/21.
18 2021-04-17 fainting pt fainted after receiving 1st dose of Moderna Covid vaccine. Pt fainted approximately 10 minutes a... Read more
Close
pt fainted after receiving 1st dose of Moderna Covid vaccine. Pt fainted approximately 10 minutes after vaccine was administered. Pt came to after 10-15 seconds, and fainted 2nd time after about 90-120 seconds. pt came to after about 10-15 seconds. Pt felt weak, was sweating, had chills. Pt was able to talk, breath and swallow water which pt requested to drink. Pt and mom decided that they would like EMT's to check him out. EMTs brought pt to ER and was released after a couple of hours..
18 2021-04-17 troponin increased, very slow heart rate, hypotension, lightheadedness, chest pain History of Present Illness: Patient is a 18 y.o. male with no pertinent past medical history who pr... Read more
Close
History of Present Illness: Patient is a 18 y.o. male with no pertinent past medical history who presents to the ED with complaints of chest pain. The patient notes that he started noticing chest pain this AM after he woke up that is associated with nausea. The pain is described to be in the center of his chest and is persistent. EMS was called who administered 2 SL NTG and 1 dose of ASA 325 mg. He notes that he received his 2nd Moderna vaccine on Thursday April 15th. He is currently a senior in High school. He had no adverse reactions to his 1st dose of the Moderna vaccine but after the 2nd dose he notes that he was having fever, malaise, body aches, and decreased appetite. He also tells me that he has been so fatigued that he has not really gotten out of bed in the last 48 hours. In regards to his oral intake he had (1) 16.9 oz bottle of water yesterday and nothing else but did have a glass of orange juice and some cereal this morning. During my evaluation with the patient he notes that he is still having chest pain that he reports to be retrosternal any 5/10 in severity. He denies any radiation into the left arm or jaw. He feels the pain is worse with movement and better when he is resting. He has had associated nausea and shortness of breath. He has been having low-grade fevers at home but denies any coughing, abdominal pain, diarrhea, dysuria, burning or itching with urination, congestion, rhinorrhea. He denies any tobacco use, drug use, alcohol use. In the emergency department initial workup is notable for potassium 3.6, magnesium 1.7, phosphorus less than 1, troponin 7206 with repeat at 10,212. CPK noted to be 380. Initial EKG was nonischemic. COVID swab was noted to be negative. After I evaluated the patient around 1520 an RRT was called due to hypotension and bradycardia. His blood pressure had dropped to 80/40 and heart rate was in the low 50s and he was symptomatic with diaphoresis and feeling as if he was going to pass out. 1L fluid was given running wide open. Repeat EKG did show some diffuse ST segment elevations concerning for pericarditis. Cardiology and ICU team were notified and evaluated the patient. Response is likely that the be vasovagal from acute pain. History obtained from: ? patient ? outpatient clinicians ? family ? staff at facility ? other ? review of medical record as summarized below Pt unable to provide reliable history because: ? Acute mental status change ? Acute illness/medical condition ? chronic dementia/mental challenges ? poor insight ? other ____
18 2021-04-18 hypotension, loss of consciousness, fast heart rate, fainting Patient stated prior to administartion of vaccine that he has had a history of passing out following... Read more
Close
Patient stated prior to administartion of vaccine that he has had a history of passing out following vaccinations, mostly when he does not eat or drink beforehand. He stated he made sure to have something to eat and drink beforehand and was aware that it may happen following this vaccine as well. Prior to administering vaccine, I verified details with patient on previous episodes and discussed risks with patient, who understood and wished to proceed anyways and was okay staying additional time beyond 15 mins post vaccination to ensure no serious reaction. Immediately post-vaccination, I asked the patient how they were feeling prior to sending him to the designated waiting area. He stated repeatedly that he was fine and okay to walk to the chairs on his own. Moments after sitting down, a technician alerted me that he had collapsed off the chair and fell on the ground before anyone could get there to catch him. I immediately called 911 and attended to the patient who had already regained consciousness while I was on the phone with emergency services. He informed technician that when he sat down he felt a little queasy and the next thing he knew, he was on the floor. Fortunately there happened to be an EMT in the store that came over to help while waiting for additional paramedics. We provided the patient with an ice pack and a bottle of water, but instructed him not to drink anything until paramedics arrived. We checked the patients blood pressure and found the reading to be low and patient was tachycardic, expected following a syncopal episode. Myself and the EMT got patient to lie down on the floor and elevated his head. We noticed that the patient had suffered a small laceration to his head resulting from falling off the chair onto the ground. Store management also got involved to assess the situation and take statements. Upon arrival of paramedics, care was transferred over to them. At first, patient refused to be transported to the hospital but asked that we contact his mother. After reaching his mother, she arrived shortly after to the store, and after further rest and evaluation, patient was transported to a local hospital for a further workup .Patient was only unconscious for 20 seconds or less, and the event occurred within 5 mins of vaccine administration. Upon regaining consciousness, patient was alert and oriented, and again stated that he's fine and it wasn't the first time it has happened.

Close
18 YOWM PRESENTED TO PHARMACY FOR ADMINISTRATION OF 1ST DOSE OF MODERNA COVID VACCINATION. HE MENTIONED BEING "SCARED OF NEEDLES" BUT AWKNOWLEDGED THAT HE WAS ON BOARD AND WISHED TO RECEIVE THE VACCINATION. AFTER PT WAS IN OBSERVATION FOR HALF OF THE 15 MINUTES REQUIRED, HE STARTED LOOKING PALE AND CONFUSED. PT FAINTED, AMBULANCE WAS CALLED, PT AWOKE AFTER 5 SECONDS FROM WHEN HE FAINTED. NO SWELLING OF TONGUE, FACE OR THROAT WAS APPARENT. PT STARTED TO VOMIT. ADMINISTERED 25MG OF ORAL DIPHENDYRAMINE SYRUP. AMBULANCE ARRIVED, CHECKED VITALS WHERE ALL WITHIN NORMAL RANGE. PT WAS PICKED UP FROM FACILITY BY HIS MOTHER. CALLED PT TO CHECK ON A FEW HOURS LATER, HE STATED HE WAS DOING WELL.

18 2021-04-19 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased He was admitted to Cardiovascular Medicine on 4/11/21 with acute idiopathic myocarditis, the etiolog... Read more
Close
He was admitted to Cardiovascular Medicine on 4/11/21 with acute idiopathic myocarditis, the etiology was unclear but considered due to recent COVID vaccination vs viral infection. He presented with elevated troponin and initially elevated ESR and CRP. CTA of coronary arteries was on done on 4/12 and showed normal coronary arteries. TTE was done on 4/13 and showed a normal LVEF of 65% and normal LV size and wall thickness. His RV size was mildly enlarged and has mildly elevated right atrial pressure. There was no significant valvular disease. Cardiac MRI was done prior to discharge and he will follow up with cardiology for the final results. He was having some intermittent chest pain and SOB and was recommended to use OTC ibuprofen 600 mg BID per cardiology. Reports that his chest pain and shortness of breath is slowly resolving. His symptoms are mild and infrequent.

After he gained consciousness pt. stated he felt pins and needles to his legs arms hands and lower back. Pt felt better after gaining consciousness. 911 was called R22 arrived on the scene did an evaluation and obtained a pt. refusal as pt. did not want to go to the hospital.

18 2021-04-19 lightheadedness Pt had a vasovagal response to the vaccine. It happened right after administration. Patient started ... Read more
Close
Pt had a vasovagal response to the vaccine. It happened right after administration. Patient started shaking and closed his eyes. Just a few seconds later he woke up and said something along the lines of, "Oh did I pass out?" I caught him in my arms before he could fall to the floor. The same response where he started aggressively shaking and eyes closed happened a few seconds later. His legs straightened out and his head was headed backward. Again I caught him and stabilized him. Afterward, my 2nd pharmacist stopped over and spoke with him. He seemed to be feeling better, but to ensure the same reaction wouldn't happen again, we had him wait 30 min instead of the standard 15. He sat in his chair and did not have any issues. We offered food but he was not interested. I spoke w/ him again this afternoon via phone and he said he was doing fine. Pt said he has had this type of rxn before w/ previous vaccines.

Close
Pt. just received first Moderna vaccine dosage. He had just sat down in the observation area when he began to feel flushed and lightheaded. NP was present and soon afterwards his head went backwards and he syncopized. He was caught by the NP and he was still sitting in the chair. NP proceeded to perform a sternal rub. Pt did not become conscious or aware for approximately 2-3 minutes. He never fell to the ground. On further questioning after patient was responsive, he states that he had not eaten prior to coming for his vaccination. He has only received a handful of vaccines and has never had the flu vaccine so he is unsure of his reaction. As per NP patients face became very pale PE: O2sat-96% on room air BP- 110/86 Pulse 60 Pt is pale in color Pupils slightly dilated Responds to sternal rub only After 2-3 minutes pt is more alert EMS was called but patient who is also here with his father refused to be transported to the ER. EMS was called but patient refused to go to the ER 3. Discussed possible side effects of vaccine and when to call 911 or go to the closest ER 4. Patient left for home with father after being observed for 40 minutes

18 2021-04-22 pallor, fainting, loss of consciousness, blood pressure decreased Immediately following the injection, pt had syncopal episode with loss of consciousness for approxi... Read more
Close
Immediately following the injection, pt had syncopal episode with loss of consciousness for approximately 15-20 seconds. Pt lowered to floor and placed in trendelenburg. BP 100/43, HR 47 and O2 sats 100%. BP then dropped as low as 56/32. Pt alert and oriented and states that his hands felt tingly. and HR in 40's. Cold compress applied as pt was pale and diaphoretic. BP continued to be alert and oriented. BP increased to 103/50 within 5 minutes of lowest BP and HR of 70. Pt states he is starting to feel better. Within 15 minutes of vaccine, BP increased back to 117/83. Pt sat up and BP 134/75. Pt up to chair and BP 139/71. Pt reports he is feeling much better now. Mother called and after approximately 1 hour drove patient home with patient back to baseline before leaving clinic.

18 2021-04-26 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain, chest discomfort, fibrin d dimer increased, troponin increased, inflammation of the pericardium Patient received his doses of the Maderna Vaccine on: 3/20/2021 and 4/23/2021. Two days later he ... Read more
Close
Patient received his doses of the Maderna Vaccine on: 3/20/2021 and 4/23/2021. Two days later he started complaining of chest pain and pressure midsternal which improved by sitting forward and worse by lying down. His EKG showed diffuse ST elevations c/w possible pericarditis. He has no prior cardiac hx. His troponins were extremely elevated. Cardiology consulted and his assessment is that pt has combined myocarditis and pericarditis. Likely immune-mediated response post vaccine and also there are reports of young men in other countries with post vaccine pericarditis.

18 2021-05-11 loss of consciousness, chest discomfort Passed out; Hallucination; Chest tightness; Sore arm; Headache; This spontaneous case was reported b... Read more
Close
Passed out; Hallucination; Chest tightness; Sore arm; Headache; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) and HALLUCINATION (Hallucination) in an 18-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 039B21A and 008B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 30-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 29-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 29-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HALLUCINATION (Hallucination) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), CHEST DISCOMFORT (Chest tightness), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Sore arm) and HEADACHE (Headache). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out), HALLUCINATION (Hallucination), CHEST DISCOMFORT (Chest tightness), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Sore arm) and HEADACHE (Headache) outcome was unknown. Patient was hospitalized due to vehicular accident Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. No treatment information was provided. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the events, therefore action taken with the drug in response to the events was not applicable. Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

It is thought to be vaccine-induced myocarditis. Myocardial infarction was ruled out. Patient does now have a reduced ejection fraction of 45%. Here is the note from the ED today: "He indicates that he was awakened from sleep with chest pain this morning around 2:50 AM. He ended up trying to sleep longer to see if it would improve and ended up going to his mother's room. She recommended that he drink some orange juice and gave him some Tylenol. He states that the pain continued to increase since that time and he asked her to bring him to the emergency department. The patient states that the pain is on the left side of his chest radiates to his left shoulder and down his left arm. He denies that it radiates to his back. He has had lightheadedness. He does not feel short of breath. He does have some pain into his left jaw as well. He has not had any vomiting. He denies abdominal pain. He denies diarrhea. The patient did receive his second dose of the Moderna vaccine on Friday to his left arm. He has had fevers over the past 24 hours to 103 at home. His mother and he indicate that the go away with Tylenol though seem to come back when the Tylenol wears off. He did complain of some headache, myalgias, malaise and sore throat which she states were all worse when he would have a fever and seemed to dissipate when his fever resolved. He states he did not and has never had chest pain like this until this morning. The patient does not have a history of Covid infection. He is active and has run track in the past. He has not had any travel. He denies any pain or swelling to his legs or calves. He has had no sick contacts. His mother received her second dose of the vaccine on the same day that he did and has not had any similar symptoms. "

Shortly after patient received vaccination, he lost consciousness. He slumped in his char, nearly falling to the floor, but was caught by a nearby patient who noticed patient falling. Patient was assisted by staff to lie down on a cot. At that time he regained consciousness and was able to state his name. Staff attempted to check his blood pressure, but the electronic cuff was unable to measure b/p despite multiple attempts. Because of this, and persistent pallor, drowsiness and low pulse, EMS (who was standing by in the parking lot) was requested to enter the building to assess the patient. After evaluating him within the vaccination site for approximately 30 minutes, patient was transported to the hospital due to persistent low pulse and low blood pressure.

18 2021-06-01 palpitations, chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, chest discomfort Patient received second Materna vaccine 5/28/2021 around 630 pm. Around 10 PM felt fatigue and head... Read more
Close
Patient received second Materna vaccine 5/28/2021 around 630 pm. Around 10 PM felt fatigue and headache. Felt very fatigued and unwell and slept most of 5/29 - 5/30. On 5/31, began experiencing chest discomfort radiating to left arm and palpitations. Presented to hospital which was notable for abnormal EKG with diffuse ST elevations and PR depressions, troponin peak of 25. TTE revealed low normal systolic function with EF 50%, no valvular disease or wall motion abnormalities. Cardiac MRI revealed subepicardial delayed myocardial enhancement in the mid, apex lateral wall of the left ventricle and adjacent pericardium consistent with myopericarditis. Patient was treated with colchicine and improved. Infectious work-up for cardiotropic viruses were sent, viral swab was notable for positive rhinovirus/enterovirus. Patient's presentation and timing of vaccine should be looked into as it is unclear wheter this presentation can be entirely due to presence of virus as above. This is notably at least the second presentation of teenager with myopericarditis on this cardiology service in the past 2 weeks in setting of recent Covid vaccination.
18 2021-06-01 fainting syncope, fatigue, eyes heavy

18 2021-06-16 loss of consciousness Woke up on floor/ Past out; Anxiety; Fall; Little weak; Foggy head; Shiver; Headache; Nausea; Throw ... Read more
Close
Woke up on floor/ Past out; Anxiety; Fall; Little weak; Foggy head; Shiver; Headache; Nausea; Throw up; Concussion; Buzzing in ears; Did not eat; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Woke up on floor/ Past out) in an 18-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 033C21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 01-Jun-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 01-Jun-2021, the patient experienced CONCUSSION (Concussion), TINNITUS (Buzzing in ears), EATING DISORDER (Did not eat), CHILLS (Shiver), HEADACHE (Headache), NAUSEA (Nausea) and VOMITING (Throw up). On 02-Jun-2021, the patient experienced ASTHENIA (Little weak) and FEELING ABNORMAL (Foggy head). On an unknown date, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Woke up on floor/ Past out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), ANXIETY (Anxiety) and FALL (Fall). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Woke up on floor/ Past out), CONCUSSION (Concussion), TINNITUS (Buzzing in ears), EATING DISORDER (Did not eat), ASTHENIA (Little weak), FEELING ABNORMAL (Foggy head), ANXIETY (Anxiety), FALL (Fall), CHILLS (Shiver), HEADACHE (Headache), NAUSEA (Nausea) and VOMITING (Throw up) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 01-Jun-2021, Blood glucose abnormal: abnormal (abnormal) abnormal. On 01-Jun-2021, Blood pressure measurement: abnormal (abnormal) abnormal. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medications were not reported . Treatment information was not provided. Company comment:Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

18 2021-06-19 fainting Patient received vaccine and 10 minutes into waiting period, he began to slouch in chair and he drop... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine and 10 minutes into waiting period, he began to slouch in chair and he dropped his belongings. We got to him quickly and held him up while it appeared he was fainting. We lowered him to the ground and called 911 and his father that was in store . He complained of being very hot and dizzy. He began to recover fairly quickly, he drank some water and stayed on floor. His dad arrived and the 911 call was cancelled due to his improving awareness. He stayed in the lobby for 20-30 minutes. He felt much better and left with his dad in good physical condition.
18 2021-06-21 chest pain, troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle Patient presented to hospital on 6/20/21 with complaints of substernal chest pain, nausea and vomiti... Read more
Close
Patient presented to hospital on 6/20/21 with complaints of substernal chest pain, nausea and vomiting 6 days after his second dose of Moderna Vaccine. His symptoms had started on the day of his second vaccine dose ( 6/14/21). He had initially presented to another hospital on the day his symptoms began and was discharged home after observation overnight. He presented to healthcare facility on 6/20 because his symptoms of chest pain, nausea and vomiting had not resolved. On presentation, his HR was 39. EKG showed sinus bradycardia, Left axis deviation and T wave inversions in II, III and aVF. His COVID and Flu RT PCR was negative. HS Troponin was elevated to 168 and peaked at 283. There were no previous values to compare with from his prior admission. Cardiac MRI was done but did not show LGE. He was diagnosed with clinical myocarditis after Moderna vaccine administration.

19 2021-01-21 nosebleed I got the injection at 3:35pm on 1/20 in my left arm. Within the first 30 minutes, my shoulder aroun... Read more
Close
I got the injection at 3:35pm on 1/20 in my left arm. Within the first 30 minutes, my shoulder around the injection site was incredibly sore, my left elbow had a lot of joint pain, and my left thumb and index fingers went numb within the first 30 minutes, I woke up at 8:00am on 1/21 and noticed that I had a light headache, felt extremely groggy, and was experiencing an uncomfortable amount of muscular and joint pain. I went to work at 9:00 and on the drive there, I began to feel dizzy and I felt as if when I turned my head, my vision would lag behind and take a second to process my surroundings. By 10:00, my muscular and joint pains were significantly amplified, my headaches were increasing in frequency and amplitude. I also began to have the chills, followed by periods of radiating heat from my body. Coworkers told me I looked very flushed, however, I never developed a fever. By 11:00, the muscular and joint pains, coupled with the headaches forced me to sit down and I almost broke down into tears. There were three sperate times where I began to get very lightheaded and thought I was going to pass out ( I did not). I went home at noon and noticed that my muscles felt like they were on fire. I took Tylenol and Advil whenever I could, which helped to reduce the symptoms. we had dinner at 7:00, however, I had no appetite, without eating since noon. On 1/22, I woke up at 8:30 with a pounding headache, muscular and joint pains still there, however reduced, and the same groggy feeling. This morning, I also noticed that I had a very sharp stomach pain in my abdomen. I also woke up with a severe nosebleed, which is extremely uncommon for me.
19 2021-01-27 pallor Received COVID-19 vaccine (Moderna) on 1/21/21. No local reaction. No immediate symptoms (hives, lip... Read more
Close
Received COVID-19 vaccine (Moderna) on 1/21/21. No local reaction. No immediate symptoms (hives, lip swelling, respiratory symptoms). One day later, feverish T99.5F. 1/23/21, Patient developed a painful red rash on the palmar aspect of his hands and dorsum aspect of his feet and has had this rash since (total of 5 days). He currently takes Xyzal daily. Father would like to know if patient should receive the second dose of the vaccine. Erythematous macular rash limited to hands and feet that is blanching. As time progressed, raised in some places. Looked eczematous in some places as well. Painful, stinging skin, and swollen. He has limited range of motion. Hot shower decreased discomfort, increased range of motion. Cold water also helped. Symptoms are improving. Spring 2020 - may have had COVID - had anosmia. Was not tested at the time, but did have COVID antibody testing in July which was negative. Family has reported the reaction to VAERS and is also using V-Safe. Patient has no history of reactions to vaccines in the past nor has he had an allergic reaction to any component of the Moderna/Pfizer vaccines. He also does not have PEG/polysorbate allergy history (though he has taken Miralax in the past for constipation). Patient does have a history of anaphylaxis.

Patient fell out of chair in post vac after vaccination. Patient hit head on floor, loss of consciousness noted. No visible injury noted. Patient regained consciousness. Neuro functions intact. Pupils equal and reactive to light eyes open spontaneously. Motor response intact. BP 110/55, P 76, R 16, O2 99%. 911 and mother called. EMS assessed patient. BP 75/48, P 61, R 18, O2 99%. 19 yo medically complex M with prior COVID infection in Dec 2020 who received first dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine on 3/4 as well as Epo shot (for chronic anemia secondary to CKD). Recently admitted for MRSA sacral abscess and had recently been discharged to complete treatment on oral Bactrim. On 3/6, developed worsening diarrhea, decreased urine output, facial and tongue swelling, and altered mental status. EMS was called and patient was brought to the ED. Upon presentation, noted to have hypotension and was fluid resuscitated. Initial blood gas with hypercarbia, and he was intubated for airway protection. CXR was non-focal. He was started on empiric vancomycin and ceftriaxone, although these were discontinued with negative blood and urine cultures. Repeat respiratory film array was negative. Patient intubated 3/6-3/10.
19 2021-03-09 inflammation of the heart muscle Perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome; A spontaneous report was received from a physician co... Read more
Close
Perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome; A spontaneous report was received from a physician concerning a 19 year old, male patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome. The patient's medical history was not provided. No concomitant medications were reported. On 16 Feb 2021, approximately six days prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number: 013L20A) for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 22 Feb 2021 the patient experienced the symptoms following vaccination: perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome. No treatment information was provided. No relevant laboratory details were included. The seriousness criteria for the event perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome were hospitalization and medically significant. Action taken with the drug in response to the event was unknown. The outcome of the event, perimyocarditis post covid19 vaccine syndrome was reported resolved on an unknown date.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
19 2021-03-10 fainting, pallor, loss of consciousness 10 minutes post vaccine administration at 13:15 patient began to exhibit the following symptoms: diz... Read more
Close
10 minutes post vaccine administration at 13:15 patient began to exhibit the following symptoms: dizziness, paleness, weakness, blurred/loss of vision, ringing in the ears, and diaphoresis. Cold pack was placed on patient's forehead and patient's feet were elevated. BP, pulse, & temperature unable to assess, pulse was faint and weak. Patient experienced loss consciousness for 1 minute, 34 seconds. During this time paramedics were called. Vitals at 13:20 were: BP=98/76, P=62, temp= unable to register with machine on hand. Patient able to follow commands and asked to lie down. Cold pack was placed on the back of his neck. Paramedics arrived and assessed patient's blood glucose = 56. Patient given orange juice. Vitals at 13:30 were: BP = 107/69, P = 70, Temp = 97.6., pulse ox: 99%. Patient asked to sit up and vitals were: BP = 114/73, P: 71. Patient declined to go be transported in ambulance with paramedics to the hospital at that time. Blood glucose assessed again = 127. Patient given chips and salsa from what facility had on hand. Patient stayed 10 minutes to eat the snack. Patient instructed to go to the hospital or urgent care for further follow-up and assessment. Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to instruction. Stated he will go to nearest Urgent Care facility. Patient left this facility alert and oriented.

I placed a cold ice pack on the back of the patient's neck and we stayed with him until he felt better, which was approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Close
The day following the vaccine at 2:30 AM, I had terrible chills, headache, shaking, and full-body weakness. 9:30 AM, I got out of bed and fainted soon after (reason for filing this report). The next day at 2:30 AM, every symptom went away.

Patient was discharged after his vital signs became more stable and he was able to walk about unassisted and without complaints of dizziness.

The patient was subsequently admitted, vomiting and fever occurred during stay, platelet count monitored, given IV antibiotics. I called 911 and gave him one dose of epipen, Patient felt much better very quickly. Police and ems show up within a few minutes and stayed with him for about 45 minutes. 19 2021-04-15 loss of consciousness, fainting, pallor Patient experienced loss of consciousness after administration of vaccine. This happened within 45 ... Read more
Close
Patient experienced loss of consciousness after administration of vaccine. This happened within 45 seconds of administration. This happened 3 separate times within a 5-10 minute time frame. No signs of anaphylaxis were identified during this time. Patient would "faint" briefly (approximately 10 seconds) and then regain consciousness and confirm that he had no symptoms of anaphylaxis. Symptoms observed were loss of color of the face and lips and some diaphoresis. The patient was monitored for any changes and EMS was called. The patient refused EMS service or hospital service. He stated that the "fainting" happened to him regularly whenever he received a vaccine. The total time of the event was approximately 30 minutes and the patient was advised to stay longer for monitoring if he would refuse EMS service, which he did. The patient has since been called and is currently feeling "normal except for being somewhat tired". He has been advised to follow up with his primary care.

Close
PT FELT DIZZY ABOUT 10-15 MINUTES AFTER RECEIVING VACCINE. UPON STANDING HE FELL TO THE FLOOR AND BRIEFLY PASSED OUT. PT STATES HE DOES NOT REMEMEBER FALLING. HE DID NOT EAT PRIOR TO VACCINATION. GAVE PT ORANGE JUICE. PATIENTS MOM CAME IN AND STATED HE HAS HAD THE SAME ISSUE IN THE PAST. PARAMEDICS CAME TO MAKE SURE PT DID NOT HIT HIS HEAD AND HAVE A CONCUSSION. HE WAS FOUND TO BE OK AND WENT HOME WITH HIS MOM.
19 2021-04-16 loss of consciousness Patient received vaccination, I explained the need to wait in the store for 15 minutes. Patient was ... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccination, I explained the need to wait in the store for 15 minutes. Patient was ok as I returned to the pharmacy to prepare for the next vaccination. Pt left the waiting area to shop, then returned after about 2 minutes and sat down in one of our chairs. Pt then announced that he was feeling dizzy. I immediately tried to reach the patient, by the time I reached him he had collapsed to the floor. The patient was unconscious for about 1 to 2 minutes, I had my staff call 911. Then the patient regained consciousness. The paramedics arrived and checked his vitals and watch him. His father arrived and took him home. He was feeling ok when he left the store.

Close
PATIENT RECEIVED FIRST FOSE COVID19 VACCINE AT 10:20AM TODAY, SECONDS TO A MINUTE AFTER THAT PATIENT FAINTED FOR A FEW SECONDS BUT RECOVERED IMEDIATELY NOT KNOWING WHAT HAPPENED. 911 WAS CALLED STAT AND ARRIVED WITHIN APROX 5 MIN. PATIENT WAS COMUNICATIVE IMEDIATELY AFTER INCIDENT, SAID HE FEELS GOOD NOW BUT DIZZY BECAUSE HE DID NOT EAT FOOD IN THE AM. FATHER WAS PRESENT. EMT NOTICED PATIENT'S BLOOD PREASURE VERY LOW AND TOOK PATIENT TO THE HOSPITAL RIGHT AWAY. PATIENT DID NOT WANT TO GO TO HOSPITAL IMEDIATELY BUT AGREED AFTER ADVICED TO DO SO. 19 2021-04-19 fainting, pallor Patient had parked in the COVID vaccine waiting area, and was observed to fall forward onto his stee... Read more
Close
Patient had parked in the COVID vaccine waiting area, and was observed to fall forward onto his steering wheel within a few minutes of parking by 2 other participants waiting in the car next to him. One of them immediately notified one of the parking lot volunteers who came and got me within 1 minute of this observation. 2 students and I came quickly to the open drivers side door and began talking to assess the situation. Mr. Bannister appeared pale, mildly diaphoretic (sweating) and slightly confused as to the passage of time, but was able to state and spell his name and talk coherently about his circumstances. He stated that he was not allergic to anything that he knew about, and that he had no prior history of similar reactions to vaccines or medicines although he had not taken any shots in several years. He noted that he had not eaten anything since breakfast (now mid-afternoon). He described himself as initially feeling weak, faint, and nauseated with his vaccinated arm feeling heavy and numb. He also reported that he had a sensation of blurriness before passing out, but denied any spinning sensation, visual loss or ringing in the ears. There were no obviously visible abrasions or bleeding on his face or forehead. The nursing students brought a chair, and we elevated his legs and gave him some water to drink during the time we were monitoring his vital signs. He refused a cupcake because of the nausea, but as time progressed he gained facial color and was more comfortable in conversing. His hands had equal muscle grip and strength, visible fingernail beds were pink and his capillary refill was less than 3 seconds. Towards the end of our monitoring, he did accept some nuts and M & Ms to eat. A University Safety Medical Report was completed by the appropriate safety personnel. He was fully AAO x 3 at the end of our monitoring, and stated that if he felt better he would drive to his apartment (less than 5 minutes away) but would wait for his girlfriend to get out of class if he did not feel fully capable of driving. We encouraged him to eat something light when he got home, to use cool water/warm water soaks at his shot site, exercise his arm, and to take an NSAID for pain relief the next day. We recommended that he eat something light before his second shot (which had already been scheduled), that he bring someone with him the next time, and as a precaution to wait 30 minutes following the second shot. He left at 3: 15 pm driving his car without any apparent difficulties. An online report was completed for the incident 04/20/2021.
19 2021-04-19 fainting Syncope after receiving the immunization. Recovered immediately with no lasting effects
19 2021-04-19 troponin increased, inflammation of the pericardium Pericarditis attributed to the Moderna shot

Felt fine Saturday 4/10 and then Sunday 4/11 developed low grade chest pain lasting 2 hours and resolved with Advil. Awakened at 5am on Monday 4/12 with severe diffuse chest pain requiring hospitalization and treated for myopericarditis.

19 2021-05-14 chest pain, blood pressure decreased, chest discomfort Immediate light headedness 1 minute post administration progressing to chest pain and tightness alon... Read more
Close
Immediate light headedness 1 minute post administration progressing to chest pain and tightness along with abdominal pain/cramping approximately 2 minutes later. EMT's contacted. Checked patient's blood pressure which had dropped to 96/50 mmHg. Provided water to patient 2 minutes later to re stabilize cardiovascular stability. Chest pain and lightheadedness ceased within 1 minute after providing 16 ounces of water. Checked blood pressure again which returned to 110/69 mmHg. EMT's arrived approximately 20 minutes after administration and patient was assessed. Blood pressure noted at 126/70 mmHg. Patient was allowed to go home with slight, residual abdominal pain.
19 2021-05-15 chest pain Shortness of breath severe chest pain headaches
19 2021-05-15 fainting 19 year old patient came to pharmacy with dad to get first dose of Moderna Vaccine. Questionnaire wa... Read more
Close
19 year old patient came to pharmacy with dad to get first dose of Moderna Vaccine. Questionnaire was completed online with no's to all questions. Patient was sitting in booth and seemed comfortable while getting vaccine, but immediately after started to lean towards wall and faint. Patient's father and I supported patient so he didn't fall and injure himself. Patient was nonresponsive for about 5 to 10 seconds before he became responsive. He was able to sit by himself after about 1 minute of support from his dad. Patient was given water and waited 15 minutes in the booth while being monitored. He seemed to be himself after about 5 minutes. During those 15 minutes I talked to patient's dad about patient's medical history. He may had 1 seizure when he was younger due to ADHD medication but test results did not confirm it as a seizure. He also passed out one time in high school while watching biology movies with blood. Discussing this incident with the father and patient, we agreed this patient seems to have suffered from syncope due to fear of needles. I gave his father my business card and told him to call me if the patient reported any symptoms after leaving or if he had any questions whatsoever. I let them know I would be reporting this to VAERS and encouraged him to follow up with his PCP about this incident.

Close
ADVERSE OUTCOME: patient experienced tonic clonic seizure not sustained minute after injection He told our staff this happens every time he has blood drawn or an injection? Dr. in office aware at time of vaccination and present and documented below. Came in for COVID-19 vaccine. 10 minutes after shot (L) deltoid. He was sitting and said to me he was feeling dizzy and immediately he had convulsion and became pale. We called 911. It lasted 1-2 minutes. Dr. came to see him, he had irregular heartbeat, feeling very tired and weak BP (L) arm 100/60 at 4:15pm. 2nd reading after 10 minutes (L) arm 112/78 p-64. He mentioned he has same reaction after injections, or blood draw. He did not want to be taken to hospital. Pt left at 5:00 with his aunt. He is visiting. When I entered the the patient was having convulsion, clonic phase, stiffening arms and legs. The consciousness came back in 1-2 minutus; he could communicate with me. He said he could breath fine. His heart rhythm was still irregular. Blood pressure was checked. He could not walk because he was too tired. 911 called. 911 cleared patient, BP and heart rate regular and stable per staff. Discharged with family member ambulating on his own, alert and oriented. Plan: must see PCP neurologist. NOT to receive second vaccine unless has complete diagnostic work up and clearance. Should have second injection vaccine in a monitored hospital setting with paramedics.

19 2021-05-23 loss of consciousness, lightheadedness The patient received his vaccine and 5 minutes later complained of feeling dizzy. He was instructed ... Read more
Close
The patient received his vaccine and 5 minutes later complained of feeling dizzy. He was instructed to sit and before we could help him into a chair he lost consciousness and fell. His fall was somewhat controlled by the technician. I then assessed the patient and determined he had a vasovagal episode and lifted his legs, he returned to consciousness within 10 seconds of raising his legs. I then allowed the patient to lie on the floor for approximately 20 minutes after which he felt better and returned to sitting . He then sat for about 15 more minutes until a family member was able to arrive. The patient reported no other adverse effects other than dizziness, lightheadedness, some trouble hearing and tingling fingers.

Patient received Moderna Covid-19 vaccination at 10:50 AM on June 2, 2021. Within 10 minutes patient describes being shaky. Patient was given orange juice. After 2-3 minutes patient described chest tightness which progressed into left arm pain during our conversation and was not improving. 911 was called. As paramedics arrived, approximately 11:30-11:40 AM, patient began to complain of trouble swallowing but no trouble breathing. Paramedic checked patients heart and patient started to develop hives. The paramedic gave the patient diphenhydramine and then was taken to the hospital for treatment.
19 2021-06-01 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased Patient started having generalized body weakness and fatigue few hours after vaccination on 05/22/2... Read more
Close
Patient started having generalized body weakness and fatigue few hours after vaccination on 05/22/2021. He subsequently developed chest pain on 05/23/2021 which progressively worsened and resulted in his presentation at the emergency room on 05/25/2021. While in the ED, Troponin was elevated at 17.22. EKG done had revealed ST elevations with PR depression. Cardiac MRI done showed myocardial edema involving the mid/apical lateral wall suggestive of acute myocarditis/inflammation. Patient received a loading dose of Colchicine and Ibuprofen as anti-inflammatory agents. Troponin was trended and peaked at 23.60 and slowly down-trended to 1.84 on 5/28/21 and he was subsequently discharged to follow up as outpatient.

19 2021-06-01 fainting Dizziness/ dizzy; Weakness/ very weak; Seizures; Fainted; This spontaneous case was reported by a co... Read more
Close
Dizziness/ dizzy; Weakness/ very weak; Seizures; Fainted; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SEIZURE (Seizures), SYNCOPE (Fainted), DIZZINESS (Dizziness/ dizzy) and ASTHENIA (Weakness/ very weak) in a 19-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 07-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 07-May-2021, the patient experienced SEIZURE (Seizures) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant) and SYNCOPE (Fainted) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant). On 16-May-2021, the patient experienced DIZZINESS (Dizziness/ dizzy) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and ASTHENIA (Weakness/ very weak) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized on 07-May-2021 due to SEIZURE and SYNCOPE, then on 16-May-2021 due to ASTHENIA and DIZZINESS. The patient was treated with PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL) at an unspecified dose and frequency. At the time of the report, SEIZURE (Seizures) and SYNCOPE (Fainted) outcome was unknown and DIZZINESS (Dizziness/ dizzy) and ASTHENIA (Weakness/ very weak) had not resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No concomitant medications were reported. Description: During the day of the injection, at 5 to 10 minutes, the patient fainted and had seizures that required hospitalization. Also, on 16 May 2021 the patient required hospitalization again because of the dizziness and weakness. The patient was still dizzy and was very weak. The patient had a consult with a neurologist and who told that the symptoms were probably becasue of the vaccine. Other treatment information included unspecified pill for dizziness at the hospital. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Within hours, he began to have chest pain, shortness of breath, general body aches and fatigue. Chest pain was worse with deep breath and worse with supine position. On Friday, June 11, he presented to The Clinic at with these complaints. He was noted to be in evident severe discomfort, though not in respiratory distress. Vitals as follows: pulse 82 and regular, BP 139/68, respiratory rate 20, temperature 99.2 oral, SaO2 98% on room air. Exam was notable for absence of a pericardial friction rub. Got vaccinated on May 22 on a saturday at store/pharmacy with Moderna. This was the second dose of the vaccine. I use a smart watch to monitor my health 24/7. I noticed an unusual elevation in my heart pulse after the first vaccine but that went away in a few days and I was back to normal. After the second vaccine I had the usual expected symptoms of headaches etc which went away the next day. After receiving the second dose on saturday I experienced unusual chest pains on monday which lasted for a few while and I was fine the rest of the day. It was tuesday when things got worse. I had a very sharp chest pain which I had never experienced and it continued till I took Alegra. I thought it was heartburn but when I went to the hospital they did my EKG which showed some abnormalities. I was then diagnosed with Pericarditis. After staying in the hospital for 4 days. I was discharged with anti inflammatory meds. I hope to have a full recovery in a few weeks.

After receiving vaccine, pt walked into the post vaccine observation room located outside the door of the vaccination room. Pt. sat down in chair, went to put his head down towards his knees, then patient slid out of chair and onto the floor. This RN was immediately at the patients side, and pt. immediately responded to his name. Pt. insisted on standing up against this RN's advice, and got back into the chair. Pt stated he didn't know what happened, so I explained to him that he had fainted. His mother and father were present. Pt stated he ate no breakfast today. Pt. states he has no health concerns, allergies, or issues. Pt.s stated that he is very afraid of needles and thinks he was just nervous. BP readings: 09:45 90/75 HR 60, 09:50 90/75 HR 60 10:00 BP 113/72 HR 65. Pt stated he was feeling fine. Pt. released to go home w/Parents at 10:30. This RN called this pt. to f/u at noon today, and patient stated he was feeling good and thinks he was just really nervous. Pt. thanked this RN for the phone call and call was ended.

20 2021-02-14 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle Myocarditis; Acute onset of chest pain; Soreness of the arm; A spontaneous report was received from ... Read more
Close
Myocarditis; Acute onset of chest pain; Soreness of the arm; A spontaneous report was received from a physician concerning a 20-year-old, male patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced soreness of the arm, acute onset of chest pain, and myocarditis. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included asthma, and allergy to egg, peanut and tree nuts. Concomitant medications reported included dupilumab, montelukast, budesonide / formoterol, cetirizine, albuterol and epinephrine. On 29 Dec 2020, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 025J20A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 26 Jan 2021, prior to the onset of events, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 028L20A) intramuscularly in the left deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 26 Jan 2021, after receiving the second dose of the vaccine, the patient reported soreness of the arm for 3 to 4 days. On 30 Jan 2021, the patient presented to the hospital with acute onset of left sided chest pain. The physician reported that the patient developed myocarditis. Consent for Safety to follow up was received. Treatment for the events, as reported, included patient's concomitant medications of dupilumab, montelukast, budesonide / formoterol, cetirizine and albuterol. No additional treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The event, soreness of the arm, was resolved on unknown date. The event acute onset of chest pain and myocarditis was not resolved at the time of this report.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 20 year old male with medical history of multiple allergies, who was hospitalized with serious unexpected events of chest pain and myocarditis and a non-serious unexpected event of pain in extremity. The chest pain and myocarditis occurred 33 days after first dose and 4 days after last dose of mRNA-1273. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Patient reports routinely having spells of syncope with injections and still insisted on receiving COVID-19 vaccination. Gave injection into left deltoid. Had patient scoot up to table in immunization room with both legs fully under the table just in case there was an issue. I set the timer for 15 minutes and left him in the immunization room with his girlfriend, who also received a vaccine. A few moments later the girlfriend asked for our help stating he was feeling like he was going to pass out. I went into the IMZ room and checked with him. At the time, he was sweaty with a rapid hearbeat. I instructed him to take some deep breaths and went to get a cold paper towel to apply to his head. When I returned he had passed out, not responsive but still breathing, in his chair and his girlfriend was holding his head in her hand. We gently lowered his head to rest on the table while another associate called 911 per girlfriend's request. He began moaning a few moments later and was able to talk to us. He was very hot and sweaty, light headed and breathing rapidly. We applied a cooling pack to his forhead as he continued to lie his head on the table. He then said he might feel more comfortable lying on the floor. We assisted him to the floor, elevated his feet on a chair and placed his head on a roll of paper towels. At that time the paramedics showed up and said his blood pressure was fine and he was just having some hyperventilation. The paramedics got him back up in the chair and his girlfriend got him some apply juice. After about 30 minutes he was talking fine, shaking had stopped and his breathing a temp went back to normal

Close
Patient reported stating feeling nauseous, lightheadedness, paleness, dizziness, and had trouble seeing to observation nurse, at 1116 AM. Vaccination nurse went to notify charge nurse on patient status. Vital signs included T 96.1, o2 99, RR 16, B/P 106/76, and HR 52 at 1116 AM. Supervisor on site notified the doctor via telephone at 1144 AM. Reassessed at 1126 AM second set of vital signs includes T 96.1, o2 98, RR 18, B/P 94/74, and HR 77.Currently patient does not display any s/s of distress or discomfort third set of vital signs includes T 97.0, o2 98, RR 18, B/P 116/86, and HR 78. As per MD patient is stable and can go home, clear to leave observation area. Patient instructed to contact HCP and/or go to ER if displays s/s.
20 2021-04-05 chest pain Patient received Moderna vaccination (Lot # 044A21A) on 04/05/2021 at 1015 in the right arm and was ... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderna vaccination (Lot # 044A21A) on 04/05/2021 at 1015 in the right arm and was escorted to Observation by the Escort Team. RN assessment findings are as follows: Patient is awake and alert, oriented to person, place, and time. Patient is responsive to all verbal commands. Upon checking out of observation at approximately 1034 patient reported chest pain. Patient is sitting upright in a chair. Patient stated that after he received the vaccine and sat in observation, he started to feel chest pain to his mid sternum. Patient?s blood pressure is 120/80, pulse 79 and O2Sat 98% room air. Patient was given 2 bottles of water. Section Chief, at the ICP of the patient at 1046. Staff called on the phone because the radios were not working properly then called Incident Commander (IC). RN was notified that patient is complaining of chest pain. 1047 Patient assessed by RN. Patient is a 20 year old with no past medical history, patient sitting in an upright position awake, alert and oriented X3, answers questions appropriately. Patient denies allergy to any medication or food. Patient verbalized he did not eat breakfast prior to vaccination. Patient stated he started to experience chest pain after he received the moderna vaccine when he got into observation. Patient rates pain 4/10 which has remained the same since he?s been in observation. Pain does not radiate, no diaphoresis or change in color noted. Patient denies using any illicit drugs or has taken any medication in the past 24 hours. IC, aware and called 911. 1055 Patient?s blood pressure was s rechecked: 122/68, pulse 70, O2Sat 98% room air. No sign of distress noted. 1059 Patient was placed in a wheelchair and brought to the other side of the room away from other patients for confidentiality and privacy. Patient awaiting EMS.
20 2021-04-05 pallor about 5 minutes after vaccine pt asked for a bandaid due to some heavy bleeding at injection site. ... Read more
Close
about 5 minutes after vaccine pt asked for a bandaid due to some heavy bleeding at injection site. He then asked for water. When I brought the water to him he was very pale and said he felt like fainting. We had him lay down and elevate feet which helped him feel better but was still hot so I applied a cold ice pack on head to help him feel less hot. After about 10-15 minutes he felt better and stayed with us for about 45 mintues until he felt well enough to drive home. I checked on him about 2 hours later and he was feeling much better.
20 2021-04-07 pallor Patient experienced lightheadedness and became pale with sweating a few minutes after receiving his ... Read more
Close
Patient experienced lightheadedness and became pale with sweating a few minutes after receiving his vaccine. The patient was given water and also accepted some orange juice. upon drinking the fluids , he started to feel improvement in his symptoms , however still noticed feeling dizzy. His parents requested a medic come to check him out. The medics evaluated the patient's vitals including blood pressure and blood sugar which were within normal limits so they released the patient to go home.
20 2021-04-07 palpitations, fainting he fainted for 1-2 seconds; palpitation; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequen... Read more
Close
he fainted for 1-2 seconds; palpitation; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (he fainted for 1-2 seconds) in a 20-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 024M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Neutropenia. On 05-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 05-Mar-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (he fainted for 1-2 seconds) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and PALPITATIONS (palpitation). On 05-Mar-2021, SYNCOPE (he fainted for 1-2 seconds) and PALPITATIONS (palpitation) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No concomitant medications reported. No treatment information reported. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset date of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset date of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
20 2021-04-08 pallor After recieving his Moderna vaccine the pt devoloped pallor, complained of being light headed and th... Read more
Close
After recieving his Moderna vaccine the pt devoloped pallor, complained of being light headed and that his thorat felt "weird". I checked the pt's pulse, it was normal. He complained he was feeling worse, I instructed him to stop drinking water and to lay down and elevate his legs. I had a staff call 911 as the pt was complining he was having trouble breathing. The paramedics showed up before I could check his blood pressure. They checked his vitals then motiored the pt for 15 minutes. They then cleared him to leave when he felt ok.
20 2021-04-11 pallor, lightheadedness, loss of consciousness 5 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient lost consciousness, vasovagal reaction. Sternal rub appli... Read more
Close
5 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient lost consciousness, vasovagal reaction. Sternal rub applied, patient aroused, A&O x 4, diaphoretic, pale, stated did not eat or drink fluids today, denied SOB, itching, swelling, chest pain, HA, dizziness. Patient laid supine with feet up. Vitals supine: B/P: 114/73, HR: 99, SPO2: 97% RA., lungs CTAB, no adventitious heart sounds. 5 minutes later, manual HR: 53, 5 minutes later HR: 58. Patient provided private room, laid supine, given oral water, snacks and breath coaching. 15 minutes later: B/P: 101/65, HR: 50 supine. Patient continued to lay supine, denied all symptoms. 40 minutes after vaccine: B/P: 105/62, HR: 56 manual, SPO2: 99% RA. Patient monitored for total of 1 hour, final vitals: B/P: 112/74, HR: 54 manual, SPO2: 98% RA. Patient stated feeling better, is an athlete. Per consult with MD, patient may go home, rest, fluids, & f/u with PCP. Advised patient to make appt with PCP and discuss 2nd dose. Also advised if develops SOB, facial swelling, hives to go to ER. Patient verbalized agreement.

Close
Pt fainted and became diaphoretic. HR in the 60's, BP 140/80, SPO2 100%. Had pt lay down for 15 minutes, provided water and a granola bar, and had client sit another 15 minutes. HR remained in the 60s/70s, SPO2 remained stable, and BP was 125/70 after 30 minutes. Client reported feeling back to baseline and went home.
