20 2021-04-15 loss of consciousness Partially lost smell; Partially lost taste; Headache; Short time "everything come black"/ short time... Read more
Close
Partially lost smell; Partially lost taste; Headache; Short time "everything come black"/ short time "black down"; Sore arm; Night time sweat; Short time "lost control of muscle of neck"; Dizziness; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Short time "everything come black"/ short time "black down") in a 20-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 037B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No reported medical history). On 10-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 10-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Short time "everything come black"/ short time "black down") (seriousness criterion medically significant), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Sore arm), NIGHT SWEATS (Night time sweat), MUSCLE DISCOMFORT (Short time "lost control of muscle of neck"), DIZZINESS (Dizziness) and HEADACHE (Headache). On 11-Apr-2021, the patient experienced HYPOSMIA (Partially lost smell) and DYSGEUSIA (Partially lost taste). On 10-Apr-2021, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Short time "everything come black"/ short time "black down") had resolved. On 11-Apr-2021, NIGHT SWEATS (Night time sweat), MUSCLE DISCOMFORT (Short time "lost control of muscle of neck"), DIZZINESS (Dizziness) and HEADACHE (Headache) had resolved. At the time of the report, PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Sore arm), HYPOSMIA (Partially lost smell) and DYSGEUSIA (Partially lost taste) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medications use was unknown. No treatment information was provided. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Patient started to feel chest tightness and tingling in his left arm. It then started to travel down his left leg. His arm was cold and numb at one point. He was concious but very confused and could not think straight. He had someone drive him to the ER. They did a CT scan, EKG, and other routine lab tests and all were normal. They attributed it to the vaccine.

20 2021-04-18 loss of consciousness, fainting Several minutes after receiving 1st dose of Moderna patient fainted and slid from chair onto floor. ... Read more
Close
Several minutes after receiving 1st dose of Moderna patient fainted and slid from chair onto floor. He was unresponsive for approximately 15-20 seconds and then regained consciousness. Pharmacist immediately took his blood pressure and it was 112/56. Patient stated that he was ok and had no trouble breathing. His grandmother accompanied him and they did not wish to call EMS. Patient was monitored for another 45 minutes and blood pressure was checked every 15 minutes where is was 122/64, 106/72, 107/78. After 45 minutes patient said he felt fine and wished to leave. Pharmacist accompanied patient to his car and grandmother drove him home.

Close
Vasovagal syncope induced from anxiety. While waiting in post vaccine observation while sitting, patient fainted briefly while still in chair. Mother braced him until I and my staff could assist. Elevated legs with another chair and provided and ice pack and bottle of water. After 5-10 minutes, the patient was fine and left without any issues.

Patient had vasovagal syncope ( due to anxiety) after being vaccinated roughly 5-10 minutes afterwards while sitting in post observation area. His mother was with him and propped him up from falling out of the chair until I and my other staff could assist. Propped his feet up with another chair, provided and ice pack and a bottle of water. Patient was fine after sitting for an additional 5-10 minutes.
20 2021-04-18 troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle, ejection fraction decreased, chest pain . He received his second Moderna vaccine on 04/15th. He did have localized pain in his arm and the... Read more
Close
. He received his second Moderna vaccine on 04/15th. He did have localized pain in his arm and the following day, had some headache and neck stiffness. Yesterday evening around 5 o' clock he developed left chest pain that has persisted. It has waxed and waned, but not disappeared. It reached an intensity of 7/10 prompting him to get a ride to the emergency room for evaluation. He was found to have myocarditis, with troponin elevation to 37 ng/mL, and globally reduced ejection fraction 45%. His care is ongoing.

Vital signs stable. No SOB or angioedema. No comorbidity. No history of cardiac problem. Planning to send patient to ED for further evaluation. Called attending Dr. per protocol and recommended patient to go to ED for further evaluation and stable to go by private car. 20 2021-04-19 pulmonary embolism, fast heart rate, fibrin d dimer increased, chest pain, palpitations, low platelet count Admission HPI: Right-sided chest pain began 2 days prior to admission (3/19) after getting out of ca... Read more
Close
Admission HPI: Right-sided chest pain began 2 days prior to admission (3/19) after getting out of car, without identifiable trigger. Pain was sharp, pleuritic, and worst with movement; didn't feel it when still. Pain not responsive to ibuprofen or heating packs. Reported 30-60 seconds of self-resolving heart racing during ocular migraine which has been his baseline for years. Not associated with SOB (at rest or with exercise), palpitations, presyncope, or syncope. No viral URI symptoms, N/V, or rash. He did receive his 2nd Moderna COVID vaccine about 1 week PTA, followed by 36hrs of fevers, chills, and body aches. Given persistence of pain, Patient asked his parents to present to urgent care. In UC, he was noted to tachycardic with CXR with bibasilar atelectasis and b/l effusions, per report. Given continued tachycardia, decision was made to transfer to ED to r/o PE. In ED, tachycardic to 104-116 and tachypneic 22-26. Had one episode of tachycardia to 182 iso ocular migraine. Endorsed chest pain but points to R middle abdomen when asked where worst. Exam was unremarkable. He received 1 dose of morphine which reduced pain from 10/10 to 0/10. Labs notable for leukocytosis (14.61), thrombocytopenia (422), elevated d-dimer (1.56), and elevated CRP (5.6). Otherwise normal chem and coags. COVID/RVP negative. CXR unremarkable. CTPA showed scattered PEs in b/l lower lobes with small pulmonary infarct in RML. No evidence of right heart strain. Heme was consulted who recommended starting him on lovenox and sending lupus anti-coagulant. Cardiology was consulted who recommended EKG, BNP, and troponin, all of which were normal and reassuring against right heart strain. ECHO was therefore deferred to the AM. The decision was made to admit. Upon arrival to the floor, Patient was tachycardic 114 and tachypneic to 22, otherwise stable vitals. He denied any pain since morphine. Denied any unexpected weight loss; reports that car ride was short. Mom reports that Patient has been less active d/t cold weather and baseball being on hold. Denies family or personal history of clots. Last seizure ~13 years ago. Hospital Course: (3/21 - 3/22) Patient was admitted to the hematology service. He was therapeutically anticoagulated with LMWH injections and his anti-Xa level prior to discharge was 0.92. (goal 0.5-1.0) Lower extremity ultrasound with Doppler showed patent veins and no evidence of DVT and upper extremity ultrasound showed no evidence of DVT, though there was potential evidence of collateralization seen in mid and distal third of right subclavian vein and left internal jugular vein. Since this was an unprovoked PE, a full thrombophilia workup was sent and will be followed up by the outpatient hematology clinic. Cardiology consulted regarding possibility of right heart strain and the tachycardia during migraine episodes. Echocardiogram performed on 3/22 was technically limited but showed no gross abnormalities. The cardiology team requested a repeat echo scheduled outpatient for 1-2 months after discharge.
20 2021-04-19 fainting Patient had bowel movement after waking up and going to bathroom. He fainted, calling for help to hi... Read more
Close
Patient had bowel movement after waking up and going to bathroom. He fainted, calling for help to his parents on his way down to the floor. Parents found him on floor cognitively responsives but not moving body (He does not remember anything after coming to kneel on floor). Parents found him clammy. Mother called 911 and was instructed to keep him lying on floor. He complained of being cold but was sweaty. Blanket placed over him on floor and kept there until EMS arrived. Patient c/o nausea. They got him into rolling chair and was going to leave when he had another episode of dizziness, clammy and nausea. EMS transported him to hospital. Blood work was done with no abnomalities noted. Upon discharge he complained of headache. Nausea dissipated upon eating and some ginger ale. Patient had previous had "covid arm" with first injection but no other complaints.

20 2021-04-21 pallor, fainting Patient had a vaso-vagal like / syncope-like reaction. His color drained from his face and he head ... Read more
Close
Patient had a vaso-vagal like / syncope-like reaction. His color drained from his face and he head was kind of limp, he responded to questions with great difficulty. He never lost consciousness. He stated like the room was fading away. We got him into the consultation room and had him lay down on the floor with his feet on a chair, to which he stated he felt better. The color came back to his face. He responded quicker to all questions and steadily improved. Next we moved him to legs straight, then sitting against the wall to sitting in a chair. Then he went back out the waiting chairs with his father.

Patient fainted a few minutes after receiving first dose of Moderna. He regained consciousness with 15-20 seconds. His blood pressure was taken at time of incident and was 112/56. He was monitored for 45 minutes after the event and blood pressure was taken every 15 minutes. He had no trouble breathing and recovered from the incident with no issues. He left with his grandmother and she did not wish to call EMS. Pharmacy called mom the next day to follow up and she stated that patient was doing fine other than having a sore arm.

He had an early lunch of turkey sandwich and apple at ~10:30am. Was given 4.6oz apple juice box which he consumed rapidly. Received 2nd juice box and crackers. 20 2021-04-23 inflammation of the pericardium, troponin increased, chest pain Patient had the common/expected fatigue/myalgia/low grade fever following the 2nd COVID vaccine. Th... Read more
Close
Patient had the common/expected fatigue/myalgia/low grade fever following the 2nd COVID vaccine. Then, once this resolved, he developed chest pain and shortness of breath. He was admitted to the hospital and found to have pericarditis with elevated troponin and mild/nonspecific EKG changes. He had echocardiogram, CT angio coronary, and cardiac MRI as part of evaluation. He was treated supportively with NSAIDs and discharged with only mild residual pain.

20 2021-05-02 fast heart rate, palpitations, atrial fibrillation Came into the ER with complaints of sudden-onset palpitations and tachycardia. Received COVID vaccin... Read more
Close
Came into the ER with complaints of sudden-onset palpitations and tachycardia. Received COVID vaccine 3 days ago (2nd Moderna Covid vaccination). Was found to be in AFib with RVR. Was given adenosine 6 mg x 1, then 12 mg x 1 en rote via EmS with no change to heart rate. When in the ER, his heart rate was 189. He was initially started on Cardizem drip. Admitted to CVU. Cardiology was consulted. An echocardiogram was ordered which did not show any significant abnormalities. No further workup recommended at this time. Hemodynamically stable for discharge. Recommend following up with primary care 2-4 weeks post discharge.
20 2021-05-03 chest pain, heart rate increased A few weeks after the vaccination, I was sitting in one of my college classes and out of nowhere my ... Read more
Close
A few weeks after the vaccination, I was sitting in one of my college classes and out of nowhere my heart rate increased significantly and I felt extremely lightheaded/panicked. Within 5 minutes I felt normal. Throughout the next week I had several similar episodes and experienced chest pain frequently. I have never had these symptoms before.
20 2021-05-03 loss of consciousness Passed out; broke his wrist; Extremely dizzy; Nauseated; This spontaneous case was reported by a pat... Read more
Close
Passed out; broke his wrist; Extremely dizzy; Nauseated; This spontaneous case was reported by a patient family member or friend and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) in a 20-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 25-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 25-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), WRIST FRACTURE (broke his wrist), DIZZINESS (Extremely dizzy) and NAUSEA (Nauseated). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out), WRIST FRACTURE (broke his wrist), DIZZINESS (Extremely dizzy) and NAUSEA (Nauseated) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. No treatment information was provided. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events ( loss of consciousness, dizziness and nausea), a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Based on reporter's causality the event of Wrist fracture is assessed as unlikely related to mRNA-1273..; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events ( loss of consciousness, dizziness and nausea), a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Based on reporter's causality the event of Wrist fracture is assessed as unlikely related to mRNA-1273..

Admitted 72 hours after 2nd Moderna dose with acute onset chest pain, EKG changes, positive troponin and elevated CRP. Coronary CT ruled out coronary disease. Transthoracic echocardiogram revealed EF 55-60% with inferior wall hypokinesis. Findings on cardiac MRI consistent with acute myopericarditis.

20 2021-05-06 fast heart rate 12 minutes after injection - local itching/redness. 30 min. after vaccination anaphylaxis with mult... Read more
Close
12 minutes after injection - local itching/redness. 30 min. after vaccination anaphylaxis with multiple organ involvement - skin injection site and uvula swelling and eyes itchy. Patient had angioedema of throat with swallowing difficulty. Had mild asthma/wheeze. Also had tachycardia and light headed when trying to sit up. Patient given Epi 0.3 ml IM, Benadryl 50 mg IM, and Pepcid 20 mg PO. Transported to hospital by EMS for 4-6 hour observation. Patient responded well to epi.
20 2021-05-07 loss of consciousness patient lost consciousness about 30 seconds after receiving the vaccine. Initially I treated it as a... Read more
Close
patient lost consciousness about 30 seconds after receiving the vaccine. Initially I treated it as a syncopal episode and was just trying to wake him up but he began to shake (seizure-like) after about 15 seconds. I could not rule out anaphylaxis so I administered a dose of epinephrine via epipen. Patient regained consciousness approximately 5 to 10 seconds after epipen. EMS arrived approximately 10 minutes later and took patient to the hospital for further observation. Patient vomited on ambulance ride but did not lose consciousness again. Patient reportedly fine after being administered fluids but reports no memory of ambulance ride or even being vaccinated.

After about 5 minutes he felt dizzy and lost consciousness for about 10 seconds but then regained consciousness. 911 was called and paramedics came to take pulse and blood pressure which were both normal. Patient chose to not go to the ER and his mother came to pick him up.

20 2021-05-11 heart attack, troponin increased Five days after receiving dose 1 of the Moderna COVID vaccine, this 20 year old man developed a spon... Read more
Close
Five days after receiving dose 1 of the Moderna COVID vaccine, this 20 year old man developed a spontaneous coronary artery dissection affecting his LAD and left circumflex arteries. This caused a ST elevation myocardial infarction. Pt received prompt stenting. His troponin peaked at 16,083 ng/L (high sensitivity test). He recovered well.

20 2021-05-12 loss of consciousness The night that I got the vaccine I got inflammation in my lower spine. I lost feeling in my lower le... Read more
Close
The night that I got the vaccine I got inflammation in my lower spine. I lost feeling in my lower legs. I could still move my legs, but they were numb. There were also a few moments of pain but mostly numbness. It lasted for two days. I was taking Ibuprofen and icing my lower back and the feeling slowly returned to my lower legs. The numbness was in both legs all the way to the hip. I also had lower back pain which went away at about the same time as I regained the feeling in my legs. After the second dose of the vaccine I had severe shaking and I passed out.

20 2021-05-13 troponin increased, chest pain Patient is a 20 y.o. male with no significant past medical history presenting with acute burning ret... Read more
Close
Patient is a 20 y.o. male with no significant past medical history presenting with acute burning retrosternal chest pain and diaphoresis, found to have diffuse concave STE with PR depressions and reciprocal changes in AVR, along with significant troponin elevation (peaked at 8K), c/f STEMI, LHC therefore pursued on 5/13 which revealed clean coronaries. TTE also with pEF and no WMA. Of note, pt recently received 2nd dose of Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine, myopericarditis therefore considered, CRP elevated at 45, subsequently started on high dose ASA + colchicine therapy. CMR also pursued and was noted to be unremarkable. Pt without return of presenting chest pain.

Stood up to go to the observation chair after getting vaccine. After sitting down at observation area, heart rate seemed to drop/become abnormal, and I began to lose hearing, and vision began to get fuzzy. The pharmacist accompanied me as I was experiencing symptoms, talking me through things. I then began to get profuse cold sweats, after which I asked for water. After drinking a bottle of water and not moving for about 15 minutes, everything turned to relative normalcy. I was able to walk home afterwards.

20 2021-05-20 fainting The patient received his second dose of vaccine in his left arm at 4:24 pm. He did not report any pr... Read more
Close
The patient received his second dose of vaccine in his left arm at 4:24 pm. He did not report any prior history of syncopy. He was walking towards the EMT/Cot area and, at 4:28pm, experienced a syncopal like episode and began to fall to the floor. He was caught prior to hitting the floor by his father and EMT. The EMT guided the patient to the cot. RN's responded. Pt was alert and oriented at time of RN arrival to scene. Pt was assisted supine position, with legs elevated. AN ice pack was applied to base of his neck and pt was provided with juice and crackers. He reported to RN that he has a history of syncope and that he faints when he gets shots. Pt vital signs were monitored for 10 minutes and pt was monitored by EMT x 20 minutes. Pt left facility at 4:50 PM with his father, denies any pain, sob or discomfort.

20 2021-05-25 hypotension Patient became dizzy, nauseous, and had difficulty seeing approximately 15 minutes after his vaccine... Read more
Close
Patient became dizzy, nauseous, and had difficulty seeing approximately 15 minutes after his vaccine. Checked patients blood pressure which was low 70s/50s mmhg initially, patient remained conscious the entire time. He had no trouble breathing or swallowing. Patient was given a cold water and stated this helped. after initial BP reading EMS was called. Patients BP gradually rose and was 110/74 mmhg when EMS arrived. Glucose was also tested and was 101. Patient was feeling much better and declined transport to the hospital.

20 2021-06-09 chest pain, inflammation of the pericardium, inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased Patient received his second Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 6/5. Approx 5-8 hours after the vaccination,... Read more
Close
Patient received his second Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 6/5. Approx 5-8 hours after the vaccination, he developed severe chest pain, which has remained constant since that time. No fevers. No shortness of breath. No sick contacts at home. No h/o prior vaccine reactions. Presented to the emergency department on 6/8 due to persistent chest pain; found to have diffuse ST elevations on EKG and elevated troponin to 2.1 concerning for acute myopericarditis. Admitted to the children's hospital for work up and treatment. Remained hemodynamically stable throughout stay. Troponins peaked at 2.8. Echocardiogram showed normal cardiac function. Patient was started on 3 week course of ibuprofen for treatment of pericarditis. Cardiac MRI performed; initial read showed myocardial and pericardial inflammation. Awaiting final read at this time. Patient hospitalized for two days and sent home with close cardiac follow up.

When I went over patient was alert and responsive. Asked patient and mother if they prefer I call an ambulance, both declined. Patient states no history of syncope after injections. Had him transition from lying on floor to sitting on floor, then sitting on chair, and then eventually standing on his own. Patient stated he felt fine and was ok to go home.

21 2021-02-04 chest pain I obtained my booster shot on my left deltoid at 2:30 PM 2/4/2021. I had slight soreness in my arm t... Read more
Close
I obtained my booster shot on my left deltoid at 2:30 PM 2/4/2021. I had slight soreness in my arm til 8:00 which the soreness disappeared. Around 2:00 AM, I was awakened by a pounding headache, fever of 102, and my upper left chest (unilateral between the midline of my left chest and the axillary region) started to hurt. I took Tylenol 1000 mg at 3 and took a hot bath (recommended by friend who also displayed a fever and headache). After a while, my fever began to lower but my headache and chest pain did not disappear and I could not sleep until 7 AM. I woke up today (2/5/2021) at 10 AM with a fever of 101.4, another pounding headache, and still unilateral chest pain. I took another 1000 mg of Tylenol around 10:30 AM and it only helped with the fever. I went back to sleep and slept until 4 PM. I understand that the fever and headache are normal symptoms but my chest pain does not seem like muscle soreness. It doesn't hurt when I touch it, it comes and goes every few seconds, I have 4 or 5/ 10 on the pain scale for most of the pain but it turns into 6 or 7/10 occasionally (10 being the worst pain). What does help with my pain when it is 6 or 7/10 is when I clench my chest really hard like I am flexing it. It is a sharp pain that stays for a few seconds before it disappears and it feels like a deep pain. I didn't want to take Tylenol again because I am about to max out (can only take 2 more capsules until 2:00 AM because it states not to take more than 6 capsules in 24 hours, and each capsule is 500 mg) (Also, the Tylenol does not help with the pain so I am only taking it for my fever.) I was wondering if anyone else reported this and if this is an adverse side effect. This has not cause any issues regarding my breathing but just pain.

21 2021-03-03 chest pain Vaccine was Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA 4 days after receiving the vaccine, two hours after I woke ... Read more
Close
Vaccine was Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA 4 days after receiving the vaccine, two hours after I woke up, I began to have mild chest pain in the center of my chest. After that, the pain started to grow and grow until it was extreme pain, at around an 8/10. The pain radiated from my chest to the undersides of my arms. After two hours of pain, it started to subside and eventually was gone. There was no pain for the rest of the day. The next day, two hours after I woke up again, the mild chest pain returned. Still in the center of my chest, the pain grew into extreme pain again. This time however, it was slightly to the right and as the pain progressed it moved right until after two hours it went away again. The treatment I got at the Urgent Care was an EKG and they told me to go to a hospital. At the hospital, I got Toradol, aspirin and propanolol. My initial Troponin levels at admission to the hospital were 900 and grew to 1300. It lowered for a time, but at the last check, it rose again to 1420 after not getting Toradol for at least 12 hours.
21 2021-03-03 fainting, hypotension Syncopal Episode, Hypotension

Close
Started with pain in the abdomen then spread upwards into chest. Serve pain around ribs making it hard to breathe. Vomited and symptoms went away for ten minutes. Pain came back gradually in same spots. This was cyclical occurance and then just stopped.
21 2021-03-14 pallor 3:42 pm Pt received vaccination, stood up and c/o of feeling light headed, dizzy and body tingles. H... Read more
Close
3:42 pm Pt received vaccination, stood up and c/o of feeling light headed, dizzy and body tingles. He became diaphoretic, pale and warm. Vaccinator put ice pack to back of neck, brought to recovery area in wheel chair VS 120/78, HR 81 reg, resps 16 regular non labored, 96% O2 sat. gave water to hydrate. no c/o N/V Monitored for 30 min Pt state he felt better, tingles diminished, color came back to face, no more diaphoresis. Provided reassurance. Encourage hydration. V-safe site. Ok'd to leave site. RN 3/9/21 - called pt to check condition he stated he is doing very well. RN
21 2021-03-14 lightheadedness I almost fainted the night after my shot. I had vaped cannabis prior at around 1:00am, and probably ... Read more
Close
I almost fainted the night after my shot. I had vaped cannabis prior at around 1:00am, and probably re-dosed at around 3:00AM, before falling asleep at around 4:30AM. I had a harder than normal time falling asleep that night, and I didn't sleep very well. At around 6:00AM I woke up and walked to the bathroom, feeling pain in my anal region. As I started to sweat profusely, I recognized that I was likely about to faint, so I pre-emptively lied down on the floor of the bathroom until I felt well enough to stand up. I don't remember exactly how long I was on the floor but most likely a few minutes. I then had a bowel movement, still feeling pain in my anal region but to a lesser degree, and then drank some water and went back to sleep at around 6:30AM.
21 2021-03-14 troponin increased, chest pain, fibrin d dimer increased, inflammation of the heart muscle, inflammation of the pericardium "Moderna" Adverse vaccine reaction possible as began 12 hours post second COVID vaccine dose on Frid... Read more
Close
"Moderna" Adverse vaccine reaction possible as began 12 hours post second COVID vaccine dose on Friday. A ER note was generated in a T-Con on a patient who got their 2nd Covid Vaccine and began experiencing chest pain approx. 12 hours post vaccine. Patient did not report to the ER until 28Feb21. It was discussed that he has myocarditis v pericarditis, elevated D-Dimer of 770, swollen lymph nodes, and elevated Troponin. Patient was transferred to Research Medical Center due to no available beds. Patient was referred to a Case Manager and Cardiology. The patient completed a follow up appointment with 509 MDG on 9Mar21 and reported Dull pain that has been affecting sleep. Cardiology reports shows Troponin was elevated to 9.1 decreased to 4.2 and back up again to 13.4. Cardiac revealed late gadolinium enhancement, possibly representing myocarditis and then at discharge possibly myocarditis.

Immediately after injection I had soreness and several notable heart palpitations followed by mild dizziness and mild difficulty breathing accompanied with dry mouth. This subsided after a short while (within 15) minutes after I left the vaccine location. I arrived home and felt fatigue and a slight headache develop. The headache has since stopped. I also experienced some chills. No fever as of yet. Soreness at injection site is moderate.

Parent was called right after the student experienced adverse reaction. Vital signs taken B/P 128/88, Pulse - 80, Pulse oximetry - 99 %, temperature was 97.4. Patient had not prior history of COVID-19, not taking any medications, no hypertension. Patient became alert 30 seconds afterwards.

PT HAD SEVERAL SEIZURE EPISODES. PT REGAINED CONSCIOUSNESS AND BECAME RESPONSIVE AFTER ABOUT 2 MINUTES. PARAMEDICS CAME AND TOOK OVER. PER PT, NO PRIOR HISTORY OF SEIZURE OR MEDICAL CONDITION. 21 2021-03-31 loss of consciousness A spontaneous report was received from a consumer (United States) concerning a 21-year-old, male pat... Read more
Close
A spontaneous report was received from a consumer (United States) concerning a 21-year-old, male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced fell out of the chair and passed out/Loss of consciousness, fell out of the chair and passed out/Fall, may have been a seizure but unsure/seizure. The patient's medical history included psychological problems. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. On an unknown date, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number unknown) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On an unknown date, after the injection he "fell out of the chair and passed out". The reporter stated that she heard it "may have been a seizure but unsure". She reported the male was obese. The events passed out and seizure was considered as medically significant. Treatment information was not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The outcome of the events fell out of the chair and passed out, may have been a seizure but unsure was unknown at the time of this report.; Reporter's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
21 2021-03-31 loss of consciousness Pharmacy staff was alerted by patient's girlfriend that he had passed out. I went to the waiting are... Read more
Close
Pharmacy staff was alerted by patient's girlfriend that he had passed out. I went to the waiting area where she was propping him up in a chair. Patient was not responsive and completely limp. Together we lowered him to the floor where he quickly began to regain consciousness and tried to sit up. Patient was fairly alert within 1-2 minutes. Patient was given water, ice packs for the back of his neck and forehead, and ED was called. Patient stated he was feeling much better and did not need EMS, but due to store policy they were called. Patient relayed a history of fainting after receiving tattoos, that was not notated on his form. Patient remained on floor until EMS arrived about 20 minutes later and checked on patient. Patient's heart rate and BP were taken by EMS laying down, sitting, and standing and was cleared by EMS to leave.
21 2021-04-03 nosebleed, fainting, loss of consciousness 8:00 woke up very tired and decided to stay in bed and rest. 11:00 When woke up again I felt sick to... Read more
Close
8:00 woke up very tired and decided to stay in bed and rest. 11:00 When woke up again I felt sick to the stomach and had the urge to throw up. While rushing to the bathroom I lost consciousness and fainted. Hit my face against the tub and the wall. My nose was bleeding and went to the emergency room. 11:45 in the emergency room they took blood samples, a head scan and put me on an I.V. for 45 minutes.
21 2021-04-03 heart rate increased, pulse abnormal My left arm was sore starting a few minutes after the vaccine. This soreness last through that night... Read more
Close
My left arm was sore starting a few minutes after the vaccine. This soreness last through that night. When I woke up the next day, my arm was extremely sore and I was very dizzy. Additionally, my pulse felt fast but my heartbeat seemed to have less strength. My breathing felt more shallow like I wasn't getting as much oxygen from the air that I breathed in as I should. For the first two weeks, the dizziness was very strong. Now, at the three-week mark, it is more manageable and life is somewhat returning to normal. I visited an ENT doctor and their diagnosis was that my dizziness was not being caused by a preexisting medical condition. Their prediction was that I would be fine, though looking back, I downplayed the severity of my vertigo. At its worst, I felt that, when I went for a walk outside, the surface was the Earth was violently spinning through space, with me stuck to the surface. It felt paralyzing. My body felt almost stuck in shock. I was afraid I would be stuck with this dizziness for the rest of my life since it was so long-lasting. Now, I am taking ginger pills and am watching my sodium intake. I feel better but am extra vigilant about taking ginger and not stressing myself too much. I do not plan on getting a second shot since some of my symptoms mirror those of anaphylaxis.

Close
Pt fainted immediately after receiving vaccine. Regained consciousness after 15-20 seconds. Got patient to floor and feet elevated. Monitored blood pressure until it returned to normal.
21 2021-04-06 fainting After receiving the vaccine while in the observation area patient's vision started getting blurry an... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine while in the observation area patient's vision started getting blurry and he started feeling dizzy. (about 10 minutes after vaccine) He walked back to talk to us, while pharmacist was asking him questions he swayed and fainted. Pharmacist caught him and lowered him to the floor. Called 911 and paged MIC. Pharmacist stayed with the patient who gained back consciousness and placed him in recovery position until paramedics arrived.
21 2021-04-07 pallor, fainting Patient stated he started to feel unwell a few minutes after the vaccine, then started to feel light... Read more
Close
Patient stated he started to feel unwell a few minutes after the vaccine, then started to feel light headed, nauseous, dizzy. He reported he felt like he was about to pass out, he felt he had dry mouth and was thirsty. To provider he appeared pale and sweating. He was instructed to sit in chair and lean forward with head down towards knees. He was provided water and his blood pressure was taken. The first reading was 89/66 pulse 74. He stated he was not sure what his normal pressure was, but was usually low. He also stated that he had a light breakfast, and didn't really drink much that day. After his pressure was taken he reported to feel slightly better, and was observed for another 25-30 minutes. After this time passed, his blood pressure was taken again, and reading was 102/74 and his color appeared better, and was more alert. After a few more minutes, he said he felt much better. He also had eaten crackers at this time. He was provided v-safe form again, and encouraged to sign up for follow-up, and to continue to monitor closely any symptoms for at least the next 6 hours.

Close
Blood pressure and heart rate sky rocketed immediately after shot-did not come down and after an hour went to the ER- was in the ER for 8 hours with continued symptoms. This is a young man with no precious hx of this. Hospital would not entertain the idea this was related to the vaccine. Was discharged with instructions to return if worse in the AM. Continued high blood pressure and heart rate for another 24 hrs. Swollen lymph nodes by the next day. Blood work in hospital showed immune response happening but again hospital would not attribute to vaccine.

Close
Patient passed out roughly 5-10 minutes following vaccine while seated on a planter; witnessed by store employee. Hit his head causing a small laceration above the right eyebrow which was cleaned with alcohol and bandaged prior to EMS arrival. The patient experienced dizziness and numbness/tingling in both hands/arms. He was able to tell RPh his name, the year, and knew where he was. Paramedics were called to assess his condition. Per patient and mother, only underlying condition is anxiety and only medication is zoloft.

21 2021-04-09 lightheadedness tunnel vision for a bit which then went away; felt like fainting; tinging in his toes and left arm a... Read more
Close
tunnel vision for a bit which then went away; felt like fainting; tinging in his toes and left arm and fingers.; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of TUNNEL VISION (tunnel vision for a bit which then went away) in a 21-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 031A217) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No reported medical history). On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced TUNNEL VISION (tunnel vision for a bit which then went away) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PRESYNCOPE (felt like fainting) and PARAESTHESIA (tinging in his toes and left arm and fingers.). At the time of the report, TUNNEL VISION (tunnel vision for a bit which then went away), PRESYNCOPE (felt like fainting) and PARAESTHESIA (tinging in his toes and left arm and fingers.) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No concomitant medications were provided. Treatment information were not reported.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
21 2021-04-10 pallor, fainting, pulse abnormal Pt Fainted shortly after receiving vaccination. Pt came for a moderna covid vaccine with his friend,... Read more
Close
Pt Fainted shortly after receiving vaccination. Pt came for a moderna covid vaccine with his friend, both first doses. Pt said he "fainted recently" from a shot where he fainted "for a couple minutes" according to his nurse, and he was sure it was psychologically induced by anxiety. He said he was more mentally prepared this time. After I gave the dose to him and his friend, he got lightheaded and slowly started losing consciousness in his seat after a few minutes. Pt was alert and responded to our questions. I quickly stepped out to give the pt a bottle of water, and upon coming back to the IMZ room, his friend said he urinated himself. He was less responsive, but still alert. I notified the technician. He started to turn pale and felt more cold. He pulse was weak. I encouraged the pt's friend to keep him alert while we call EMS. I reminded the pt to keep breathing. The technician called EMS, and I stayed with the patient to kept him calm, but alert until EMS arrived. Pt slowly felt better after a few minutes (color return, and temperature normalized). Pt said he was okay, and he was able to walk. EMS arrived and tested blood sugar; he was within normal range. Pt did not need EMS service, and went home with friend.

21 2021-04-13 loss of consciousness Client passed out while seated in observation falling to the right side of the chair and onto the gr... Read more
Close
Client passed out while seated in observation falling to the right side of the chair and onto the ground Client landed face down on the floor and was turned over onto his side first before being flipped onto his back Client?s head did hit the ground Client reportedly appeared to be having a seizure when he was turned over Multiple people were present to assist client including nurse and EMT At12:09, LVN called 911 and relayed information to the dispatch While on the phone, nurse went to get an Ambu-bag because staff present reported that the Client stopped breathing but had a pulse Upon bringing the Ambu-bag, the Client had already regained normal breathing pattern and no longer needed assistance breathing . Ambu-bag was present but was not used Client was assisted into a wheelchair and taken to the private recovery area. Physician, nurse, and EMT were present Client was alert enough to answer questions Client began to vomit / dry-heave for a short moment Client asked EMT about transport billing and was informed that he might possibly get a bill but that he had the option to choose not to pay it At 12:20, Vitals taken BP 155/112, Pulse 64 Client informed of the need to be further evaluated at the hospital Client verbalized multiple times that he did not want to be transported even after speaking with the physician Physician suspected that the client had some underlining reason that he did not want to disclose regarding his refusal to be transported At 12:25, Vitals taken BP 135/83, Pulse 58, O Sat 97% Blood sugar reading 104 Client reports no pain in the head, no nausea Client reports that he did not eat anything prior to coming At 12:31, Ambulance arrives EMT briefs paramedic regarding the incident and the client?s history Paramedics questioned client Client signed form and verbalized that he did not want to be transported and felt well enough to leave Client called his brother to drive him home At 12:41 Client was wheeled in the wheelchair to the car Client informed of selfcare and instructed to go to the hospital / ER if symptoms worsen or headaches develop Client informed to let further vaccine administrators know that he passed out in the past and needs to have the injection lying down Client verbalized understanding Client?s brother drove him home

pt experienced what appeared to be a vaso vagal episode. pt had fainted in his seat and was attented to by ems staff. pt was wheelchaired out to hall way for evaluation. pt vitasl were taken at 205pm bp 76/45 hr 55 spo2 96% rr 18. pt admitted to presvious experience whengiving blood. pt complained of tension in chest. pt was placed on 4 lead ekg and found to be in what appeared to be normal sinus rhythm. pt vitasl wre taken again at 2:15pm bp 105/67 hr 65 rr 18 spo2 100% ra. pt was "feeling better" and was able to walk out of vaccine clinic unassisted.
21 2021-04-14 loss of consciousness At the pre-counsel stage, the patient said that he was a little nervous about getting this immunizat... Read more
Close
At the pre-counsel stage, the patient said that he was a little nervous about getting this immunization, but wanted to go ahead and do it. I counseled him on the immunization and sent him into the booth to get the shot. Technician administered the vaccine and then told Technician that he felt a little nauseous. Technician told him to stay seated. A few seconds later the patient passed out and started slipping down the chair. Technician grabbed him from behind and called me over to assist. I yelled for Staff to call 9-1-1 and a code white. I held him from the front and Technician held him from the back and we slowly lowered the patient to the floor. Technician sat behind the patient to hold him up while I assessed the patient and tried see if he was responsive. The patient was breathing and had a pulse, so I patted him on the face and chest to see if he would become responsive. After about 15 seconds, the patient became responsive and confused. He asked what happened and if he got the shot yet or not. After talking to the patient for a moment he said he was fine, but needed to vomit. I gave him a trash can and he vomited. We gave the patient some water and sat with him on the ground for a few minutes until the paramedics arrived. The paramedics took the patient's vitals and the patient said he felt fine and declined going to the hospital. We had the patient sit in the observation area for another 30 minutes. He said he felt totally fine and was ready to go home.

Shortly thereafter, his head rolled back and he slumped in the chair for ~10 seconds before regaining consciousness. 21 2021-04-18 loss of consciousness, pallor While giving the patient his first vaccination, the needle was not properly secured to the syringe a... Read more
Close
While giving the patient his first vaccination, the needle was not properly secured to the syringe and the two parts separated while giving the vaccine. He got at least part of the dose, but we discussed giving him a second shot so he could receive the full dose. The patient seemed fine so I went to draw up the next dose, and as I was doing that, he started to get a little pale and said he was not feeling well. I gave him some water and sat with him while he was in a chair. He then began to fall forward and was unconscious. I caught him before he hit the ground, laid him down on his side, and he woke up fairly quickly after. We did not administer the rest of the dose and the patient waited around the pharmacy for 30 minutes, but he stated he felt much better with no concerns fairly quickly after the reaction.

Upon shaking by RPh, pt opened his eyes and looked at her and said "I'm okay. I don't know how I got here." He reported no dizziness before or after fainting, and said he felt fine. Paramedics were called, arriving after 15 or 20 minutes, during which pt was alert and oriented.

21 2021-04-21 loss of consciousness Patient received vaccine in left deltoid and immediately responded which looked like a short seizure... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine in left deltoid and immediately responded which looked like a short seizure, losing consciousness shortly, then upon shaking responded by waking back up. Within the next few minutes the patient did the exact same thing and again responded after shaking by waking back up. Patient felt hot, weak and nauseous for quite a long time, he eventually vomited and thought he felt a little better. We called EMS and they responded by checking him over (B.S. 79 and Blood Pressure initially 87/60 but a repeat reading was 105/74 and patient felt well enough to decline a trip to the hospital. Patient was still feeling weak, so we observed him for over 2 hours and he took some water and drank some gatorade. After a bit we had him call his mother to drive him home. Patient was standing when we had one of our interns take him to his mother's car.

Patent received the shot, was given a 15 minute timer until it was safe for him to leave, He went out and sat in the waiting room until his time was up. Approx, 10 minutes later I heard a noise and looked over at his and noticed he was started to fall out of his chair. He then became as stiff as a board and I held him in place until he came to. He was seemingly scared and not aware of his surroundings. He said that he was feeling better but was still light headed. He was given an icepack and water and took his mask off. He looked pale. He started to feel better and left approx 10 minutes after this happened. He told me that he was feeling dizzy before he passed out.

Close
Client stated he did not like needles and did almost pass out last time he got a vaccine. Client was given moderna vaccine in left deltoid and was asked to stay seated, but the client said he felt fine, that it was a small needle so he was allowed to walk to the waiting area and went to get a snack also. About 5 min after this I was called to the client as he was being lowered to the ground by his sister and MA with department. The client was unresponsive for about a min. We raised his legs and he regained consciousness soon after, and was able to open his eyes and talk. About 3 min later client sat up on the ground, no other injuries per the client. 21 2021-05-11 inflammation of the heart muscle, inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain This is a very pleasant and healthy 21-year-old with history of migraines with aura who presents to ... Read more
Close
This is a very pleasant and healthy 21-year-old with history of migraines with aura who presents to the ER 2 days after receiving his second Materna vaccine with complaint of chest pain, myalgias and fatigue. Patient reports normal postvaccination myalgias and fatigue for the last 2 days but had onset of left-sided chest pain that radiates to his upper back and is worse with deep inspiration, some positions and movement of his left upper extremity. He denies cough, shortness of breath or rash. He is low risk for pulmonary embolism with PERC score negative for PE. Screening EKG showed a sinus rhythm with elevated J point in anterior-lateral leads, ? ST elevation in 1 and AVL w questionable reciprocal changes in leads 3 and AVF. Patient went to CXR. Clinically very low risk patient for STEMI from CAD. ? Myocarditis or pericarditis? No hx of stimulant use or early CAD in family. Upon reevaluating the patient, clinically he seems to have musculoskeletal chest discomfort, worse with palpation and movement of LUE. Repeated EKG - showed more definative ST elevation through anterior and lateral leads with reciprocal changes in 2, 3, AVF. Slight ST elevation in AVL. ? Pericarditis vs myocarditis. Will call cardiac alert. Evolving EKG changes. Discussed with ED physician and Interventional Cardiology, we agreed, patient likely has acute myocarditis clinically. Very low risk for CAD. Gave aspirin and heparin. They will evaluate him. Labs coming back... wbc 17.4, normal chemistry. Sending off CRP, ESR. Troponin pending. Patient and family appreciative and understanding. 1710 - Follow up call from cardiology. Stat echo normal wall motion. With elevated CRP and mild trop 1.6, patient has myocarditis with pericarditis. Dr very appreciative for the detailed history and physical. CP free. Holding off on cath lab.

Patient received his Moderna vaccine and immediately (10-15 seconds) appeared to be seizing. His muscles were tensed, tonic clonic, he was pale, hot to the touch, and excessively sweating. However, the fire department reported it as a syncopal episode. The fire department paramedics came and monitored him until his family came to pick him up. His pulse was 57, blood pressure was 102/54, respirations 20, glucose 116, pulse of 96. Patient denied treatment to the hospital and requested to go with his parents. His dad is a physician.

Close
He had Moderna vaccine #2 on 5/13/2021. The day after the vaccination he had fevers and chills. Two days after his vaccination (5/15/2021) he developed mild midsternal chest pain. This worsened and on 5/16/2021 he felt like someone was sitting on his chest. This pain was worse with deep breaths and radiated to his shoulders. He sought care at an urgent care clinic where EKG unexpectedly showed diffuse ST elevations. He was referred to the ED where he had an elevated troponin and there was concern for myocarditis. TTE done showed a normal ejection fraction and normal heart valves. He denies recent illnesses. He denies recent sore throats or skin infections. He works in the hospitality industry but denies known recent COVID-19 infection. Since admission he was seen by cardiology and was started on colchicine, indomethacin, and protonix. Telemetry has been reassuring. He reports feeling much better.

Patient was given vaccine. He did not state he was scared of needles. i asked him to have seat outside pharmacy for 15 minutes to observe him. His friend with him said he passed out in the chair sitting down.We called 911 and I went to assess him and spoke to him and touched him with no response. He proceeded to slide out of chair and I brought him to the floor and laid his to the side. He twitched and eyes fluttered. I then injected him with epi-pen thinking he may have been having an allergic response. His skin was white. After injection his coloring came back and slowly started to speak.He was able to form sentences. Police and EMS came and assessed him within 10 minutes and took his blood pressure. He was coherent and coloring resumed on patients face. Patient stated he had a little of tingling and mentioned he passes out occasionally after giving blood. Patient was released and aunt came to store and did not seek any further medical attention even though ems wanted him to get checked out. Blood pressure continued to rise and EMS believes patient had vasophagal syncope.

21 2021-05-23 chest pain, troponin increased Day 4 (April 30) After 2nd vaccine dose: chest pain started and continued through the night. . Day 5... Read more
Close
Day 4 (April 30) After 2nd vaccine dose: chest pain started and continued through the night. . Day 5 (May 1) after 2nd dose: chest pain intensified. Visit Urgent Care where EKG abnormal, chest X-ray okay. Sent to ER on basis of abnormal EKG. At ER (still day 5 (May 1) after 2nd dose) echocardiogram normal. EKG abnormal. Blood labs showed elevated Enzyme Troponin (7-8ng/ml). Admitted to hospital. Started colchicine 0.6 mg 2x/day. Troponin levels continued to rise and elevated to 12 ng/ml within 24 hrs from start of meds. Took another 36 hrs to bring Troponin down to 6 ng/ml. Sent home May 3 where continued Meds.

Close
This is a 21 year old male who had his first dose Moderna vaccine on 3/18/21 (lot#001B21A) and second dose on 5/9/21 (lot#024C21A). On 5/13/21, the patient presented to the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath, chest pain, 'sharp shooting pain going up my leg/thigh,' pain 5/10, and nausea. Onset on 5/12/21. The patient has a history of a recent ED admission on 4/24/21 for abdominal pain, felt to be related to a recent diagnosis of hepatic stenosis, biliary sludge (unrelated to the 5/9/21 ED visit, however notable; discharged to home to f/u with established surgeon). The patient stated that this may be related to chronic anxiety. ED provider determined that acute chest pain was likely due to anxiety and/or a vaccine reaction. The patient was discharged to home with instructions to f/u if needed. No additional chart documentation available since discharge.

21 2021-05-26 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain, troponin increased For the next few days after I received the second dose of the vaccine, I experienced muscle and body... Read more
Close
For the next few days after I received the second dose of the vaccine, I experienced muscle and body aces, fatigue, and a low grade fever. About 3 days after getting the vaccine I woke up at about 2 AM on the 18th with severe chest pain, the other side effects had subsided at this point. I ended up going to the ER after about a half hour of the pain not going away. They ran a Troponin blood test and foinf my levels to be high. They also tested me for Covid which came back positive. They ended up doing an ultrasound of my heart, using a catheter to take a look at my arteries, a chest xray, a CT scan, and an EKG. The final diagnosis was myocarditis of the heart. I had to stay in the hospital for a few days while my heart stabilized. I was given orders to only participate in light exercise and to take it easy for now. I have a follow up visit with the cardiologist in about a week frok now. It was also found out through testing that I may have Wolf Parkinson's white syndrome.

Patient received 1st dose of Moderna vaccine around 1445 on 4/6/2021 after waiting in the waiting area for about 13 min he got up and spoke to EMT stationed at the first aid and asked if 'he was supposed to be feeling this way' and then he had an episode of syncope - the EMT caught him and lowered him into chair. He was also very pale. EMS were called around 1516 patient's VS were BP 92/52, HR 42, R 10, 02 95%. When EMS arrived they attempted to do orthostatic BO his seated BP was still low (I don't have reading) and when they stood him up he got woozy again so they seated him. The decision was made for him to be taken to ER by EMS Transport. Patient denies any medical history or NKDA. Tr

21 2021-06-15 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain Patient had and uneventful COVID 19 infection in Dec 2019. Recovered quickly and completely. Had Mod... Read more
Close
Patient had and uneventful COVID 19 infection in Dec 2019. Recovered quickly and completely. Had Moderna Vaccine April 29, 2021 with only a temporary low grade fever as the side effect. Underwent his second Monderna vaccine June 6, 2021 and 2 days later developed a high grade fever and severe chest pain. Admitted to the hospital and had a positive troponin I to 18. Also COVID SARS 19 PCR positive on admission. Cardiac Cath showed normal coronaries with non thrombosis. Cardiologist confirmed acute myocarditis due to troponins, chest pain, and segmental wall motion abnormalities by Cath and echocardiogram. ID has been consulted and confirmed diagnosis as well.

HE REGAINED CONSCIOUSNESS ALMOST IMMEDIATELY AND REMEMBERED EVERYTHING THAT HAPPENED. BUT HE TOLD ME THAT HE FELT VERY DIZZY. I HAD HIM LAY DOWN ON HIS SIDE. HE WAS ALSO SWEATY. 22 2021-02-01 platelet count decreased Low count platelets; Convulsions after vaccination without lose of consciousness; A spontaneous repo... Read more
Close
Low count platelets; Convulsions after vaccination without lose of consciousness; A spontaneous report was received from a pharmacist concerning a 22-year-old male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced convulsions without loss of consciousness and low platelet count. The patient's medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications were not provided. On 28 Dec 2020, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 for the prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 28 Dec 2020, after getting vaccinated, the patient immediately started to experience tremors and shaking all over his body which was described as convulsions without losing consciousness. On 05 Jan 2021, the patient had a blood test that showed a low platelet count. No treatment information was provided. Action taken for the event was not reported. The outcome of the events, convulsions without loss of consciousness and low platelet count, was considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 22-year old male patient. The medical history is not provided. The patient experienced a medically significant and unexpected medically significant event of Convulsions without losing consciousness immediately after receiving their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot unknown). Additionally, the patient experienced an unexpected non-serious event of Platelet count decreased. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded and the events are considered possibly related to the vaccine.

Nausea, light headed, hot flashes, oxygen level decrease, blood pressure decrease, heart rate decrease, temperature decrease. All in cycles of 10 minutes on, a few minutes off. Was put on oxygen, sent to hospital in ambulance, and given 2 bags of fluid through an IV

22 2021-02-14 loss of consciousness After about 15 minutes the subject asked to use a pulse oximeter, reading normal. Then said it was l... Read more
Close
After about 15 minutes the subject asked to use a pulse oximeter, reading normal. Then said it was like looking in a tunnel. We asked him to sit an d applied an ice pack to the back of the neck. At the time this provider did not know the patient had a seizure disorder. He slid to the floor with full tonic clonic involvement. His head and neck were protected. 911 was called and an ambulance. After about 3 minutes the subject regained consciousness. He did not wish to be checked out at the hospital. He signed a release and his mother picked him up
22 2021-02-18 heart rate decreased Patient got lightheaded and clammy. Eyes rolled to back of head about 3 minutes after injection. MT ... Read more
Close
Patient got lightheaded and clammy. Eyes rolled to back of head about 3 minutes after injection. MT assessed pulse, slow but steady. RE got BP cuff and took BP. 1st BP reading was 146/96 with pulse of 59. Sat O2 was 100% Staff went to get patient water per patient request. Resident claims he 'lost hearing' for a small time period. BP reading at 1147 was 148/91. SS, CNP, was summoned to vaccination area to assess patient. Spoke with patient / family. He has had similar reaction before after knee surgery. Patient feeling better. CNP requests continued observation until DBP is below 80. BP reading at 1153 is 135/79. Patient released from observation and left vaccination clinic.

Close
One minute following vaccination, patient hunched over and fainted. Nursing staff lowered patient off chair and onto floor, raised patient feet above heart level. Patient woke 15 sec later and sat up slowly. Patient given juice and granola bar. Patient observed for total of 50 minutes. Patient vitals remained within normal limits throughout observation period. Patient released after reporting feeling better and all symptoms diminished. No other severe symptoms or concerns noted during observation period noted.

22 2021-02-26 increased heart rate, chest pain, troponin increased Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA The patient was in his usual state of health until he received his seco... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA The patient was in his usual state of health until he received his second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on Tuesday 2/23. He had previously had no side effects from the first dose other than soreness at the injection site. After the 2nd dose, he noticed arm soreness at the injection site more quickly than before. 10-12 hours later, he noticed headache and subjective fever, which was relieved by Tylenol. On Wednesday he woke up with subjective fever and chills, and felt sternal chest pain during deep breathing and attempted cough, but did not notice any effect from positional changes. Other than attempting to cough to elicit pain, he did not experience any other symptoms such as runny nose, coughing, sneezing, congestion, shortness of breath, palpitations, abdominal pain, diarrhea, or dysuria. The following day, he noticed that the chest pain was more severe and persistent throughout the day. The pain location would vary from the sternal area to the left side of his chest. The intensity of pain would vary between a 2-3/10 to 7-8/10. When the pain peaked, it would be accompanied by feelings of fever, chills, and brief headache, and he felt that the pain would "spread" across his chest. The pain would persist for a variable amount of time but then eventually disappear before returning. The pain was not affected by deep breath, position, or analgesics (he took an ibuprofen at around 2 AM when he couldn't sleep). After he fell asleep he was not woken up by pain. On Friday, he pain continued to be intermittent, and peaked during a work meeting. At that point he told his boss and an MD co-worker, who recommended that he presented to the ED. The EKG that was obtained in triage showed sinus tachycardia widespread ST elevations, PR depressions, with reciprocal changes in aVR. At this time he was continuing to experience chest pain. After getting a room in the ED, he no longer felt pain. He received a 2nd EKG showing improvement in ST elevations in some, but no all leads. He received ibuprofen and he continued to feel no symptoms. He was found to have a troponin elevation of 8.84 that peaked to 11.2. Transthoracic echo showed no motional wall abnormalities, normal EF, no pericardial effusion. He was admitted to the CICU out of concern and workup for myopericarditis.
22 2021-02-28 blood pressure increased, pallor 0936 vs 92/60, 58, 20, 98%. Pt c/o ringing in both ears, tightness in head and skins were pale and d... Read more
Close
0936 vs 92/60, 58, 20, 98%. Pt c/o ringing in both ears, tightness in head and skins were pale and diaphoretic. Pt denies any SOB, rash, hives, dizziness. Pt?s father is here with him and is his driver. 0946 vs 120/82, 69, 20, 97%. Pt is feeling a bit better. The ringing in the ears and tightness to head is gone, BP has increased and skins are drying and color is returning. This is his first vaccine. Pt did not want any further medical attention/paramedics called. Pt and father were advised to call 911 if any further symptoms occur after leaving site. Pt is feeling back to normal with skins W/D, no other symptoms.
22 2021-03-03 heart rate decreased, heart rate increased, blood pressure decreased No reaction occurred from time of administration (0830) to 1600. Intense emesis and stomach pain th... Read more
Close
No reaction occurred from time of administration (0830) to 1600. Intense emesis and stomach pain then began. Patient self-administered 100mg IM hydrocortisone. Blood pressure monitored via home monitor quickly decreased and heartrate increased. At 2000 on 3/2 EMS was engaged and brought patient to Hospital Emergency Department. At emergency room patient was diagnosed with acute adrenal crisis and given multiple doses of hydrocortisone 50mg and promethazine 12.5mg. At least three 1000ml NS boluses were provided in ED. Blood pressure continued to drop; lowest noted was low 80s/30s. Admitted to cardiology unit for continued observation and steroid/antiemetic support. Patient remained admitted 3/3 and was discharged 3/4 following adequate fluid resuscitation and transition to PO steroids.

Close
I had upper body aches and heart palpitations. This lasted about a month. I went to a walk-in clinic and they told me that they have seen the same reactions in Covid shots in other individuals . My AST and ALT levels were elevated. The PVC lasted about a month and upper body aches lasted about a week.
22 2021-03-09 pallor Patient was sat in the front of the pharmacy to wait 15 min after vaccination. Patient agent with hi... Read more
Close
Patient was sat in the front of the pharmacy to wait 15 min after vaccination. Patient agent with him came to the counter and stated patient was not feeling well. Patient was pale, sweating, and feeling nauseous. After 3 minutes (approximately 8 minutes after vaccination), patient started to vomit on himself and was given a basket. Gave Ice pack to place on neck, shoulder, and head and gave cold wet cloth to clean up vomit. Proceded to make patient wait an additional 15 minutes and patient started to feel better and was given okay to leave.
22 2021-03-11 excessive bleeding, fainting On Thursday, March 11th, 2021 approximately 3:10 pm, Patient received his first dose of Moderna Vacc... Read more
Close
On Thursday, March 11th, 2021 approximately 3:10 pm, Patient received his first dose of Moderna Vaccine (Lot number: 003A21A) in his left deltoid Patient received the Moderna Vaccine. After which he sat in the designated medical observation area for 15 minutes. Approximately five minutes later around 3:15 pm, Patient experienced syncope, fell out of his chair, hit the left side of his forehead on the ground. Due to the fall, he experienced a mild abrasion on the left side of his forehead, which led to bleeding. The Physician?s Assistant rushed to aid Patient who was lying on the ground in a supine position. Emergency Medical Services (EMS) - Fire Department and ambulance were called immediately and approximately five minutes later EMS arrived. During the time frame prior to EMS arrival, the Physician?s Assistant asked numerous questions to Patient to assess his condition. She asked Patient if he could breathe and he responded ?yes?. She asked Patient if he was short of breath and he responded ?no?. She asked Patient if he felt like his throat was closing and he responded ?no?. At this point, an Epinephrine pen was not used. Patient was alert and the Orient x 4 questions were asked [(1) Who are you? (2) Where are you? (3) What is the date and time? (4) What just happened to you?]. Patient also denied head pain, neck pain, nausea or chest pain. Staff performed a limited neuro-exam and was deemed within normal limits. Patients Glasgow Coma Scale score was 15 Patient mentioned that he has a phobia of needles and something like this has happened before when he was ?young?. Patient initially did not want an ambulance to be called. It was explained to him that it might be in his best interest to call EMS due to syncope and abrasion on his forehead due to the fall. Patient also mentioned that he only consumed two cookies and coffee for that day. When the EMS arrived (about 5 firefighters), they interviewed him and performed a blood pressure test. His sitting blood pressure was 130/82. One of the firefighters assessed his spine and Patient denied cervical, thoracic, and lumbar tenderness or pain. The firefighter assessed Patient's glucose level, which was a bit difficult to obtain in the first initial efforts, with the glucometer reading ?error?. The firefighters eventually were able to obtain a reading on Patient's glucose and it read 86. Patient was able to stand on his own, and a second blood pressure test was performed; his standing blood pressure reading was 145/89. EMS gave Patient gauze to address his head wound Patient initially refused to go to the hospital, but per EMS protocol, fluids needed to be administered. Patient entered the ambulance and was taken to the hospital by EMS.

Patient became very hot and sweaty after dose. He felt light headed and had to lay down. He was given a glucose tablet and Gatorade. He did not have any symptoms of anaphylactic allergy. Emergency responders came and took his blood pressure and blood sugar. Both were a little low. He was not taken to the hospital, he walked out of the pharmacy with his parents

Appeared pale. able to converse at all times. 14:35 BP 150/59 P 76 and regular, O2 sat 99%. given water and juice and crackers and felt better within minutes. no other complaints or severe adverse reaction sxs. States he did not eat or have fuids since early in day. 14:43 116/64, P 72, O2 sat 100%. 14:50 119/67, P 68 O2 sat 100% 14:55 had cookies. sitting up. 1504 "back to normal". good color to skin. able to stand and ambulate without dizziness 117/71, P 66 and regular, O2 Sat 100%. Discharged home, ambulatory in very stable condition.

22 2021-03-29 pallor Pt received the first of the two-series COVID vaccination at 1512. Once in observation area, pt beca... Read more
Close
Pt received the first of the two-series COVID vaccination at 1512. Once in observation area, pt became unresponsive shortly after sitting down. This provider was called over by staff to pt, which was noted to have become unresponsive while sitting in the chair. Pt remained in the chair, did not fall or injure self. Upon arrival to patient, he was noted to have severe diaphoresis, prominent pallor, with shallow, slow breathing, no cyanosis noted. His head initially fell back and head was aligned/adjusted to maintain an open airway. This provider was speaking to the pt and performed a sternal rub to elicit a response, pt remained unresponsive and with eyes closed. Pt remained in this state for approximately 10 seconds. Pt noted to suddenly have some muscular rigidity to arms and torso and in order to prevent injury upon possible onset of seizure activity, pt was lowered to the floor by this provider and RN . Once on the ground the pt was relaxed and opened his eyes. Pt was immediately verbally responsive and asked if he passed out. Pt was able to sit up and was assisted into the wheelchair. Pt moved to treatment area where vitals and blood glucose were obtained. (@1525 BG- 104 mg/dL, VS BP 116/72, HR bradycardic @51 bpm, O2 sat 95%). Patient responses/speech was clear and pt was oriented to self, place, time and situation. Pt stated that he felt nauseated upon sitting in the observation area and admitted that he only had a coffee today, nothing to eat all day and attributed this as the cause of his reaction. Pt verbalized that he would not respond to the hospital with the paramedics and was encouraged to at least call someone to take him to the hospital. This provider spoke with the patient?s mother and explained the events. The patient?s mother stated that the patient had febrile seizures when approximately 4 years old, associated with asthma exacerbations; but pt was evaluated with a neurologist and there were no abnormal findings. Pt admitted that he has a similar syncopal episode after washing a laceration and seeing his finger bleeding. Pt states this was a few years ago and witnessed by his father that told the patient he initially fainted and then became momentarily rigid before responding appropriately (similar to today?s events). Ambulance - arrival @1536 report given and pt stated he was feeling better and declined further evaluation in truck and also declined transport to ED ( departed at 1545). Pt?s overall condition, appearance, including color was much improved. Pt denied any allergies or medication history. Past medical hx of febrile seizures at approximately age three and four, childhood asthma and one syncopal episode as an adult. Pt girlfriend arrival and she agreed to drive patient from the vaccine clinic. Pt and girlfriend were both provided with an explanation of the many concerning causes of syncope and the necessity for further evaluation in the Emergency department to rule out any underlying conditions. Both patient and girlfriend verbalized understanding and although they still declined to respond to ED directly from the clinic, both did agree to respond to ED if any changes in mental status occurred. Pt lives alone, but agreed to stay with parents and family in order to have others watch him for any changes. Pt was advised to followup with PCP and made aware that an provider would contact him tomorrow to check on his status, understanding verbalized and agreed with plan of care. Pt in no acute distress, awake, alert and oriented. Color within normal limits for and departed facility with girlfriend at 15:56, steady gait noted. Patient?s appointment for second dose was cancelled and will need to obtain clearance prior to second vaccine dose.
22 2021-03-30 blood pressure increased Headache, elevated blood pressure, chills & shivering, right arm & back pains,
22 2021-03-30 loss of consciousness Patient received vaccine was fine while sitting. When patient stood up and was walking to the door ... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine was fine while sitting. When patient stood up and was walking to the door he passed out. BP was 117/74 prior to EMS arriving. When EMS arrived he was placed into a chair and BP was lower initially. After sitting for about 10 minutes his blood pressure returned back above 117/74.
22 2021-04-01 chest discomfort Around 11:30pm I started to get chills and my teeth started to chatter. At the same time my body was... Read more
Close
Around 11:30pm I started to get chills and my teeth started to chatter. At the same time my body was shaking slightly. I was laying on the couch during the start of it for the above events, this lasted for about 20+ minutes. Then I tried to get up to go to bed. I was shaking very badly at this point, teeth chattering a lot and I was very cold. I tried to use the bathroom and I couldn't even stand still to use the bathroom. My chest was also tightening and it was hard to breathe. I went to bed to lay down and I was practically hyperventilating for about 15 minutes at a time and I would stop for a minute then it would start up again. I tried to go to sleep but I couldn't because I couldn't breathe and my chest was closing in, it felt like. I called my parents in and they sat with me and gave me ibuprofen and benedryl. I started to feel better after about an hour. During that time, though, my body was extremely hot (but no fever) but I was still cold and had the chills. My head also was hurting like a headache and my eyes were really hot too. It was hard to get air and if I sat up I would get dizzy.

Close
Patient with severe dizziness and intractable nausea/vomiting. Upon admission to the ED last night his platelet count was 9. He has a subconjunctival hemorrhage OS and frank hematuria, besides the epistaxis. Pinpoint erythematous lesions noted on his forearms. No other bleeding noted. ADAMTS13 level confirms TTP . Patient now on day 4 of PLEX treatment.
22 2021-04-01 fainting Syncope. Pt fell backwards as he was leaving immunization room for waiting/observation area after re... Read more
Close
Syncope. Pt fell backwards as he was leaving immunization room for waiting/observation area after receiving first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. Episode lasted roughly 15 seconds at which point patient regained alertness. It was determined no epinephrine etc was needed. Pt was observed following episode until he was clearly okay to leave on his own accord, and no further medical attention would be necessary. Discussed follow up with PCP post event and to discuss appropriateness of receiving second dose. Out of an abundance of caution, contacted patient later in the evening (about 1.5 hrs later) at home to check up and make sure he was still okay.

Close
Within 3 minutes of being escorted to our waiting area and starting the timer, patient made a complaint of sweating. within moments patient was heavily perspiring and lost all color. Flushed and confused. Pt starting asking "how long have I been here?". then while being escorted back to our vaccine room patient experienced a brief syncope. He fainted and was escorted to the ground. Increased pulse and continued confusion. Patient was placed in supine position with ice packs on face and nape of neck. EMS was called. we stayed with patient until EMS arrived and took over. Patient declined going with them to the hospital after his evaluation and was cleared by EMS to leave.

Close

Offered water, cool cloths to face and neck 5:32 pm - VS 107/70 P 70; Sat 99% . Patient stated he felt better after cooling off and drinking water. Discharged to home. Dizziness, and headache have improved.

Close
Patient had fallen out of chair approximately 5 minutes after being vaccinated and showed signs of having seizure (jerking motions) for approximately 30 seconds. We rolled patient on his side while he was having seizure and rolled him onto his back when he stopped seizing. Patient regained consciousness and was profusely sweating. Fire department showed up to take over. They had questioned patient on his medication history and whether he had a history of seizures. Approximately 15 minutes from then, the paramedics arrived and preformed vital check on patient and deemed patient unwell to leave on his own accord. Patient was then transmitted to hospital.
