Close
Patient immediately felt light headed and notified immunizer. He then quickly fainted. Pharmacist and technician carefully lowered him from the chair to the floor and laid him on his back. Pharmacist quickly checked for a pulse and removed his mask. Patient came to within 10 seconds and pharmacist then elevated his legs using a chair. Patient remained laying on the floor for 10 minutes and then felt ready to sit up. After sitting up, patient was given a cold water to drink and a snack, and remained under pharmacist's supervision for 30 minutes. Patient then felt back to his normal self and felt confident he could safely leave the pharmacy.

22 2021-04-11 chest pain 22 Y male with past medical history of environmental allergies presents with a chief complaint of ab... Read more
Close
22 Y male with past medical history of environmental allergies presents with a chief complaint of abdominal pain and nausea/ vomiting. He states that on 4/7 he had some nausea and one episode of non bloody nonbilious emesis that morning. He had previously received his first dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine on 4/6. He states this morning he awoke and had significant nausea and abdominal pain and then had approximately 10 episodes of non bloody emesis that eventually became bilious. He did have some diaphoresis. He states that he eventually did have some chest pain that he attributed to all of the vomiting. He went to urgent care and did receive Zofran but this did not alleviate his symptoms. He denies shortness of breath, cough, fever, chills, diarrhea, melena, hematochezia, genitourinary symptoms, or other pain. He states that he has been having a few episodes of loose stools, but did not have any bowel movements today. In urgent care CT was performed and was suspicious for pneumomediastinum within the partially imaged lower chest and a CT esophagram was recommended. Patient presented here for CT esophagram. He is admitted for further treatment, and required a three day admission with IVF, and IV narcotics and antiemetics to control his nausea and Abd symptoms. He denied dyspnea. On 4/11 the patient was tolerating a diet and stable to dc home.

22 2021-04-16 fainting, pallor Patient fainted shortly after receiving second dose of Moderna Covid vaccine. When I approached the ... Read more
Close
Patient fainted shortly after receiving second dose of Moderna Covid vaccine. When I approached the patient he was laying on the ground and very pale but still breathing. I rolled him onto his back and elevated his feet and asked him to keep breathing and try to stay calm. I asked someone to grab him some water and someone else to run to the pharmacy and grab the pharmacy manager while I monitored the patient. I asked if I could help him sit up to drink some water and he accepted. After sitting up I asked if he had eaten and if I could get him something to eat. He stated he hadn't eaten all day and that he had a panic disorder and felt like he was having a panic attack. I asked if he had medicine he needed to take to help him feel better, he stated no, he needed to just wait it out. Then he told me he felt like he was going to throw up and I got him a waste basket that he threw up in right away. I asked the patient if he hit his head or if he wanted us to call an ambulance; he stated no to both questions. The pharmacy manager arrived and sat with the patient for the next half hour or more until he felt better. He stated that his dad was going to take him home now that he felt better. Some store staff had us fill out an incident report and the pharmacy manager walked the customer out to his car where he said he would call and find his dad.
22 2021-04-17 heart rate increased Around 3 pm on 4/14/21, I started to feel very tired and I started to get a headache. Around 6 pm, I... Read more
Close
Around 3 pm on 4/14/21, I started to feel very tired and I started to get a headache. Around 6 pm, I started to experience lower back pain and my legs began to throb and my whole body became very sensitive to touch. I took tylenol or ibuprofen every 4 hours for the rest of the night. This went on until Thursday 4/15/21, when the dizziness and throbbing headache started. Every time I would stand up I would become off balanced and need to hold on to something. I was still experiencing the lower back pain, leg throbbing and skin sensitivity but the dizziness and headache became much more intense. Around 9:30 pm on Thursday, I felt like I was hallucinating and was experiencing euphoria along with a fever. I did not sleep the night of 4/15 into 4/16. I was sweating profusely with a throbbing headache that would cause spinning when I would stand up. Around 3 am on 4/16, I fell asleep until around 4:30 am when I woke up in a pool of my own sweat. The body aches, leg pain and skin sensitivity went away along with my fever. Throughout Friday 4/16, I had a throbbing headache and was dizzy with no relief. This continued into Sunday 4/18 when I started to feel some relief. My headache was pretty much gone but the dizziness is still very much there. I have also an experienced elevated heart rate and respirations throughout the last 5 days.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Additional Details: Patient felt dizzy/light-headed within 1-2 minutes of receiving his 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine on 4/18/21 at ~12:30pm. Patient stood up from the waiting area, walked approximately 20 feet to the pharmacy window to request assistance where he fainted and hit his head on the counter ledge. He has a raised bump (approximately 2 inches wide) on his right temple above his eyebrow. Patient remained conscious, received water/juice/granola bar & was monitored by the RPh for an additional 30-40 minutes.
22 2021-04-19 loss of consciousness Approximately 3 to 5 minutes after immunization, patient was observed in a waiting room chair uncon... Read more
Close
Approximately 3 to 5 minutes after immunization, patient was observed in a waiting room chair unconscious, unresponsive and not breathing (respiration was not immediately observable or recognizable). Patient was carefully and quickly placed in a supine position on the floor. Pulse was present but the patient was completely unresponsive. Respiration was not observed. EMS was immediately notified. Pharmacist and staff prepared for resuscitation and utilization of Epinephrine if needed. Patients face was flushed, arms became flushed and the patients skin became moist. After approximately 45 seconds in the supine position the patients eyes opened and he became responsive to auditory communication. Respiration became reestablished. BP was recorded at 130/91 with a pulse of 91 BPM. EMS arrived on scene and provided further evaluation. After an additional 5-10 minutes, patient was completely conscious and coherent. Patient indicated that he had a similar experience in a grocery store over 1 year ago that was unrelated to immunization and was attributed to dehydration. Patient refused additional medical care or transport to ED. Patient was released to a friend who drove him home. Patient was observed 1 day later picking up his car from the pharmacy and has recovered. Patient was advised to seek additional medical evaluation to assess the root cause of this event.

Close
Patient received the first Moderna vaccine. After receiving the vaccination and while waiting 15 minutes, the patient became extremely light-headed and passed out out of the chair. Patient immediately regained consciousness and was helped back into chair by myself and his brother. Patient was still dizzy. I immediately told one associate to call 911 and another associate was able to call for management. Afterwards, I told an associate to go grab the patient a water and some hard candy to elevate his blood glucose. I confirmed that the patient has not had seizures in the past. The patient stated that he had not eaten very much today (just a smoothie) and wasn't adequately hydrated. I stayed with the patient the whole time until the paramedics arrived and were able to test his vitals. The patient was eventually cleared to go home and went home with his brother.

22 2021-04-26 inflammation of the heart muscle Myocarditis; This spontaneous case was reported by a physician (subsequently medically confirmed) an... Read more
Close
Myocarditis; This spontaneous case was reported by a physician (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of MYOCARDITIS (Myocarditis) in a 22-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, after starting mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine), the patient experienced MYOCARDITIS (Myocarditis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant). At the time of the report, MYOCARDITIS (Myocarditis) was resolving. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant medications were provided. Patient developed myocarditis 48 hours after receiving his first Moderna COVID vaccine. The patient is still in the cardiac ICU in stable condition and improving. Treatment of the event was not reported. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested.

22 2021-04-27 fainting, loss of consciousness Pt received the vaccine in l-deltoid area and within seconds lost consciousness. After being unconsc... Read more
Close
Pt received the vaccine in l-deltoid area and within seconds lost consciousness. After being unconscious for roughly ten seconds, pt was arousable by calling his name and lightly shaking him. Pt was seated during his loss of consciousness, was caught by the nurse administering the shot, pt did not hit his head or suffer any trauma. Pt was assisted to a stretcher, given water to drink and his vital signs were monitored. Upon initial assessment, pt was A&O x 4, GCS 15, blood pressure 88/60, pulse 58, pupils equal and reactive to light, lung sounds clear, respirations 16 and non-labored. Pt denied ever fainting before, denied any allergies, medical history, denied taking prescription or over the counter medications, and denied birth defects. Pt was reassessed after about 5 minutes of initial assessment. A&Ox4, GCS 15, BP102/68, PR 78, PEARL, LS clear, RR 16 non-labored. Pt was continuously monitored for 30 minutes and advised to follow up with his primary doctor for an assessment of new-onset syncopal episode. PT's mood improved and was reassessed for vitals before leaving the clnic. A&0x4 GCS 15, BP 118/80, PR 84, PEARL, LS clear, RR 16-non-labored, PT released from care and exited the site with no further findings.

Headache; Chills; Vertigo; Nausea; He threw up for about 20 minutes; He feels odd here and there; Random onset on backpain now, in the lumbar area; He almost passed out; Heart beat was 130; Fever of 100.6; This spontaneous case was reported by a non-health professional (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (He almost passed out), HEADACHE (Headache), CHILLS (Chills), VERTIGO (Vertigo), NAUSEA (Nausea) and VOMITING (He threw up for about 20 minutes) in a 22-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 046B21A and 037A21B) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 23-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 20-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 20-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (He almost passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), VERTIGO (Vertigo) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), NAUSEA (Nausea) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), VOMITING (He threw up for about 20 minutes) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and TACHYCARDIA (Heart beat was 130). On 20-Apr-2021 at 10:00 PM, the patient experienced HEADACHE (Headache) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and CHILLS (Chills) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On an unknown date, the patient experienced FEELING ABNORMAL (He feels odd here and there), BACK PAIN (Random onset on backpain now, in the lumbar area) and PYREXIA (Fever of 100.6). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (He almost passed out), HEADACHE (Headache), CHILLS (Chills), VERTIGO (Vertigo), VOMITING (He threw up for about 20 minutes), TACHYCARDIA (Heart beat was 130), FEELING ABNORMAL (He feels odd here and there), BACK PAIN (Random onset on backpain now, in the lumbar area) and PYREXIA (Fever of 100.6) outcome was unknown and NAUSEA (Nausea) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 20-Apr-2021, Body temperature: 100.6 (High) 100.6. On 20-Apr-2021, Heart rate: abnormal (abnormal) Resting heart rate was 130. Additionally irregular heartbeat reported.. Patient got to the hospital where he was given pain medication and medication for vertigo. He was in the hospital for 6.5-7 hours.When he was discharged nausea went away and it took him 48 hours after ER visit to feel normal. Concomitant medication information not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-114588 (E2B Linked Report).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-114588:dose 1
22 2021-05-14 troponin increased Patient received a Moderna vaccine at another facility on 05/12/2021. On 05/13/2021, he had chills, ... Read more
Close
Patient received a Moderna vaccine at another facility on 05/12/2021. On 05/13/2021, he had chills, fatigue, and myalgias. These symptoms resolved on 05/14/2021. However on 05/14/2021 at 10 AM he developed pleuritic chest pain. He was admitted to hospital on the evening of 05/14/2021 with dramatic elevations in high-sensitivity troponin to 1700 and EKG with diffuse ST elevations and PR depressions, concerning for myopericarditis. He was initially treated with ibuprofen and colchicine. We have ordered an echocardiogram and a cardiac MRI. Workup and treatment are ongoing.
22 2021-05-15 loss of consciousness, hypotension Patient lost consciousness for under one minute. When he lost consciousness his blood pressure dropp... Read more
Close
Patient lost consciousness for under one minute. When he lost consciousness his blood pressure dropped and he fell forward (didn't hit the floor). He was given water to bring up his blood pressure and cool rags to cool him off.
22 2021-05-17 chest discomfort, chest pain, inflammation of the pericardium Tightness in chest, pain in chest, and shortness of breath. Started late May 13, subsided enough to ... Read more
Close
Tightness in chest, pain in chest, and shortness of breath. Started late May 13, subsided enough to get some sleep. Awakened by the pain and shortness of breath around 7:30 am May 14. Unable to get out of bed. Called 911 for ambulance. Patient was taken to Hospital Cardiac. EKG showed ST elevation, thus L & R Catheterization was performed. Negative for MI, but diagnosed with Pericarditis, kept overnight in hospital and prescribed Indomethacin (Indocin) 3 times daily for 14 days. Released from hospital May 15. Recovery continues at home.

Approximately 5-10 minutes after receiving injection patient became faint and collapsed while browsing store. Did not appear to hit his head or significantly injure himself in any way but reported headache and some confusion on regaining consciousness. Slowly moved to sitting position and allowed to recover.
22 2021-05-17 fainting Patient fainted after receiving his first dose of the Moderna vaccine. He was very nervous and breat... Read more
Close
Patient fainted after receiving his first dose of the Moderna vaccine. He was very nervous and breathing hard before the vaccine because he is afraid of needles. After receiving his vaccine he was standing in the vaccine area with the woman he was with. The woman was also receiving a vaccine. He was still very nervous about needles and I suggested that he wait in the post-vaccination area so he didn't have to witness the woman receiving her vaccine. While walking to the post-vaccination area the patient fainted. After fainting he woke up right away. Another pharmacist and a technician immediately went to check on him and assist him. Patient thinks that he fainted because of his fear of needles.

Patient came to and had significant bleeding from nose and mouth, paramedics were called to the scene. Pharmacist helped patient to a seated position and patient was given bottled water and an ice pack. Paramedics came in and took over care of patient within approximately 5 minutes

PATIENT CONCOMITTANTLY BECAME NAUSEOUS WITH ABDOMINAL PAIN, AND HEADACHE, AFTER WHICH (~5MIN) PROCEEDED TO VOMIT. PATIENT LEFT STORE AFTER ABOUT 30 MINUTES AFTER HE BEGAN TO FEEL BETTER. 22 2021-05-24 troponin increased, blood glucose increased, chest pain, hypertension, inflammation of the heart muscle Patient is 22 year-old, admitted to the Cardiology 3 Emergency Department with acute myocarditis sh... Read more
Close
Patient is 22 year-old, admitted to the Cardiology 3 Emergency Department with acute myocarditis shortly following the receipt of his 2nd Moderna COVID-19 vaccination. He has a remote history of acute pericarditis (01/12/2014) following viral illness, which was treated with high dose ibuprofen 800 mg t.i.d. At that time, he presented with retrosternal chest pain worse with laying down and fever/myalgia, rigors and chills (T 103.3°F) with laboratory findings consistent with leukocytosis 17.3, elevated inflammatory markers (CRP 43, but normal ESR 12) with a negative influenza screen. ECG demonstrated diffuse ST wave elevations in leads I, II, aVF, V1-V6. He had resolution of symptoms with NSAID treatment. On this occasion, he presented with non-radiating retrosternal chest pain not responding to Ibuprofen 800 mg. At the ED, ECG demonstrated diffuse ST elevation, troponinemia 629/725/712/1319, elevated inflammatory markers (CRP 38.2, ESR 19). He had normal D-dimer and SARS-CoV-2 PCR was undetected. A cardiac MRI was obtained that demonstrated patchy subepicardial enhancement in the mid-apical lateral-anterolateral myocardium, suggestive of myocarditis. EKG showed diffuse ST elevation. He was treated with Toradol and fentanyl for pain management with improvement of symptoms. He was then admitted to Cardiology 3 for further evaluation and management. Upon admission, Infectious Disease was consulted given the novelty of his presenting symptoms and findings. Extensive evaluation including connective tissue cascade, respiratory viral panel and tick bone panel have not yielded any significant findings. They suspected this could be related to his recent COVID vaccine given that there have been reports of myocarditis that have occurred following COVID-19 messenger RNA vaccinations, though it is not clear whether there is a definite cause or effect. Moreover, the association of myocarditis and the messenger RNA COVID-19 vaccinations appears to be controversial, not supported by recent FDA reports. All in all, the Infectious Disease team recommended no specific therapies, but the case should be reported as a possible adverse event associated with the recent Moderna vaccination to VAERS. The center where the patient received this vaccination should make this report. Emergency Management Director was notified to report the event. They also felt that it may be reasonable to avoid the Moderna and perhaps even the Pfizer messenger RNA COVID-19 vaccination in the future to be conservative. While inpatient, his troponin level continued to trend up and peaked at 1707. An EKG was repeated and showed improvement in ST elevation from his initial EKG with no other acute changes. His case was discussed with Dr., who felt that a steroid taper would be appropriate. Additional chest pain was treated with PRN Ibuprofen 600 mg QID. After initiation of steroids, troponin markedly improved to 706. Due to his history of impaired fasting glucose, his blood glucose levels were monitored q.i.d. While slightly elevated, he did not require any sliding scale insulin while inpatient. We will plan to have his primary care provider assess his glucose level at his follow-up visit. Additionally, while receiving NSAIDs and steroids, his blood pressure was elevated to the 150s to 160 systolic. He was initiated on Coreg prior to dismissal. He was dismissed on 04/29/2021 given improving troponin and no concerning arrhythmias on continuous telemetry monitoring. He will follow up in the Cardiomyopathy Clinic in 3 months with a repeat cardiac MRI and stress ECG. We have recommended the patient to avoid heavy lifting or strenuous activity for the next 3 months until seen by the cardiomyopathy Clinic. He was provided with education and a letter delineating work restrictions.

Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Site: Redness at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Confusion-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Additional Details: On 5-28-21 the patient was given the COVID vaccine, following the vaccine he passed out. When the patient came to he said he must have gone to sleep. The patient stated he passed out the week before and thought it was due to not eating. EMS checked vitals, and all vitals were good. Pt refused to go to the hospital, he left with his wife and she drove. I told the patient I would follow up with him via a phone call to see how he was feeling. I called pt at 5 pm on 5-28, he stated he was fine
22 2021-06-03 fainting Three to five minutes following vaccine administration patient was collapsed to the ground then imm... Read more
Close
Three to five minutes following vaccine administration patient was collapsed to the ground then immediately got up and sat on the floor. When I got to him he was sweating and his arms were twitching. Even though he was alert, he was struggling to straighten his arms. I made a 911 call and then administered one dose of epipen then within a minute he thanked me for the epipen and he said he is feeling much better. Finally the paramedics came in and asked him if he still wants to go for further checkups. He agreed and left the store with the paramedics.
22 2021-06-05 troponin increased, chest pain Patient is a 22 y.o. male with no previous cardiac history, no known cardiovascular risk factors, an... Read more
Close
Patient is a 22 y.o. male with no previous cardiac history, no known cardiovascular risk factors, and no significant past medical history. 2 days ago he received his second dose of the Maderna Covid vaccine. Yesterday he reported flulike symptoms with fever to 102 degrees, generalized myalgias, and fatigue. He awoke at 2 AM this morning with sharp somewhat diffuse substernal pain unrelated to activity, inspiration, exertion, position, without radiation or associated symptoms. He took Tylenol which eventually caused the pain to decrease in intensity. He called his family, discussed it with his girlfriend, did some online research, and came to the ER for evaluation where his EKG demonstrated anterior T wave abnormalities and his high-sensitivity troponin came back elevated at 16,072. His pain is now fully resolved, he is being admitted to the hospitalist service, and cardiology consultation was requested. June 6, 2021

22 2021-06-13 loss of consciousness PATIENT WAS ADMINISTERED HIS FIRST DOSE OF THE MODERNA COVID VACCINE AND APPEARED TO BE FINE AFTERWA... Read more
Close
PATIENT WAS ADMINISTERED HIS FIRST DOSE OF THE MODERNA COVID VACCINE AND APPEARED TO BE FINE AFTERWARD. HE MOVED FROM THE IMMUNIZATION BOOTH TO A SEAT OUT IN FRONT OF THE PHARMACY, AND A FEW MINUTES AFTER HIS VACCINE HE PASSED OUT AND FELL OVER OUT OF THE SEAT. A CODE WHITE WAS CALLED, BUT THE PATIENT REGAINED CONSCIOUSNESS QUICKLY AFTER PASSING OUT, AND WAS MOVED BACK INTO A SEAT WITH ARMS. HE TOOK A FEW SIPS OF WATER AND APPEARED TO HAVE MOSTLY RECOVERED, BUT THE PATIENT LOST CONSCIOUSNESS IN THE SEAT AGAIN A FEW MINUTES LATER. EMS WERE CALLED TO CHECK OUT THE PATIENT, BUT WHEN THEY ARRIVED HE APPEARED TO HAVE MOSTLY RECOVERED AND SHOWED NO MORE SIGNS OF PASSING OUT AGAIN. EMS CLEARED HIM TO GO HOME AND ADVISED HIM TO GO TO THE ER IF HE HAD ANY MORE ISSUES LATER.

22 2021-06-22 chest pain I have had a cough, sore throat, and some chest pain for almost 2 months. This all started a few day... Read more
Close
I have had a cough, sore throat, and some chest pain for almost 2 months. This all started a few days after my second shot of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on May 5, 2021. I went to an UrgentCare on May 24th, and the nurse told me "this is happening to everyone... it's just something going around... it will go away". A week later, I went somewhere else and got Amoxicillin. I took Amoxicillin for 7 days and it did not resolve my cough. My primary doctor is currently not seeing any patients for "respiratory-related illnesses".

Patient was fine until about 5 minutes post immunization, when he fainted. He was unresponsive for about 8 minutes. We wet his face with some water, laid him down on floor with feet up on chair, checked pulse, called 911. They checked vitals and after he was awake he made the decision to not go to hospital. Patient left with parents to go to their doctor.
22 2021-06-23 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain myocarditis; NSVT episodes; chest pain; This literature-non-study case was reported in a literature ... Read more
Close
myocarditis; NSVT episodes; chest pain; This literature-non-study case was reported in a literature article and describes the occurrence of MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis), VENTRICULAR TACHYCARDIA (NSVT episodes) and CHEST PAIN (chest pain) in a 22-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On an unknown date, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged and medically significant), VENTRICULAR TACHYCARDIA (NSVT episodes) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged and medically significant) and CHEST PAIN (chest pain) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged). The patient was hospitalized from sometime in 2021 to sometime in 2021 due to CHEST PAIN, MYOCARDITIS and VENTRICULAR TACHYCARDIA. At the time of the report, MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis) and VENTRICULAR TACHYCARDIA (NSVT episodes) was resolving and CHEST PAIN (chest pain) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): In 2021, C-reactive protein: high (High) 4 (Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range).. In 2021, Ejection fraction: abnormal (abnormal) 53%, inferolateral hypokinesis. In 2021, Electrocardiogram: abnormal (abnormal) Inferior, anterolateral STelevation. In 2021, imaging: abnormal (abnormal) Edema, delayed enhancement. In 2021, SARS-CoV-2 test: negative (Negative) negative. In 2021, Troponin: high (High) baseline-1327 (Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range). and high (High) Peak-1433 (Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range).. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter considered MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis), VENTRICULAR TACHYCARDIA (NSVT episodes) and CHEST PAIN (chest pain) to be possibly related. Discharged in stable condition. Treatment information not provided. Company Comment : Based on current available information and the temporal association between product sue and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product sue and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
22 2021-06-23 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain myocarditis; chest pain; fever; chills; myalgia; This literature-non-study case was reported in a li... Read more
Close
myocarditis; chest pain; fever; chills; myalgia; This literature-non-study case was reported in a literature article and describes the occurrence of MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis) and CHEST PAIN (chest pain) in a 22-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On an unknown date, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged and medically significant), CHEST PAIN (chest pain) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged), PYREXIA (fever), CHILLS (chills) and MYALGIA (myalgia). The patient was hospitalized from sometime in 2021 to sometime in 2021 due to CHEST PAIN and MYOCARDITIS. The patient was treated with PREDNISONE for Adverse event, at an unspecified dose and frequency and IBUPROFEN for Adverse event, at an unspecified dose and frequency. At the time of the report, MYOCARDITIS (myocarditis) was resolving and CHEST PAIN (chest pain), PYREXIA (fever), CHILLS (chills) and MYALGIA (myalgia) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): In 2021, C-reactive protein: 4.8 (High) Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range.. In 2021, Ejection fraction: abnormal (abnormal) 50%, generalized hypokinesis. In 2021, Electrocardiogram: abnormal (abnormal) Diffuse STsegment elevation with depression in aVR. In 2021, Magnetic resonance imaging: abnormal (abnormal) Patchy subepicardial delayed enhancement. In 2021, SARS-CoV-2 test: negative (Negative) negative. In 2021, Troponin: 104 (High) Baseline troponin 104 (Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range). and 285 (High) Peak value 285 (Values are expressed as the multiple of the upper limit of normal for each laboratory's reference range).. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Concomitant medication not provided. It was reported that the patient was hemodynamically stable, no clinical heart failure. Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

23 2021-01-31 heart rate increased Approximately 10-15 minutes after receiving dose of covid vaccine case reported he had the sensatio... Read more
Close
Approximately 10-15 minutes after receiving dose of covid vaccine case reported he had the sensation is throat was "a little sore and if felt like it was beginning to swell. No observed obstruction in airway. Had own epi-pen and this supervisor also had available but he declined at that time. Consented to oral elixir of bendryl 50 mg po which was given. He reportedly felt tachy Pulse rate 96. Case reported last time he needed epipen he felt pain like needles in throat area. Continued to observe. Case reported sensation of swelling was dissipating within 15 minutes. Continued to observe an additional 40 minutes. Had case call for ride home since he took bendaryl. Also had case call his physician to notify him of reaction. Case departed clinic about 11:50 breathing WNL. Girlfirend escorted him home. Instucted to call 911 and administer epipen if symtpoms worsen or return. Contact caste 5:30 pm at home he reported he has continued to improve. No throat swelling, but has slight sore throat. He will continue to have girlfriend stay with him. His physician called back and provided the same instructions.

Ambulance was called and they fully checked him out and said all vitals were fine and that patient could leave whenever he felt OK to do so. 23 2021-03-15 loss of consciousness Patient passed out and slid out of his chair while waiting after receiving his vaccine. The fall was... Read more
Close
Patient passed out and slid out of his chair while waiting after receiving his vaccine. The fall was witnessed by NP and aid was provided, immediately. Patient was laid flat on the floor and his Covid mask was removed. Patient returned to conscious state <5 seconds after onset of event. BP was checked while laying down (130/76 HR 80) and patient was given water and a pillow. Patient was allowed to sit after 5-7 mins but began to get dizzy, again. He was taken by wheelchair to clinic and allowed to lay on an exam table. A snack was provided and NP remained with patient until he was d/c'd at 10:05 am. His d/c BP was 128/78 (HR 65). Patient was reminded to alert staff to this event with his next vaccination.

23 2021-03-17 chest discomfort, lightheadedness, palpitations, pallor, very slow heart rate diaphoresis, pallor, chest tightness Narrative: Patient states that he started to feel unwell almos... Read more
Close
diaphoresis, pallor, chest tightness Narrative: Patient states that he started to feel unwell almost immediately after the vaccination. He became pale and diaphoretic. He was able to consume some bottled water prior to initial set of vitals being taken. He denied pruritus, swelling, dizziness, lightheadedness, SOB, nausea. +chest tightness and palpitations. Denies having any sort of prior similar reaction to vaccination and any known allergies to medications or other substances in the past. O: 1st set: BP 79/45, HR low 40s, RR 10, SpO2 97% on RA Exam significant for distress, pallor, diffuse diaphoresis (soaking through shirt/shorts), alert/oriented to person/place/time. CV: bradycardic, regular rhythm, no murmurs, b/l radial/pedal pulses 1+. PULM: CTAB, no wheezes/rhonchi. Neuro: no focal deficits. EMS was called 2/2 concerns for immediate allergic reaction. He notes he may have not eaten ecough today and politely declined CBG. Also politely declined IVF. He was able to slide safely to the floor and politely declined assistance (staff were ready in support), in Trendelenburg as much as possible with feet elevated on a chair. 2nd set of vitals: T98.4, BP 121/64, RR 11, HR 50s, SpO2 95% on RA Exam significant for: continued diaphoresis, improvement in pallor, continued A/O. Answers to questions linear and appropriate. No focal neurological deficits. Provided 2x rice crispy treats, which were consumed w/o issue. 3rd set of vitals: BP 144/82, HR 63, RR 10, SpO2 98% on RA Exam significant for: improved diaphoresis, vast improvement in pallor. Mental status/neuro exam unchanged. Fire arrived, repeat vitals reassuring (BP 131/77, HR 63 SpO2 100% on RA), EKG on monitor w/o arrhythmia and appeared to be NSR. A/P: 22 yo Veteran with immediate reaction to vaccination, concerning for immediate allergic reaction vs vasovagal reaction. Stabilized quickly with minimal intervention.

Patient (nursing home employee) was given his second dose of the Covid 19 vaccine today (March 24,2021) during a routine nursing home vaccination clinic. Patient stooped in chair and lowered to the ground. Epi Pen 0.3 mg was administered by the attending pharmacist, at 8:41 am and the ambulance was called. HIs vital signs were taken: Blood pressure 123/77, Oxygen 99%, pulse ranged from 104 to 111 bpm. Patient complained of pins/needles feeling in extremities, his arms (both left and right) were contracting, and his pupils were dilated. He was given 4 L oxygen, and the ambulance arrived at 8:58 am.

23 2021-03-31 fainting Patient was waiting for a 15 minute observational period. During the observation he started experien... Read more
Close
Patient was waiting for a 15 minute observational period. During the observation he started experiencing dizziness, light headedness and loss of hearing. Patient stood up to notify observation staff of his symptoms and had a syncopal episode and was moved to a cot. Patient soon regained consciousness and observational staff took a first set of vital signs with BP 128/72, O2 97% and strong pulse of 108 Bpm. Patient continued having dizziness for approximately 10 minutes after the event occurred. Onsite medical staff offered an ambulance transport to a nearby medical facility and patient reused against medical advice. Medical staff took a second set of vital signs with BP 124/76, O2 99%, strong pulse 78 BPM. Medical staff took patient out on a wheel chair and patient had a relative drive him home.
23 2021-03-31 fainting Faint; Migraine; Dizzy; Disoriented; Joint pain; Fatigue; Muscle pain; Nausea; Slight fever; A spont... Read more
Close
Faint; Migraine; Dizzy; Disoriented; Joint pain; Fatigue; Muscle pain; Nausea; Slight fever; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 23 year old, male patient, who experienced faint (syncope), migraine, dizziness, fatigue, disoriented (disorientation), joint pain (arthralgia), muscle pain (myalgia), nausea, and slight fever (pyrexia). The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the events, included allergy medication unspecified. On unspecified date, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 10-FEB-2021, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013L20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 10-FEB-2021, after vaccination, the patient experienced faint, migraine, dizzy, fatigue, disoriented, joint pain, muscle pain, nausea and slight fever. Treatment for the event included Ibuprofen and Excedrin. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the events; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the events is not applicable. The event of faint was considered recovered. The outcome for the events of migraine, dizziness, fatigue, disoriented (disorientation), joint pain (arthralgia), muscle pain (myalgia), nausea, and slight fever (pyrexia) was considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
23 2021-04-01 loss of consciousness Patient indicated on consent form that he had never had a reaction after receiving a vaccine before.... Read more
Close
Patient indicated on consent form that he had never had a reaction after receiving a vaccine before. Pharmacist on duty administered vaccine to patient. Patient walked from the vaccine administration location to the waiting area and sat down. Pharmacist heard a loud thud, and customer yelled "call 911" 911 was called, and patient was given a pillow under his head, and a blanket covering his body. He was unconscious for about 5 seconds, then came to. He was able to answer questions correctly like his name, and what year it is. Management came to help and take care of patient also. EMT arrived and took patient's BP and blood glucose levels. EMT recommended a snack because patient had not eaten yet today. Patient was given cheetos and water. EMT stayed to monitor patient until his vitals returned to normal. Patient told EMT that he has fainted about 8 times previously after giving blood, but never after receiving a vaccine. Came to pick him up so he did not have to drive home. Patient stated he had chipped his tooth when he fell from the chair.

Now treatment includes no strenuous activity for 6 weeks, no travel for 3 months. Follow-up with cardiology in 3 month for reevaluation.

Client fainted in the post-vaccine monitoring area at 12:57. The left forehead made contact with the floor. LOC for 5-10 seconds. PHN responded right away and advised client to remain laying on the floor while EMS was called. Vitals were WNL and client was coherent upon waking. Oriented x3. Fire EMS and hospital EMTs both responded and determined that client was OK. Offered client transport to ER for further evaluation but client declined. Discussed s/sx of concussion and when to seek treatment over the coming days. Continued to monitor client in first aid room -provided ice and water. Advised to call emergency contact for a ride home - client declined. Discussed importance of monitoring for concussion. Also discussed s/sx of allergic reaction. Client reports that he faints frequently, especially when receiving injections and other medical treatments. Advised client to request to receive 2nd dose laying down . Client remained on site for an hour and remained coherent and oriented. He called his mom and reports his mom and girlfriend would meet him at home but that he had no concerns and felt "normal".

Close
Patient received COVID-19 vaccination (Moderna) at 12:04pm. He sat at the table for observation period stood up and turned, stated he was feeling nauseated, took a step forward and then fainted forward onto a different table. Staff responded and lowered him backward onto the floor. Vitals assessed BP 100/62, P 72, O2 SAT 98% on room air. Ice pack applied to forehead; patient sweaty but responding, stated hands tingled but no other complaint. Breathing regular, not labored. Admits he had a similar reaction to a vaccination about 3 years ago does not recall type of vaccine but agreed not life threatening reaction. Denied having any allergies that he is aware of. Admits did not eat recently. (to Continuation Page)Additional information for Item 18: Patient stated he did not hit his face when he fell onto the table, denied physical injury. Assisted to sit up while on floor for a while, then to stand and sit back onto a chair. Given bottle of water and granola bar. Orthostatic blood pressure checked at 12:25pm sitting blood pressure was 110/72 and standing 108/62. Patient stated feeling well; had him wait out a 30-minute observation period rather than 15-minute period. Walked out of building with staff and his sister; encouraged sister to drive them home, and for him to eat.
23 2021-04-19 chest discomfort, chest pain, troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle Per patient, he developed chills, subjective fevers, body aches few hours after the vaccine on 04/1... Read more
Close
Per patient, he developed chills, subjective fevers, body aches few hours after the vaccine on 04/15. Also developed chest discomfort that progressively got worse over the next 1-2 days which prompted him to visit the ED on 04/18. He was found to have troponin elevation with diffuse J-point elevation. He received aspirin and was started on heparin drip. Chest pain completely resolved by the next day. Coronary angiogram was negative. Cardiology attributed stroke elevation and chest pain to myocarditis secondary to vaccine. Echo was normal with no evidence of pericardial effusion.

23 2021-04-20 loss of consciousness The patient developed fatigue, malaise, skin allodynia, fever (103.5F) and took acetaminophen and ib... Read more
Close
The patient developed fatigue, malaise, skin allodynia, fever (103.5F) and took acetaminophen and ibuprofen. The fever resolved but he was diaphoretic. He also had a headache, vomiting, then lost consciousness overnight and had a tonic-clonic seizure lasting 10 minutes. He was brought to the emergency department and had 2 more seizures there which was controlled with lorazepam. He was admitted to the hospital and started on broad spectrum antibiotics (acyclovir, ceftriaxone, and vancomycin). On 4/11/21, the patient was extubated and improved symptomatically, and antibiotics were narrowed to doxycycline. He was then discharged on doxycycline and levetiracetam.

Asked "what happened?". 911 was called, the paramedics came. Took vitals. They administered IV fluids and wheeled him out on a gurney in a neck brace.

23 2021-04-20 fainting While monitoring post-vaccination a woman yelled from her car window that ?he? fainted. Upon arrival... Read more
Close
While monitoring post-vaccination a woman yelled from her car window that ?he? fainted. Upon arrival, it was noted that a young man in the passenger seat was slumped with his head on his chest and unresponsive. It was witnessed that the passenger stiffened and started shaking as if he was having a seizure. The nurse was called. It was noted that the shaking lasted just a few seconds and he then relaxed and opened his eyes. Once the RN, received call that there was a person having a seizure, 3 nurses went to the scene. Once RN arrived at the car the patient was awake and alert. The patient was assessed, and he was able to answer questions. History of the patient from the mother revealed that he has responded to other vaccines in the past by having a vagal response. RN noted that there were no signs of patient being postictal. Patient was alert, oriented and stated that he was feeling better. EMS arrived and assessed patient and noted that he was in no distress. Patient denied transport to ED. RN educated patient on importance of reporting this to nurse prior to next vaccination.

23 2021-04-26 loss of consciousness After providing the Moderna vaccine, patient passed out going forward in slow motion and head was re... Read more
Close
After providing the Moderna vaccine, patient passed out going forward in slow motion and head was resting on table, then immediately started seizure-like action putting him in an upright position and I put my arms out to keep him from going forward and then he opened his eyes and came to. After talking to him while in observation, he mentioned that it felt like he was out for 5 minutes even though it only lasted for about 10-15 seconds. He mentioned that 12 years ago this happened (someone had thrown a rock and it hit his hand and when the nurse went to clean it, he went cold and when he came to it was exactly how it was after getting the vaccine). He only recalls feeling cold. When patient was about to leave, I suggested to him to reach out to his PCP to see if it's ok to give his 2nd dose with us or if he should be observed in a clinic setting. I did a follow up call a few hours later and he is doing fine.

23 2021-04-27 pallor Within 5 minutes post-vaccination, the patient began to feel dizzy and requested some water. He look... Read more
Close
Within 5 minutes post-vaccination, the patient began to feel dizzy and requested some water. He looked pallid, felt cold and clammy. I helped the patient out of his chair and onto the floor. I retrieved an instant cold pack and prepared it. When I returned to the patient 45 seconds later, he said the coolness of the ground helped. He did not feel dizzy anymore but his fingers were still tingling. I gave him the cold pack to place behind his neck and provided him a bottle of water. I had him lie prone for another 5 minutes. When I re-assessed, he was no longer feeling any negative symptoms and he no longer looked pale nor felt clammy.

23 2021-04-28 fainting 23-year-old-male presented for a Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. The patient was seated with his feet plan... Read more
Close
23-year-old-male presented for a Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. The patient was seated with his feet planted firmly on the floor. Immediately following vaccination, the patient had some blood running down his arm. I reached for a cotton swab to apply pressure and stop the bleeding, but the patient began to faint. I immediately positioned myself next to the patient; and held his head and arm to keep him in a sitting position. The patient regained consciousness after about twenty seconds. I began talking with the patient to ensure it was only a fainting spell. The patient was groggy but became clear-headed after about a minute. Upon further discussion, the patient stated this happens every time he sees blood, has bloodwork done or receives vaccines. The patient recounted a time when he cut his hand at work and fainted immediately. The patient was doing deep breathing exercises immediately after regaining consciousness. When asked, he said it helps him focus. I asked the patient if he wanted us to call anyone to pick him up but he refused. The patient was advised to remain seated, and we would transition him to the waiting area once he felt stable enough. After about 5 minutes the patient was helped to the waiting area (from our counseling room about 10-15 feet away). I advised him to remain in the waiting area for 30 minutes for further monitoring. The patient was offered juice, water and a snack but declined. After the 30 minute waiting period, the patient was clear-headed and appeared to be in the same state as when he arrived for the vaccine.

He denies any known alergey with any vaccination . At 3:50 Vittal signs rechecked which showed improvement BP 100/70, Pulse 72, resp 18, o2 sat 98% on room air, patient color returned to baseline, no further diaphoresis noted. At 4:00p Patient voiced no further complain. Vs: Bp 120/80, Pulse 72, O2 sat 98% , resp 20. Patient released home accompanied by family member post 30 minutes observation also writer recommended patient to follow with his PCP or if symptom persisted to seek emergency help. He verbalized understanding.

Close
Approx. 5 minutes following vaccine administration the patient developed a transient loss of consciousness resulting in a fall causing a small abrasion to his left forehead. The patient regained consciousness immediately. He was alert and oriented. No witnessed convulsions were reported. He denied any further neurological symptoms. He reported that he did eat breakfast. He denied symptoms of anaphylaxis or severe allergy symptoms. By this time, paramedics arrived and the his blood pressure (and orthostatics), pulse, blood sugar, pulse oximetry, EKG findings were all within normal limits. He refused to be taken to the Emergency Room as well as treatment for the head abrasion. There were no physical signs of fracture. The patient ambulated out of the clinical without difficulty, accompanied by his girlfriend. S/sx of concussion were discussed w/ patient and he or his family members are instructed to call 911 should he development further syncope or other neurological symptoms.

Acute epigastric abdominal pain/elevated troponin: The patient was chest pain free from the time of treatment with Pepcid, magic mouthwash, and Toradol in ED. His echo is without wall motion abnormalities, troponin is flat and remains chest pain free. The patient had a CT PE protocol study and CTA coronary without acute findings. He had a cardiac MRI which showed no acute myocarditis but may have had some delayed contrast enhancement and may represent prior myocarditis. He was started on low dose lisinopril 2.5 mg po daily for cardio-protection, will reduce physical activity with slow return to activity, and follow with cardiology with an urgent exercise stress test as an outpatient. His u tox shows cannabinoids and no other intoxicants, His lipid panel wnl, HDL 65, LDL 84, His TSH is wnl. His CRP and ESR is wnl. 2. Left axillary lymphadenopathy: Discussed with patient lymph nodes seen on CT scan in left axilla and left pectoral region. Patient cofnirmed he had a COVID 19 Moderna vaccine in the left arm on 4/3/2021. Epic documentation notes in the right axilla, but patient is clear that he had the vaccine in the left arm. Axillary lymphadenopathy is not surprising in this situation. 3. Small 4 mm nodules noted on CT scan: The patient had no infectious symptoms, no cough, no fever, and no elevated WBC. He does smoke marijuana but has no tobacco use. He can follow with PCP to further risk stratify the nodules, either with PPD, and consideration of repeat scan in 6-12 months as needed. 4. He can follow with his PCP for further evaluation as needed for this finding. Inpatient Consultants and summary of recommendations: 1. Pt called advice nurse, waiting to hear back. Pt reports don't need to go to urgent care or emergency. Will follow-up with primary provider. Spoke to pt about importance of seeing dr, make sure no bleeding/SE.

Close
The vaccine is affecting young people; My son felt like he had an aneurysm in his neck/He had pain in the large artery on the right side of his neck like a myocardial inflammation or something; The right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes; On Tuesday, on the right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes; shoulder pain; On Saturday night he was feeling tired and cold; feeling cold; On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain, like he had blood clots or thrombosis in his veins; On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain; This spontaneous case was reported by a patient and describes the occurrence of THROMBOSIS (On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain, like he had blood clots or thrombosis in his veins) and ANEURYSM (My son felt like he had an aneurysm in his neck/He had pain in the large artery on the right side of his neck like a myocardial inflammation or something) in a 23-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 027L21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concomitant products included BUPROPION HYDROCHLORIDE (ZYBAN) for an unknown indication. On 21-May-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 22-May-2021, the patient experienced THROMBOSIS (On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain, like he had blood clots or thrombosis in his veins) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain), FEELING COLD (feeling cold) and FATIGUE (On Saturday night he was feeling tired and cold). On 25-May-2021, the patient experienced ANEURYSM (My son felt like he had an aneurysm in his neck/He had pain in the large artery on the right side of his neck like a myocardial inflammation or something) (seriousness criterion medically significant), NECK PAIN (The right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes), SWELLING (On Tuesday, on the right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes) and ARTHRALGIA (shoulder pain). On an unknown date, the patient experienced VACCINATION COMPLICATION (The vaccine is affecting young people). At the time of the report, THROMBOSIS (On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain, like he had blood clots or thrombosis in his veins), ANEURYSM (My son felt like he had an aneurysm in his neck/He had pain in the large artery on the right side of his neck like a myocardial inflammation or something), VACCINATION COMPLICATION (The vaccine is affecting young people), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (On Saturday his legs were very heavy and had pain), NECK PAIN (The right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes), SWELLING (On Tuesday, on the right side of his neck, between the shoulder and neck, on the inside, he felt swelling, pressure pain, dull pain that comes and goes), FEELING COLD (feeling cold), ARTHRALGIA (shoulder pain) and FATIGUE (On Saturday night he was feeling tired and cold) outcome was unknown. No treatment information was provided. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to MOD-2021-182543 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

23 2021-06-06 troponin increased, chest pain Patient started having generalized weakness, fatigue, fever and headache after the second dose of hi... Read more
Close
Patient started having generalized weakness, fatigue, fever and headache after the second dose of his Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. These symptoms persisted throughout the next day. However, two days after the second Covid-19 shot patient developed severe chest pain that resulted in presentation in the ED. There was associated shortness of breath and diaphoresis. He was treated with Colchicine and Ibuprofen. He was also started on metoprolol because he had an 11-beat run of non-sustained ventricular tachycardia. He was discharged home on the fourth day to follow up with cardiology as outpatient.

23 2021-06-08 pallor Client received the 1st dose of the COVID vaccine (Moderna Lot # 027C21A and expiration date 07/01/2... Read more
Close
Client received the 1st dose of the COVID vaccine (Moderna Lot # 027C21A and expiration date 07/01/2021) at 1934. At 1948, EMT noticed that the client?s face was becoming pale and diaphoretic. EMT alerted PHN and both responded to the patient at 1948 and transitioned the client into the zero gravity chair. Client was reluctant to sit in the zero gravity chair and stated, ?I?m feeling anxious and this is not helping especially with my aunt.? Client?s aunt was very concerned and was anxious about what was happening and was standing over the client. PHN asked the aunt to sit in her seat and allow us to assess the client. PHN also explained to the client that this was a precaution and not meant to create more anxiety. PHN offered the client a juice which he accepted and drank. At 1952 client stated, ?I?m feeling fine now, I?m not sweating anymore.? Vital signs were taken at 1952 (Blood pressure 130/70, heartrate 87, Oxygen 98%). At 1952, client?s color had returned to his face and his skin was no longer diaphoretic. PHN asked the client if he has history of fainting from needles, and the client stated, ?no, but I have anxiety.? Vital signs were taken at 2002 (blood pressure 112/70, heart rate 68, oxygen 97%). Client stated that he ate two hours before receiving the vaccine. Vital signs taken at 2010 (blood pressure 114/74, heart rate 78, oxygen 97%). Vital signs taken at 2018 (112/74, heart rate 66, oxygen 97%). Client does not have any medical conditions or allergies and is not taking any medications. PHN provided education to the client on when to seek emergency medical services and to follow up with his primary care provider before receiving his second dose. At 2019 client stated, ?I?m feeling fine,? and left the facility unassisted with a steady gait.

Close
Within 12 hours of the injection, he felt fevers, chills, and fatigue. Then about 48 hours from the vaccine, he developed chest pain that radiated down the arms. He presented to the ER. His troponins have trended up and peaked at about 1.8. His CRP was elevated. Toradol helped significantly with his pain. He was pain free by the following day. No heart failure symptoms. No arrhythmias other than a single PVC, a single ventricular couplet, and one ventricular triplet.

Vitals taken = 101/64; 100% in room air; HR = 80; RR = 32; lung sounds clear to auscultation. Patient kept on vital sign monitoring and noted that saturations started decreasing to 90%, then 80%, then down to 70% in a span of several minutes + HR = reduced to 55. Patient also stated he was feeling faint & started feeling very weak & stopped talking & having difficulty breathing. MERT called and patient placed in a wheelchair & oxygen administered. Patient continued to look worse and not as responsive. MERT arrived around 317PM and took another set of vitals and brought patient to ED.

24 2021-03-21 chest discomfort I kept a log of the events that occurred. Notes: 25mg amitriptyline taken nightly for the last month... Read more
Close
I kept a log of the events that occurred. Notes: 25mg amitriptyline taken nightly for the last month, 200mg motrin I?ve never taken pain killers before this, time is in military. Mar 18 1430 (1 hour 30 mins after my shot) i have a compressing headache toward the back of my head so i take 1 motrin. 1700 i head home, take 1 amitriptyline and head straight to sleep. ( i have no apatite so no dinner ) Mar 19 0100 The pain starts, it?s unbearable. I am sweating heavily and im also shivering cold. i have a high fever I have body aches which turns my shivering into shaking which keeps my wife up all night. In my dreams i feel pain. I talked to my deceased mother, i hold my deceased cat and i relive some of my most regrettable moments. 0700 I wake up, the bed is soaking wet. I take a motrin and get dressed. it takes me an hour longer to get ready for work because, the pain has sapped my energy. My supervisor sends me home seeing how horrible I look. 0900 I take an amitriptyline and lay down. I ask me wife to close to the storm shutters to darken the room. They are normally pretty quiet to close but, this time they are deafeningly loud. I struggled to get 1 hour of sleep. 1500 I wake up due to shaking so bad that i hit my head on the wall. I then take 2 motrin and about 30 mins later i notice theres a tightness in my chest. i take 1 tums. I know that my body is exhausted from the pain and my mind is clouded but i really wanted to do all of the tasks that i was planning on doing this weekend. All of the tasks end up failing. 2100 i try the tasks again and end up failing again. 20 Mar 0100. I eat a pear and 2 cheetos. i do not take a amitriptyline and i lay down. i have no pain or fever. (Dream start) The dream i had is of me watching myself get thrown around by a ghost. The ghost possesses my body for a short time. I grab some kittens (cats are a comfort to me so im guessing that my subconscious trying to reel me back in) I then wake my sleeping wife and tell her theres a ghost and we need to leave. We walk outside and im in an old neighborhood that i grew up in, everything darkens and im in pitch black feeling my way around a room. I open my eyes and im in a hotel. The front desk staff will not let me take the kittens up to my room so i leave them. When i walk into the room, it?s full of kittens (dream end) and i wake up 21 Mar 0900 I wake up and I have a sore throat and tightness in my chest. The soreness prevents me from going back to sleep and the tightness in my chest causing some anxiety. Once I calm myself down and convince myself that im not having a heart attack I take 2 motrin and some tums and the pain goes away from the day. These could be some withdrawals from not taking amitriptyline since 19 mar in the morning. This is still happening as I write this report. (23 March 2021)
24 2021-03-25 loss of consciousness customer passed out and or had seizure and EMS was called. customer is alert and fine now.

3/11/21: patient presented and was admitted through ED for Shortness of Breath and choking on food. His saturation was as low as 70s and placed on nonrebreather. Patient was brought to ED and eventually required to be intubated because of hypoxic respiratory failure. During hospitalization patient has one episode of seizure. 24 2021-04-02 hypotension Earlier today, a Moderna patient at 3213 experienced a 15-30 second seizure after receiving his 1st ... Read more
Close
Earlier today, a Moderna patient at 3213 experienced a 15-30 second seizure after receiving his 1st Moderna vaccine. Shortly after sitting down for his 15-minute post immunization observation period, patient X began seizing resulting in him falling to the ground from a seated position to his left side and seizing for about 15-20 seconds. Patient was positioned in a left lateral recumbent position. Code white was called and EMT arrived on site within 10 minutes. Patient's immunization questionnaire did NOT have any contraindications that would warrant he should not receive the vaccine. Patient reported no allergies to medications/past immunizations/foods and reported no seizure and/or neurological condition. Once recovered and at baseline, patient reported having a light breakfast this morning and also having a needle phobia that may have played a role in his adverse response. Shortly after recovering, patient was coherent and aware of person, place, and time. He remained weak and fatigue and BP readings from EMT indicated hypotension. EKG was normal. Patient's mother happened to be waiting outside in the car. One of my associates was able to call her in and we updated here on the event. EMT recommended, and patient agreed, to be taken to the hospital for further examination.

24 2021-04-07 fainting The patient fainted 10 minutes after his shot and fell from the chair he was sitting in. He had a br... Read more
Close
The patient fainted 10 minutes after his shot and fell from the chair he was sitting in. He had a brief seizure while on the ground and someone called for help. I ran over and yelled for someone to call 911. He stopped seizing and stood up when he came to. I supported him and asked him to have a seat. He sat down and I asked how he felt and if he would like food or water. He said he felt okay but accepted the food and water. At that time, firefighters that had been shopping in the store arrived and started interviewing the patient. They took his pulse and blood sugar levels. Medics arrived and he continued to be monitored. After several minutes, he refused the ambulance and said he was feeling good enough to leave.

His vital signs WNL EMT was chatting with the patient and patient was responding to all questions. 24 2021-04-12 blood pressure increased At 3:15 PM, pt entered observation immediately after receiving his second dose of the Moderna CV 19 ... Read more
Close
At 3:15 PM, pt entered observation immediately after receiving his second dose of the Moderna CV 19 vaccine. Pt reported to the RN that he was feeling dizzy (Client reported feeling dizziness after receiving his first dose as well.). Pt also complained of piercing headache above his left eye and pain on the right side of his neck. The pain radiated down his entire left side of his body. The pt also felt tingling in the arm he received the vaccine in. Vitals were initiated and water was provided to the pt. Ice packs were applied to the patients forehead and nape of the neck where he felt the pain. Vitals NOT within normal limits. O2 saturation fluctuating and blood pressure was a bit elevated. Pt reports having a history of hypertension, but could not accurately recall having taken the medication that morning. EMS was activated at 3:35 PM because the pts O2 saturated was fluctuating dangerously and interventions were not successful in relieving the patients symptoms. Vitals were taken approximately 10 minutes apart. Vitals were not WNL. Pt continually reported that the pain was increasing and beginning to feel unbearable. It was noted that the patient had increasingly poor circulation in the arm he received the injection. O2 was taken on the opposite arm and saturation levels appeared normal. EMS at 4 PM. Vitals were taken, all WNL. Patient left with EMS at 4:05 PM and was transported to Hospital.

A 24 year old male who has completed a 15-minute observation period with the following signs and symptoms of an adverse reaction: loss of consiousness and other - dizziness. No hematoma or laceration on the head Observed for additional 30 minutes More likely syncopal episode vasovagal This is not an allergic reaction to the vaccine

24 2021-04-20 fainting Patient developed nausea and dizziness. He then had a witnessed syncopal event. HR was noted to be i... Read more
Close
Patient developed nausea and dizziness. He then had a witnessed syncopal event. HR was noted to be in the 50s. BP was noted to be 60 systolic initially. He denied any skin issues, mouth swelling, SOB or any other signs to suggest anaphylaxis. After several minutes, patient improved. Repeat BP 100/60, HR 56, SP02 99%. He recovered completely and elected to go home with family. Symptoms likely consistent with a vasovagal response to the injection.

24 2021-04-22 loss of consciousness 30 seconds after receiving the Moderna Vaccine patient passed out; Fell to floor after passing out; ... Read more
Close
30 seconds after receiving the Moderna Vaccine patient passed out; Fell to floor after passing out; Body was stiff when fell to floor; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (30 seconds after receiving the Moderna Vaccine patient passed out) in a 24-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 013A221A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Drug allergy (Cephalexin). Concomitant products included VITAMIN B COMPLEX (VITAMIN B CO) for an unknown indication. On 03-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (30 seconds after receiving the Moderna Vaccine patient passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant). 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced FALL (Fell to floor after passing out) and MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body was stiff when fell to floor). On 03-Apr-2021, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (30 seconds after receiving the Moderna Vaccine patient passed out), FALL (Fell to floor after passing out) and MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body was stiff when fell to floor) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Reported mentioned that ambulance was called after the events and paramedics monitored the patient in the ambulance, patient had stable vital signs and it was offered it take him to the emergency room, but patient declined.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
24 2021-04-22 pallor, loss of consciousness Pt was sitting in post-vaccination area for his 15 minute observation time when he passed out after ... Read more
Close
Pt was sitting in post-vaccination area for his 15 minute observation time when he passed out after a few minutes. He had fallen onto the floor beside his chair. I immediately went out to pt. His eyes were fluttering. I shook pt and asked if he was okay. Pt opened his eyes and sat up seemed disoriented and said that he felt nauseated. I told pt to lay down on his back and elevate his feet on the chair, and told my technician to grab a bucket, an ice pack, and to call code white. We applied the ice pack to pts head. A member of management and an EMT who happened to be in the store reported over very shortly. Pt said he did think that he hit his head and his head did hurt. We asked the pt if he wanted us to call an ambulance. Pt said no, he was feeling a little better and he just wanted to wait a little bit and then finish his shopping. Pt was feeling better and was able to get back into the chair and sit. Pt appeared pale and we got him a drink of water. Pt sat and rested for sometime and after about an hour he said he was okay and was going to finish his shopping.

Close
Patient vaccinated at 1035 - was in observation area for 30 minute observation. Patient reported to observation RN s/sx consistent with history of his anaphylactic allergy to shrimp - i.e. "throat closing" patient reported not feeling like he needed to get epi yet and did not want it. RN lead notified. Patient rapidly assessed as pale, slightly anxious but reserved. Patient was agreeable to taking 50mg Benadryl PO - given with sips of water. VS BP 140/80 P 92 Spo2 98%RA. - Stat team initiated - pt rapidly assessed and transferred to ED per patient request. Chart review indicates patient medicated in ER with Solumedrol, famotidine and loratadine and given a bolus of 1L of NS. VS remained stable throughout. Discharged with 2 days of 20mg Prednisone PO daily. Pt has supply of epi pens at home.

Patient received his covid-19 shot and went to sit in our waiting area for his 15 minutes. Customer in line immediately saw/called out for help as the patient passed out for less than 5 seconds. His head dropped and then immediately shot back up. Patient stated he did not recall the event and was trying to look something up on his phone. Patient stayed in our waiting area for about a hour until he felt comfortable walking around. During that time he denied any medical treatment and asked for some water which was provided to him. Once he felt comfortable enough he stated he wanted to just sit in his car. Tried reaching out to patient after he left and voicemail is full.
24 2021-04-22 fainting Patient was scheduled for his first Moderna vaccine on Friday April 23rd at 3:00 pm. Intern administ... Read more
Close
Patient was scheduled for his first Moderna vaccine on Friday April 23rd at 3:00 pm. Intern administered the vaccine. After receiving the vaccination patient was instructed to wait in the designated waiting area for 15 minutes. After 5-10 minutes, patient walked over to the drop-off window and stated that he was having a hard time breathing and his hands were going numb. Pharmacist on duty, immediately left the pharmacy and walked over to the patient. The patient then fainted in his arms and pharmacist was able to gently bring him to the ground. Patient wanted pharmacist to call and notify his wife which at the time was waiting in her car. His wife arrived immediately. Technician, called 911 and ran EpiPen over to pharmacist and technician prepared a damp cloth and placed it behind patients neck. Pharmacist then administered one dose of adult Epi-pen. Minutes later patient still said he could not breathe and that his symptoms were getting worse. Pharmacist then administered second dose of Epi-pen. Within 3-5 minutes after receiving second Epi-pen dose, the ambulance came. EMT's gave the patient oxygen and placed him on a gurney. EMT's then took patient to ambulance and drove him to hospital. Going through patient's immunization consent form and in talking to patient, there was no indication that the patient has ever had any reactions to any vaccinations in the past.

Patient appeared to regain consciousness for a few seconds and then began to convulse again for 5 seconds. Patient then regained full consciousness with no postictal confusion.

24 2021-04-30 loss of consciousness Passed out for a little bit; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occu... Read more
Close
Passed out for a little bit; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out for a little bit) in a 24-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 017C21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 23-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 23-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out for a little bit) (seriousness criterion medically significant). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out for a little bit) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medication information was not provided. Patient passed out for a little bit after his shot. After he came to, he felt thirsty and got some food. No treatment information was provided. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

24 2021-05-04 haemoglobin decreased, chest pain, arrhythmia, troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle On Sunday April 25th 2021, I woke up with severe chest pain that went up to the right side of my nec... Read more
Close
On Sunday April 25th 2021, I woke up with severe chest pain that went up to the right side of my neck, as well as having shortness of breath. I was admitted into the ER and they ran blood work, did a CT scan and x ray of My chest. When my bloodwork came back, it showed I had very elevated troponin levels. Because I was having continuous pain, I was given morphine but it didn't work. So they upped it and gave me dilaudid and that took the pain away. It was in the doctors best interest I get transported to a facility with a good cardiatric team. Upon arriving to the new facility, they further drew my blood and ran more tests. I got admitted as an in patient on the cardiatric floor. The cardiologists ordered for me to have an echocardiogram done, another CT scan with a special protocol to view my heart, and an MRI done of my heart. After my echocardiogram and CT scan came back fine, the doctors said they'd be surprised if the MRI DIDNT show something. When that result came back, it did reveal my heart was still inflamed. After ruling out all other possibilities they concluded that the 2nd Dose of Moderna COVID vaccination I'd received was the culprit behind my diagnosis. My diagnosis being, a case of myocarditis as well as a mild heart arrhythmia. For the next several months I am kn a medication called metoprolol 25mg, 2 half tablets a day, to correct my heart arrhythmia and relieve stress from my heart as well as minimize the amount of stress I encounter each day. No heavy lifting pushing or pulling of any sort for the next 3 months.

Close
Fainted, history of same symptom. No acute distress BP 95/53 ; 103/54 HR: 76 Sp02: 95% Seen and cleared by EMS
