Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Additional Details: passed out 1 minute post injection. pt recovered consciousness immediately. he had glasses on, which caused a cut on his nose because he fell forward. we called 911 and ems came and checked him out. he was feeling fine other than his nose was sore. ems felt he experienced a vagal response. bp was fine, so he went home.
24 2021-05-08 pallor, loss of consciousness, blood pressure increased A few seconds after shot, pt became pale and immunizer asked if he was ok. His muscles tensed and sh... Read more
Close
A few seconds after shot, pt became pale and immunizer asked if he was ok. His muscles tensed and shook a little and he passed out, falling slightly to the right. The technician was able to place herself between him and the floor and slowly lower down, leaning against the wall of the pharmacy. By this point, about 30 seconds at most had passed, and pt was awake and cognitive, but had no recollection of passing out or how he had gotten to the floor. He did know his name and where he was, but was breathing heavy. We took his blood pressure at this point and it was 82/46 with a pulse in the 40's as well. Pt refused ambulance and we had him continue to sit on the floor. Patient mentioned he had this type of reaction in past to other vaccines (not stating what), though only telling us prior he had "slight dizziness once". He also stated he had not had anything to eat or drink that am so we got him a snack and some water. Patient continued to breath deeper as we suggested and stay on the floor as we called mgmt from the store. We took blood pressure about 10 minutes later and it had gone up to 117/71. and then again 10 minutes later and it was 121/69. After 30 minutes total, pt asked if he could stand and leave. He stood with no dizziness and said he felt "fine". We called patient approximately an hour later at his residence to make sure he got home ok and patient stated he had no other symptoms at that time and continued to feel "normal".

Close
I?ve been having palpitations, headaches, tremors, no longer can drink coffee, or any other stimulant, cannot do any sort of physical exercise except for walking a short distance. As soon as I carry anything I immediately start having palpitations. This has been happening for more than a month now.

Patient received the shot. Within a few minutes he became light headed, chest pain, and was hot. We gave him a cold pack and water to drink. We checked his BP which was elevated. We contacted EMS, they advised us to give him four 81mg ASA. The EMS came and evaluated him and he was feeling much better.

24 2021-05-10 fainting After receiving first moderna covid dose, pt was sitting in our waiting area and fainted, falling ov... Read more
Close
After receiving first moderna covid dose, pt was sitting in our waiting area and fainted, falling over sideways and hitting his head on the floor. Technician, Intern, and myself were checking on patient immediately after he fainted. He very quickly "came to" and we then helped him up and into the IMZ room to sit. A store manager was very close when it happened and let other management know of code white. While monitoring patient, I called 911 to get paramedics to the scene. I stayed on the phone with them while monitoring patient and asking questions. Paramedics soon arrived and a store manager began filling out incident form. The paramedics assessed patient and asked if he would like them to take him to the hospital. Pt declined. We gave patient cold cloth, water, and ice pack. He had a small bump on the upper right hand side of his forehead. He was feeling much better when he left, had someone to drive him. I encouraged the pt to go to ER if any pain, vision changes, headaches, nausea/vomiting.
24 2021-05-13 loss of consciousness He got the vaccine, mom received her shot and the pharmacist said they were done, and he told his mo... Read more
Close
He got the vaccine, mom received her shot and the pharmacist said they were done, and he told his mother that he was feeling a little dizzy and anxious and wanted to sit down. They were going to the car and he got in first as he was going to drive, and mother got in the car, and he acted like his head was spinning, had a blank stare and started making weird sounds like he could not breath, started foaming at the mouth and then he passed out. She called 9-1-1 and when they got there he was coming out of it. They checked his VS and said that everything was OK, and felt that he did not need to go to the hospital but it was their call. He didn't want to go either. She drove him home and he slept OK, he had a bad headache and felt extremely tired and lied down. He seemed to be OK the next day other than his arm being sore, but no other issues and he's been fine since. The pharmacy did not have them wait before leaving to make sure they were OK, the pharmacist told her they were fine and they could go, but the incident occurred within 5 minutes of the vaccine.

24 2021-05-23 chest pain, heart rate abnormal Initially I had experienced the standard adverse effects of drowsiness, a little difficulty sleeping... Read more
Close
Initially I had experienced the standard adverse effects of drowsiness, a little difficulty sleeping, minor chills. The next day following my Dose 1 of the Moderna Vaccine, I started noticed chest pains on both sides of the chest. It wasn't from breathing and not very consistent or something I could re-create on command. It seemed to happen every hour for a few seconds and was a sudden, sharp pain. That was a concern for me so I did some basic internet searches and found that Chest pains are a symptom of the vaccine. I didn't think too much of it after that but It was a concern I kept in my head. My timeline gets a little foggy here but either that same day or the following day, the chest pains were still happening and I wasn't feeling 100%. One evening I went to take a bath. As I was laying in the water, my heart rate felt off, almost as if it was skipping a beat or not in the right rhythm. I remember laying in the bathtub, trying to count my pulse or seeing if I could "catch" the incorrect beat. Rather than one normal heartbeat it felt like there was 2 beats very closely timed with each other. My heart rate felt faster than normal considering I was only laying down in water and didn't do any exercises the past few days. Unfortunately I never was able to find a good way to track the pulse and timing, but I was sure that something was wrong. I had difficulty sleeping that night because I kept feeling something wrong with my heart rhythm. I got worried that I would need to go to the emergency room, but I told myself to sleep it off and if the chest pains and awkward heart beat continues for 5 days, I would go see a doctor. As for an outcome, thankfully I stopped noticing it around day 4 and haven't had chest pains since. I am extremely worried as to how my body will react to Dose #2.
24 2021-05-23 chest pain Chest pain on 2nd and 3rd nights after the vaccination for approximately 3 hours each episode.
24 2021-05-23 heart rate increased, chest pain I was woken up by severe chest pain, which continued for the next few hours. I felt the pain above m... Read more
Close
I was woken up by severe chest pain, which continued for the next few hours. I felt the pain above my stomach, below my sternum, and above my heart, and it was a sharp, stabbing pain. My heart was also beating faster than normal. The stabbing chest pain continued for the next few hours before eventually subsiding. However, for the next few days I occasionally felt a fleeting, stabbing chest pain. After a few days, it went away completely. I had never had such a sustained chest pain before.

Close
At 9:10 PM on 5/11/21, I experienced chills that required multiple layers of heavy blankets. This lasted till about 10:20 PM on 5/11/21. I was shaking a lot. I never experienced chills that extreme before. At 10:30PM on 5/11/21, I took one Tylenol. At about 2:00AM on 5/12/21, I woke up with heat flashes for an unknown time due to sleeping. At 7:30AM on 5/12/21, I woke up to a heart rate of 105 beats per minute. This lasted for about six hours. I could feel my heart pounding through my chest. During this event, I also experienced shortness of breath. That lasted for about the same time. At 9:00AM on 5/12/21, I took one Tylenol. By 4:00PM on 5/12/21, I started to feel better and my heart rate got down to my normal level of 70 beats per minute while resting.

On Thursday morning (May 27) he was at rest and stated that's when he first felt chest pressure. Chest pain got worse since yesterday, prompting a visit to urgent care then urgent care sent patient to ED. 24 2021-05-27 loss of consciousness passed out; dizzy; moaning; gasping; foaming in the mouth; headache; tired; This spontaneous case wa... Read more
Close
passed out; dizzy; moaning; gasping; foaming in the mouth; headache; tired; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) in a 24-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 002C21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 11-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 11-May-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS (dizzy), MOANING (moaning), DYSPNOEA (gasping), FOAMING AT MOUTH (foaming in the mouth), HEADACHE (headache) and FATIGUE (tired). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out), DIZZINESS (dizzy), MOANING (moaning), DYSPNOEA (gasping), FOAMING AT MOUTH (foaming in the mouth), HEADACHE (headache) and FATIGUE (tired) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 11-May-2021, Vital signs measurement: normal (normal) normal. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. The patient had a severe reaction when he was getting in the car to leave. He was dizzy first then had a blank stare. After that he started moaning and gasping and foaming in the mouth then passed out. They called the paramedics. Vitals were normal and the patient was given the choice to go to the hospital but declined. Patient felt very tired and had a headache later. No concomitant medications were reported. No corrective treatment was provided. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However, medical history and concomitant medication details are required for further evaluation. Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 18-May-2021: Follow up included correct DOB was confirmed; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However, medical history and concomitant medication details are required for further evaluation.

The patient received pain medication for symptom relief, nitroglycerin x1 with no improvement of symptoms, and the patient was briefly on a heparin drip. Patient was advised to remain on the floor and attempt to stand only under supervision of the pharmacist. After approximately twenty minutes the patient was able to stand and walk with no difficulty and was allowed to leave. No signs of injury or trauma were noted.

6/15 Headache, swelling L axilla, by 6/18 - chest pain, pressure. ED visit: testing revealed increased troponin and pos D Dimer. The patient was administered the vaccination, observed for 15 minutes following the vaccination, after which he left to return to work at a pharmacy. The patient came back into the store about on hour later to pick up some things for his pharmacy and reported feeling a little chest pain. The patient was then informed to keep monitoring the pain and if it got any worse to go to the doctors office. About 2 hours later, the patient called when on the way to the emergency room and reported chest pain and a fever of 102 degrees (at the highest). Around 3pm, which was about 6 hours after the vaccination was administered, the patient reported chest pain was alleviated and that the emergency room treated him for a migraine/nausea with Tylenol #3, Fioricet and Zofran.

Close
During the first night after receiving vaccine I started to have SEVERE shaking / full body muscle spasms-hypertonicity that lasted 60-90 minutes. Required 30 minutes hot shower to calm down shaking symptoms. Initially thought episodes were caused/triggered by cold temperature (still possibility) but now thinking its triggered by anxiety. Heart rate almost spikes to 120-130 BPM. No fever and normal blood pressure is noted when episodes happen. Occurrences is not routine and seem to be random. Very concerning considering symptoms lasted for 2 + weeks now. I do not have health care or ability to see PCP/GP without paying out of pocket. Now please understanding the severity of these episodes, to the point where it resembles severe Parkinson's symptoms. Along with those I still have the normal side effects, fatigue (extreme) , mood changes, joint aches, intolerance to cold off and on, and elevated HR.

25 2021-02-22 fainting I began to feel ill in bed. I stood up to get some water. While pouring the water, I felt much worse... Read more
Close
I began to feel ill in bed. I stood up to get some water. While pouring the water, I felt much worse - out of it. I dropped the cup but it didn't register with me. I tried pouring again but dropped the pitcher too. My girlfriend came out, woken up by the noise, and then saw me collapse and start shaking. I don't remember anything after dropping the pitcher. When I came to (maybe a few seconds later?), I asked if I hit my head. She said I hadn't (luckily she was there to catch my head) but I did urinate on myself. I was very cold shivering, teeth clattering. She got me over to the shower where I turned the temperature all the way up and sat underneath. After a while I began to feel better - the fog had cleared for sure. I got in bed after and slept it off. When I woke up I had sweat through my clothes and still had a mild fever, but aside from that I felt almost entirely better. It's been about two days since then and I still feel completely well.

Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA The day after I received the 2nd dose of the vaccine I had a headache. That same night I ran a fever and woke up the next morning feeling ok. I was taking a shower and it was reported to me by my fiancé I had passed out, started to seize, my eyes rolled to the back of my head. A few minutes later I woke up on the floor and asked what had happened. I was not sure what had happened. I felt fine when I woke up. When first responders arrived they asked me if I knew who I was, the date, the president, where I lived to all I was able to answer correctly. I went to the ER and they did a ECG, blood test, urine test, chest x-ray, CT of my head and they said everything came back normal. I was prescribed Keppra and have an MRI scheduled in the coming week.

25 2021-04-10 fainting Approximately 2 minutes after COVID-19 Moderna vaccination 0.5ml injected, patient fainted in the ch... Read more
Close
Approximately 2 minutes after COVID-19 Moderna vaccination 0.5ml injected, patient fainted in the chair located in our 15 minute waiting area. RPh was called to respond. Patient was unresponsive upon arrival. Pulse present and strong, breathing appeared normal. Patient was aroused by touch and voice. Upon arousal patient was lethargic but could indicate name and DOB. Patient verbalized feeling warm, faint, and nauseated. Care was administered by visual monitor, cold compress to neck and forehead, water, and fan placed near patient. Patient's girlfriend was present and was a diabetic and took patient's BS reading with her own glucometer. BS was 98. Patient vomited x 1. Took approximately 50 minutes for patient to be fully awake and ready to try standing. Upon standing patient was steady on the feet. Patient was advised to discuss reaction with primary care provider and was assisted, when ready, to the door.

EMS staffs checked his vital signs about 10 mins later. His BP, oxygen saturation and EKG were normal. His friend picked him up about 45 mins.
25 2021-04-20 nosebleed Pt has had significant generalzied weakness and a bloody nose that persisted for over 10 minutes.
25 2021-04-20 loss of consciousness, heart rate decreased, fainting Probable vasovagal syncope. I had no anxiety up to and during the vaccination. Immediately after bei... Read more
Close
Probable vasovagal syncope. I had no anxiety up to and during the vaccination. Immediately after being vaccinated, I grew dizzy and felt my vision fading. I asked for some water and waited. Three minutes after vaccination, I lost consciousness and forcefully fell on the floor, scraping my head and biting the front of my tongue. I was immediately wheelchaired over to a nearby bench and tended to by a nurse and two doctors. I was sweating profusely, had a low heart rate and chills, and felt tired. After forty-five minutes, a bottle of water and a can of orange juice, I had recovered and was dismissed. I already had a ride waiting to take me home.
25 2021-04-21 loss of consciousness Pt has received second dose of the Moderna series. He had completed his fifteen minutes of observat... Read more
Close
Pt has received second dose of the Moderna series. He had completed his fifteen minutes of observation and after standing to leave, he collapsed onto the floor hitting his head at 1152. Myself,RN rushed over and began to evaluate condition. Pt was oriented x4 and stated he had become light headed after standing. Stated that his head hurt from hitting it on the floor. Began monitoring vital signs. Initial VS showed BP of 138/82, Pulse of 83, and respirations at 14. Applied oxygen per nasal cannula until we could monitor oxygen level which was found to be 96%. After continuing to talk with pt, he again passed out while still laying down. We were able to awaken him and he was still oriented x4. . Second VS at 1159 showed BP of 130/82, P 82, and 02 of 96. Pt reported his history of seizures. Continued to monitor. Third set of VS at 1204 were BP 124/78, P 78, R 12, 02 96. Police arrived at 1205 and ambulance arrived at 1209. Pt refused to be taken in by ambulance and continued to converse. We sat pt up to sitting position. At 1207, BP was 124/80, P 79, and 02 96. He was then moved up to sit in chair but after sitting there at approximately 1215, pt again passed out but was supported by the EMT. After regaining consciousness, he then agreed to be transported to hospital via ambulance.

Patient fainted approximately 3 to 5 mins after receiving the first dose. They were standing and fell to the ground during the 15 min mandatory observation period. EMS was called and checked his vitals. Patient refused to go to the ER. He was advised to continue to monitor his symptoms and call EMS or his doctor immediately if symptoms worsen. Patient advised to download mobile CDC reporting app. EMS checked his vitals and all were normal.

Systemic: Allergic: Anaphylaxis-Medium, Systemic: Confusion-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Hyperventilation-Medium, Systemic: Hypotension-Medium, Systemic: Shakiness-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: immediately after first dose pt head started to lower, eyes closed, slid down in chair. respiratory rate decreased for several seconds then panic breathing occured thereafter. pt was sweating profusely and skin was cold and clammy. could not verbally respond for 30-45 seconds. after a minute pt could talk and answer question. blood pressure was taken 3 different times 5 minutes apart 75/43, 87/46, 93/52. Pt was feeling fine a half hour later and was called 4 hours later to follow up.
25 2021-04-22 pallor After I administered the vaccine, the patient left the shot room and sat down with his mother on the... Read more
Close
After I administered the vaccine, the patient left the shot room and sat down with his mother on the bench. A minute or two later at most, we heard his mom yelling for us and I could see him kind of slumped over while she kept him sitting up. I ran out with an EpiPen and saw him on the bench, slumped forward but coming to - he was able to speak with us and answer questions (his name, DOB, today's date, where he was). He was dizzy and his face was pale and sweaty, but he said otherwise he was okay. We provided him water and Gatorade, which he drank and said it helped. We had them stay for 30 minutes from that point to monitor for improvement, and there were no further issues. We checked in with them before they left, and the patient said he was fine and back to normal.

25 2021-04-23 loss of consciousness patient passed out
25 2021-04-23 fainting Patient is a 25 year old male A & O x4 with a chief complaint of a syncopal episode. Patient was si... Read more
Close
Patient is a 25 year old male A & O x4 with a chief complaint of a syncopal episode. Patient was sitting in a chair in the observation area approximately 10 minute post vaccine. Patient struck his head when he fell and presented with a small abrasion on the top of his head complaining of neck pain 1/10. Cervical spine immediately immobilized and EMS activated. Patient stated that he has had similar events in the past when he had his blood drawn. Patient denied any other medical history, no allergies and stated that he takes no medications. Vital signs obtained with all vitals within normal limits. Patient stated that he felt slightly dizzy but denied any other complaints. Negative chest pain, SOB, weakness, blurred vision, tinnitus, nausea and no sign of allergic reaction. Patient had equal grips and pushes with no signs of stroke. Medic Engine with EMT arrived and assumed patient care. Patient went via ambulance Hospital.
25 2021-04-24 inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle Received second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 3/29/2021. On 3/31/2021, I was awoken at app... Read more
Close
Received second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 3/29/2021. On 3/31/2021, I was awoken at approximately 0230 am with severe chest pain. I went to the emergency room later that day and medical staff stated a blood test showed my heart was under stress. My systolic blood pressure also dropped into the low 80's. I was admitted to the hospital and stayed for two nights as multiple tests were conducted. I was discharged from the hospital on 4/2/2021 with the diagnosis of myocarditis and pericarditis. It was determined the only cause of this condition for me could be the COVID vaccine.
25 2021-04-26 pallor, fainting At approximately 12:45pm on 4/27/2021, patient received his first dose of Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine,... Read more
Close
At approximately 12:45pm on 4/27/2021, patient received his first dose of Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine, given by Pharmacist on duty. During the 15 minute observation period following the vaccine, the patient's father asked the pharmacist to check his blood pressure. While the pharmacist was checking his blood pressure (approximately 2-3 minutes following the vaccination), she notices the patient was starting to look pale and shut and squint his eyes as if he was having trouble focusing his vision. The pharmacist questioned the patient to make sure he felt ok, and the patient said his vision was going black and he was getting dizzy and lightheaded. The pharmacist moved nearby objects out of the way to prepare to lay the patient on the ground. When returning to the patient, he was staring blankly, hunched over, unresponsive, no pulse felt on a 5 second check, and had rheum dripping from nose and eyes. At 12:50pm the pharmacist instructed technician to call 911. Patient was lowered to the floor in the supine position where he remained unresponsive and no pulse could be felt on a 10 second check, but chest rise could not be evaluated as patient started to have convulsions. Convulsions ceased after approximately 15 seconds and patient started groaning and moving his head and said he could hear but he couldn't open his eyes yet. Patient remained supine and the Pharmacist continued to carry on conversation with patient until EMS arrived at 12:57pm to evaluate patient. EMS attributed the instance to syncope related to the vaccine. The patient denied ambulatory care to the hospital for any further evaluation. Patient denied history of fainting expect for ?one unprovoked episode at his grandmother's house when he thinks his blood sugar got too low.?

Close
After approximately 15 minutes of receiving the vaccine, patient experienced dizziness and hypotension. He appeared pale, sweating and cold. At 10:21AM, patient's blood pressure was 85/44. We called paramedics and they arrived at 10:29AM. Patient refused to go to the hospital. At 10:41AM, patient's blood pressure was at 119/66. He was stable and left our clinic.

Close
Patient vaccinated with Moderna COVID vaccine 3/25/21 and 4/22/21. Patient presented to Hospital 4/29 with SOB. The patient actually stated the SOB started 4/21 and he received his second Moderna vaccination 4/22. SOB progressively worsened from 4/21 until ED visit. Patient thought it was asthma flare. 4/29 04:00 CTA chest showing extensive bilateral pulmonary emboli, left greater than right. Started on heparin protocol for PE in the ER. 4/29 afternoon, patient is currently an inpatient at GSH on a heparin drip for anticoagulation.
25 2021-04-29 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle Developed chest pain. Found to have myocarditis. Receiving NSAID for treatment.
25 2021-04-29 loss of consciousness, fainting, pallor, chest discomfort 25 year-old male who had a witnessed fainting episode, leaned on left side, with arm twitching appro... Read more
Close
25 year-old male who had a witnessed fainting episode, leaned on left side, with arm twitching approximately 10 minutes post 2nd dose of covid moderna covid vaccine. LOC approximately 15 seconds. Covid Observer RN called 911. Pt regained consciousness, able to state name and simple "yes and no" questions. Pt does not recall events prior to passing out; he is pale, cool and diaphoretic to touch. Initial BP 70/40, HR 32, unable to obtain Spo2 on RA due to cool extremities. Pt refused to be placed on supine position, states "I feel better sitting up." Then pt c/o chest tightness and profusely sweating, NRB mask placed. Covid Observer RN stayed with pt until 911 EMS crew arrived. Pt was taken via gurney to ED.
25 2021-04-30 chest discomfort, troponin increased I woke up with pressure on my chest and pain on my left arm around the elbow. After a couple of minu... Read more
Close
I woke up with pressure on my chest and pain on my left arm around the elbow. After a couple of minutes, I began to have a lot of cold sweat, and both the pressure in my chest and pain in my arm began to increase. Then I began feeling a tingling sensation on my neck/chin. After that, I felt lightheaded and decided to go to the hospital. At my arrival to the ER, I was given aspirin and heparin. I got a couple of EKGs and a chest X-Ray, as well as some blood work. I was then transferred to the medical center, where I had some more blood tests and EKGs done. I was also treated with Indocin, Lipitor and Aspirin. At around 9PM, I began feeling the pressure on my chest again, although with decreased intensity. I was given morphine and the pain went away. This event repeated at around 10AM next morning with the same outcome. After that I got an Echocardiogram, and began to be treated with Metoprolol. No other pain events happened for the rest of my stay at the hospital. On the next morning, April 26th, I was taken to an angiogram to rule out Coronary Dissection. After the test, I was discharged with a prescription for Metoprolol.

25 2021-05-03 pallor Shortly after receiving the vaccination the patient began to feel light headed. He stood up and fell... Read more
Close
Shortly after receiving the vaccination the patient began to feel light headed. He stood up and fell back to the floor, landing in a sitting position and not striking his head. He was helped into a chair by a bystander and I was alerted to the situation. He appeared pale and diaphoretic, then he became unresponsive with his eyes up and his arms tensing up. After about 10 seconds he became responsive again. EMS had been called earlier and arrived a few minutes after this and he was evaluated and left with EMS. It was unclear if he had simply passed out or if he had a seizure. He had no previous history of seizure, though the presentation seemed somewhat atypical for just passing out.
25 2021-05-03 platelet count decreased, low blood platelet count Patient is a 25-year-old male with past medical history of depression with anxiety, esophagitis and ... Read more
Close
Patient is a 25-year-old male with past medical history of depression with anxiety, esophagitis and hemorrhoids. Patient presented with petechial rashes all throughout his body started on Friday 4/9 after getting a tattoo the day prior and his first moderna covid vaccine 3/28. On admission patient was found to have a platelet count of 1. Heme/ onc was consulted and thrombocytopenia was deemed secondary to ITP. Hepatitis B panel, showed previous hepatitis B infection, although results may be inaccurate due to patient receiving IVIG prior to hepatitis panel being done. Patient also had an equivocal syphilis result, which also could be a false positive due to immune response. Patient received 2 IVIG, 4 days of Decadron, and 1 dose of Nplate. Patient did not receive rituximab, due to stable increasing platelet count. Patient received hepatitis-B prophylaxis for 2 days in case he were to receive rituximab. Platelet count now stable at 25, to follow-up with hematology in 1 week outpatient for repeat CBC. Patient also to follow-up with his Primary Care Physician in 1 week.

Close
Prior to administering the vaccine, the patient had expressed an intense phobia of needles to pharmacy staff, and this was communicated to the pharmacist. After administering the vaccine, the patient stated that they felt lightheaded. The pharmacist then asked the patient if they wanted to remain seated, and the patient lost consciousness for approx. 60 seconds. Per Pharmacy protocol, code white, (indicating injury) was declared over the stores radio system. The patient was lowered onto the floor, legs were elevated and cold compress applied as per protocol. Following the patent regaining consciousness, they declined paramedic assistance and was provided with an electric cart to aid in leaving the premises.

25 2021-05-06 pallor, chest discomfort Patient received second dose of medication after not concerns or issues with first dose. After appro... Read more
Close
Patient received second dose of medication after not concerns or issues with first dose. After approximately 25 minutes the patient started experiencing chills, dizziness and tightness in chest. The patient stated no issue with breathing but was provided water and was monitored with bedside care following concerns. Patient started experiencing labored breathing at approximately 11:50AM. Explained that his throat was feeling tight but was fine. Coached through breathing techniques and color was changing to more pale. Benadryl and Epi prepared. Patient was provided Benadryl as he was stating his throat did not feel "tight" rather he was feeling weight in his chest when breathing. 50mg of liquid Benadryl was administered at 11:52AM. Within 3 minutes patient color was returning and breathing was coming with more ease. Patient seemed more relaxed and stated he was feeling better. More water and close monitoring. Patient stated chills still present and fingers were cold 12:00PM. Provided blanket. Patient stated on sight from 11:00-1:00. Patient was feeling no concerns with breathing, chills were subsiding at 12:30pm. He was provided Benadryl, Tylenol and water to go home to father's care. He was provided option to be taken to walk in clinic or ER for further evaluation but stated that he felt comfortable with going home as he felt like himself.

Close
Per the observation nurse, the patient was sitting down in a chair, looking down on his phone, when he suddenly fell from his chair to the floor on his left-side. Patient was unresponsive for about 4-5 seconds with convulsion-like movements, while he was on the floor. He then regained consciousness, he independently stood up and assisted to sit in the chair. Patient was pale in color, cool and clammy to the touch at this time (while alert and oriented). Two doctors were at the patient's side to assess him. Vitals were taken. Patient was alert and oriented (answering all questions from the MD). Patient continued to be monitored and he was given water to rehydrate for an hour after the incident. He was sent home with his wife. Prior to leaving, the patient was alert and oriented. He stated he felt better.

25 2021-05-18 chest pain, heart rate increased, inflammation of the pericardium Pericarditis. Initial symptoms were noticeable upon waking up the morning after receiving the vaccin... Read more
Close
Pericarditis. Initial symptoms were noticeable upon waking up the morning after receiving the vaccine, ~ 20 hours after vaccination. Initial symptoms: extremely elevated heart rate (~160 bpm). Heart rate fell to more reasonable, but still high, ~120 bpm after 2-3 hours. Roughly 36 hours after vaccination, began noticing soreness in the chest. Upon waking the following day (~48 hours after vaccination), chest soreness had progressed to pain (rating: 4/10), which remained roughly 6 hours to roughly 1400 that day, when the pain subsided along with all symptoms. Later, at roughly 2000 the same day (~58 hours after vaccination), there was a sudden and extreme flair up of chest pain (rating: 8/10) which radiated down the inside of both arms, this lasted 1.5 hours and then subsided just as suddenly as it came on. I went to sleep, then was woken up by another extreme episode of pain (rating: 7/10) at 0230 the morning of 15 May, again extreme chest pain radiating down both arms.

Close
Three days post-vaccination #1, patient developed chest tightness and shortness of breath, has continued for past 3 weeks. Had syncopal episode on 5/26/21 and presented to Emergency Department at facility. Was found to be COVID positive with result on 5/26/21. Admitted to facility on 5/26/21, and diagnosed with pericarditis. Hospitalist suspects that pericarditis could be result of Moderna vaccine, as patient was previously young and healthy with no chronic conditions, with symptom onset 3 days post-vaccination. Patient also had expected post-vaccination symptoms, including flu-like symptoms, fever, chills.
25 2021-05-27 hypotension motion sickness in car; micro movement of the eye; lack of focus of the eye; prolonged dizziness; in... Read more
Close
motion sickness in car; micro movement of the eye; lack of focus of the eye; prolonged dizziness; intense headache; Dropping blood pressure; Myalgia; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of MOTION SICKNESS (motion sickness in car), EYE MOVEMENT DISORDER (micro movement of the eye), OCULAR DISCOMFORT (lack of focus of the eye), DIZZINESS (prolonged dizziness), HEADACHE (intense headache) and HYPOTENSION (Dropping blood pressure) in a 25-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 040B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient experienced MOTION SICKNESS (motion sickness in car) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), EYE MOVEMENT DISORDER (micro movement of the eye) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), OCULAR DISCOMFORT (lack of focus of the eye) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), DIZZINESS (prolonged dizziness) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HEADACHE (intense headache) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and HYPOTENSION (Dropping blood pressure) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On an unknown date, the patient experienced MYALGIA (Myalgia). At the time of the report, MOTION SICKNESS (motion sickness in car), EYE MOVEMENT DISORDER (micro movement of the eye), OCULAR DISCOMFORT (lack of focus of the eye), DIZZINESS (prolonged dizziness), HEADACHE (intense headache), HYPOTENSION (Dropping blood pressure) and MYALGIA (Myalgia) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Blood pressure measurement: mmHg (Low) Dropping blood pressure. On an unknown date, Cardiac stress test: (Inconclusive) Inconclusive. On an unknown date, Magnetic resonance imaging: (normal) had a cyst but nothing that would cause symptoms. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Treatment medication includes antibiotic for cyst, 25mg 3xday meclizine for inner ear, and Midodrine HCL 10mg for dropping blood pressure and 10mg Pregnisone for inner ear inflammation. Patient underwent VNG test had no inner ear inflammation and noticed micro movements of the eye No concomitant medication information were reported Caller wanted to report adverse event. Callers first dose was on 12apr21, LOT#040B21A, Expiration date 10/2/21. Caller said his life has been upside down since he got the shot. First week had intense headache and dizziness. Second week he had muscle aches and dizziness with limited headaches. Third week he is having a focusing and dizziness issue. Caller said he seen doctor and specialist. Caller had MRI and Stress test. Caller said MRI came back clean. Caller said they had a cyst but nothing that would cause symptoms. Caller said Brain scan came back negative. Caller said he was completely heathy. Caller said he also gets motion sickness now since he had the vaccine. Primary care doctor gave antibiotic for cyst. PCP thought had something to do with inner ear, 25mg 3xday meclazine, then the gave Midodrine HCL 10mg for dropping blood pressure. Caller said he got relief for 3 days then he started getting sick. Caller went to ER and they took him off the medicine. Caller when to a ENT doctor. Caller said took VNG test. He was prescribed 10mg Pregnisone for inner ear inflammation. The VNG test proved he didnt have inner ear inflammation. Caller said his symptoms have been going on for 32 days as of yet. CAller said he cant go to restaurants because of dizziness and sickness. Caller said during his VNG test they noticed micro movements of the eye. His ENT thinks this may be causing the dizziness and lack of focus. Caller said he will travel to anywhere to get help.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information regarding detailed medical history and diagnostics will help in assessment.

25 2021-05-31 low platelet count, low blood platelet count thrombocytopenia; ITP; Petechia rash; Tiredness; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (s... Read more
Close
thrombocytopenia; ITP; Petechia rash; Tiredness; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of THROMBOCYTOPENIA (thrombocytopenia) and IMMUNE THROMBOCYTOPENIA (ITP) in a 25-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Anxiety and Stomachache. Concomitant products included LAMOTRIGINE (LAMICTAL) for Anxiety, OMEPRAZOLE (PROTONIX [OMEPRAZOLE]) for Stomach discomfort. On 28-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient experienced RASH (Petechia rash) and FATIGUE (Tiredness). On an unknown date, the patient experienced THROMBOCYTOPENIA (thrombocytopenia) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant) and IMMUNE THROMBOCYTOPENIA (ITP) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant). The patient was treated with IMMUNOGLOBULIN HUMAN NORMAL ongoing since an unknown date at a dose of 1 dosage form. At the time of the report, THROMBOCYTOPENIA (thrombocytopenia), IMMUNE THROMBOCYTOPENIA (ITP), RASH (Petechia rash) and FATIGUE (Tiredness) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. No laboratory details was given. Reportedly, the patient had to go to the hospital for a week and was still being monitored. Treatment information was given as steroids Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 20-May-2021: Follow up information received on 20 May 2021 contain significant information includes updation of 2 more medically significant events and patient was hospitalized for the events too.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding the events has been provided at this time. Further information is not expected.

25 2021-06-07 chest pain, heart attack, chest discomfort, inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: Myocarditis, Type 2 myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) Patient received M... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: Myocarditis, Type 2 myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) Patient received Moderna Covid Vaccine on 3/16/21 and second dose on 4/21/21. Patient presented to the ED on 4/24/21 complaining of acute onset central chest pain/pressure with radiation to jaw, left upper extremity that awoke him from sleep at 05:50 in the morning. After awakening, patient notes the chest pain was approximately 7 or 8/10, had diaphoresis, was anxious with the severity of the symptoms, but symptoms seem to have spontaneously improved and now has only mild 1 to 2/10 central chest pressure, mild discomfort in left arm, but no nausea, vomiting, headache, dizziness, and no recent febrile illness. Patient underwent cardiac cath to rule out SCAD. Cath was clean with no SCAD or CAD. Patient discharged on Aspirin, Metoprolol 12.5 mg QD.
25 2021-06-07 troponin increased, chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, cardiac arrhythmia Vaccinated 5/20/21. Onset of chest pain 5/26/21. Admitted to hospital 5/28/21. Dx of myopericardi... Read more
Close
Vaccinated 5/20/21. Onset of chest pain 5/26/21. Admitted to hospital 5/28/21. Dx of myopericarditis. Treated with bedrest, analgesia, and telemetry monitoring to r/o ventricular arrhythmias. Patient was recovered 5/30/21 and discharged.
25 2021-06-08 excessive bleeding, fainting, loss of consciousness Patient was walking in waiting room, passed out, fell backwards and hit his head on a chair. When I... Read more
Close
Patient was walking in waiting room, passed out, fell backwards and hit his head on a chair. When I came to the waiting room patient was actively seizing and bleeding from a laceration on the posterior part of his scalp. Patient moved from under chair and placed in recovery position. Active seizure time from my arrival was 30 seconds. Patient was minimally responsive and postictal for approximately 5 minutes and diaphoretic. Vital signs taken and oxygen placed on patient. Color returned to normal, and VSS. BS was 108 on glucometer. EMS called and patient transported out of facility. Patient is a 35 yo M with no sig pmhx presenting after syncopal event after receiving his COVID vaccine. Fell from standing, denies dizziness, SOB, CP, or other symptoms prior to the event. He hit the back of his head when he fell. He presented to the ED, at which time he felt very nauseous and per notes he was confused and perseverating. Admitted to the SICU for R frontal IPH and R frontal SDH.
25 2021-06-08 loss of consciousness Patient fell forward in his chair, briefly lost consciousness and started seizing for about 3-4 seco... Read more
Close
Patient fell forward in his chair, briefly lost consciousness and started seizing for about 3-4 seconds. Patient stated he had not eaten all day. Company has an in-house safety/medical team that came over to observe and examine the patient. EMS and fire department arrived as well to further examine patient. He did not want to go to hospital despite EMS recommending it. Patient stated he felt fine as if nothing had happened afterwards.

Chest pain. Hospital found my heart enzymes were at the level of a massive heart attack. The muscle surrounding my heart was enlarged. The levels went back to normal after 24hrs.
25 2021-06-14 palpitations, fibrin d dimer increased, atrial fibrillation Patient received second dose of Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 6/4/21. During this same time, patient a... Read more
Close
Patient received second dose of Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 6/4/21. During this same time, patient also had URI diagnosed as bronchitis at an urgent care and provided albuterol inhaler. Cough and URI symptoms subsided on approximately 6/12/21 but developed SOB, lightheadedness, and palpitations thereafter prompting presentation to ED on 6/15/21. Patient was started on digoxin, heparin, and furosemide by cardiology team. Work up in progress.
25 2021-06-14 palpitations, heart rate abnormal Palpitation; Heart was acting erratically; Numbness on the left side; Puffiness on the left side; Th... Read more
Close
Palpitation; Heart was acting erratically; Numbness on the left side; Puffiness on the left side; This case was received via an unknown source (no reference has been entered for a health authority or license partner) on 04-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 04-Jun-2021. This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of PALPITATIONS (Palpitation), HEART RATE ABNORMAL (Heart was acting erratically), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness on the left side) and SWELLING (Puffiness on the left side) in a 25-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 039B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 01-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 29-May-2021 at 10:00 AM, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 29-May-2021, the patient experienced PALPITATIONS (Palpitation) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HEART RATE ABNORMAL (Heart was acting erratically) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness on the left side) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and SWELLING (Puffiness on the left side) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was treated with LORATADINE, PSEUDOEPHEDRINE HYDROCHLORIDE (BENADRYL 24 D) at a dose of 1once a day; IBUPROFEN (ADVIL 12 HOUR) on 29-May-2021 at a dose of 1 UNK and PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL) from 29-May-2021 to 30-May-2021 at a dose of 1 UNK. At the time of the report, PALPITATIONS (Palpitation), HEART RATE ABNORMAL (Heart was acting erratically), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness on the left side) and SWELLING (Puffiness on the left side) had not resolved. No relevant concomitant medications were provided. The reporter was in contact with physician and also went to emergency room (ER) but they were not able to resolve the problem. The reporter confirmed that these side effects were still going on. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
25 2021-06-14 troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle Vaccinated on Friday AM. Typical fever chills of vaccine about 10 hours later. Pt was taking NSAID... Read more
Close
Vaccinated on Friday AM. Typical fever chills of vaccine about 10 hours later. Pt was taking NSAIDS, and symptoms continued Sat and Sun getting worse Sunday Night. Woke up Monday AM with severe CP 8/10. Came to ER. Found to have Trop HS of 222, EKG changes with diffuse ST elevation, and preserved EF. diagnosis of perimyocarditis and actively recovering. Treated with anti inflammatory medications.
25 2021-06-15 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle The patient presented 3 days after receiving the 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine with chest pain. Initia... Read more
Close
The patient presented 3 days after receiving the 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine with chest pain. Initially, the patient was started on Heparin drip, a beta-blocker, high-intensity statin, and aspirin. Cardiac MRI showed evidence of myocarditis with normal biventricular systolic functions. An echocardiogram showed a normal Ejection fraction with apical hypokinesis. The patient was discharged on aspirin only. In the last follow-up visit, the patient denies any recurrence of chest pain.
25 2021-06-15 chest pain Mild Chest pain began to occur roughly a week after vaccination. Two weeks after vaccination it had ... Read more
Close
Mild Chest pain began to occur roughly a week after vaccination. Two weeks after vaccination it had processed to severe bouts of pain accompanied with dizziness and fatigue. After about a week of severe pain, the pain began to taper off and seemed to move from my chest more into my armpit and arm. A swollen and painful lymph node occurred in my left armpit roughly 2 weeks after severe pain had started. The lymph node is currently still swollen but it's getting mildly better. Chest pain is not entirely gone but it's also getting better slowly.
25 2021-06-17 fainting Patient became dizzy/loss coordination and collapsed after completing 15 minute observation period. ... Read more
Close
Patient became dizzy/loss coordination and collapsed after completing 15 minute observation period. He was able to stand back up and walk to a chair with assistance from family members. At the immediate time of him sitting down after fall, he was unresponsive when asked his name. Approximately 5 minutes after initiation of episode he began to communicate and regain responsiveness but stated he continued to feel dizzy, sweaty, and had some difficulty breathing. At this time EMS arrived on the scene and took over the care of the patient.
25 2021-06-18 fibrin d dimer increased, chest pain Patient reported brief chest pain events starting day after Moderna COVID vaccine. They decreased o... Read more
Close
Patient reported brief chest pain events starting day after Moderna COVID vaccine. They decreased over time. I saw him in clinic 11 days later - but were mildly present. I obtained a D-Dimer which was positive. He was referred to the ER.
